title: Multivariate Analysis for the Classification of Chocolate According to its Percentage of Cocoa by Using Terahertz Time-Domain Spectroscopy (THz-TDS)
summary: This paper explores the use of terahertz time-domain spectroscopy (THz-TDS) for classifying chocolate according to its cocoa percentage. The authors employ multivariate analysis and machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines (SVM), to achieve a high accuracy rate of 93%. This study demonstrates the potential of THz-TDS in the food industry for non-destructive inspection and quality control.

title: Crop Modeling with Less Data: The FAO Model for Soybean Yield Estimation
summary: This paper presents a low-input methodology for soybean yield estimation using the FAO-33 model and agroecological zone approach. The study combines indirect data with climate information from ECMWF to estimate yields, achieving reasonable accuracy.

title: Assessment of Flood Susceptibility Using Support Vector Machine in the Belt and Road Region
summary: This paper assesses flood susceptibility using a support vector machine (SVM) model in the Belt and Road region. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results reveal that Southeast Asia is most susceptible to flooding. The study introduces the flood susceptibility comprehensive index (FSCI) to quantify the flood susceptibility levels of countries and sub-regions.
statisticalMethods: The study uses statistical methods to analyze the relationship between flood susceptibility and various factors. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results are evaluated using metrics such as accuracy and AUC values.

title: Classification of Sidr honey and detection of sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics
summary: This paper presents a method for classifying Sidr honey and detecting sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics. The authors employed machine-assisted classification using the bagging algorithm, achieving high accuracy in discriminating between Sidr, sugar, and mixed Sidr-sugar samples.

title: An extensive dataset for successful recognition of fresh and rotten fruits
summary: This paper presents a large-scale dataset for the classification of fresh and rotten fruits, which is crucial for agricultural productions and fruit processing industries. The dataset contains 16 types of fruit classes with 3200 original images and 12,335 augmented images, making it an essential resource for researchers to develop effective algorithms for recognizing more variety of fruits.
statisticalMethods: Histogram Equalization is another approach that was used to improve image contrast.

title: Assessment of in Vitro Pollen Germination and Pollen Tube Growth of Annona Cherimola Mill
summary: This paper assesses the in vitro pollen germination and growth of nine ecotypes and one cultivar of Annona cherimola Mill. The study evaluates the percentage of pollen germination and length of pollen tubes after 2 and 24 hours of incubation, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods used.

title: Evaluation of Five Gas Diffusion Models Used in the Gradient Method for Estimating CO 2 Flux with Changing Soil Properties
summary: This paper evaluates the applicability of five commonly used gas diffusion models in estimating soil CO 2 flux using the gradient method. The study assesses the effects of changing soil properties on the accuracy of these models and compares their performance with a reference method.

title: Violence Detection in Ranches Using Computer Vision and Convolution Neural Network
summary: This paper proposes a violence detection system using computer vision and convolutional neural networks to detect animal fights in ranches, reducing the need for close supervision and monitoring. The system uses machine learning models to identify fights and alert ranchers, with an accuracy of up to 93%.

title: The Factors Influencing Market Price Of Sago Starch In Meranti Islands By Linear Regression
summary: This paper investigates the factors influencing market price of sago starch in Meranti Islands using linear regression. The study finds that the number of sago farmers, annual production, and area of sago land significantly impact the market price. Linear regression is used to analyze the relationship between variables, providing a graphical visualization of the distribution of data.

title: Image Processing Technology Based on Internet of Things in Intelligent Pig Breeding
summary: This paper explores the application of image processing technology based on the Internet of Things in intelligent pig breeding. The authors use image processing to monitor and manage pig growth environment, health, diet, and other aspects, significantly improving production efficiency and reducing labor costs.

title: Recent Advances in Novel Packaging Technologies for Shelf-Life Extension of Guava Fruits
summary: This review discusses the physiology, mechanism of ripening, oxidation, and ethylene production of guava fruits. It also reviews recent developments in packaging technologies such as modified atmosphere packaging (MAP), controlled atmosphere packaging (CAP), and edible films or coatings for extending shelf life.

title: Effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails
summary: This paper investigates the effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails. The study found that in ovo injection of Spirulina platensis improved hatchability, antioxidant, and immunity-related gene expression in quail chicks.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods used include analysis of variance (ANOVA) and real-time PCR to evaluate gene expression.

title: Deep Learning Techniques for In-Crop Weed Identification: A Review
summary: This paper reviews recent developments of deep learning techniques in image-based weed detection, highlighting the potential for accurate and efficient weed control. The review discusses various deep learning architectures, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and graph neural networks (GNNs), and their applications in weed identification.

title: Classification Modeling Method for Near-Infrared Spectroscopy of Tobacco Based on Multimodal Convolution Neural Networks
summary: This paper presents a method for identifying the origin of tobacco using near-infrared spectroscopy and multimodal convolutional neural networks. The proposed approach improves the accuracy of tobacco origin classification by leveraging the strong feature extraction ability of CNNs.

title: Using Artificial Neural Networks and Remotely Sensed Data to Evaluate the Relative Importance of Variables for Prediction of Within-Field Corn and Soybean Yields
summary: This paper uses artificial neural networks (ANN) to predict within-field corn and soybean yields, leveraging remotely sensed data from satellite images. The study evaluates the relative importance of various predictor variables and identifies the most significant ones for each crop type.
statisticalMethods: The study reports on the performance of the ANN models using metrics such as mean absolute error (MAE) and relative MAE.

title: Hyperspectral Spectroscopic Study of Soil Properties- A Review
summary: This paper reviews the use of hyperspectral spectroscopy for estimating soil properties, highlighting its potential as an alternative to traditional laboratory methods. However, machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this review.

title: Faba Bean: An Untapped Source of Quality Plant Proteins and Bioactives
summary: This paper provides a comprehensive review of the nutritional and biofunctional qualities of faba beans, with a particular focus on protein-derived bioactive peptides. The study highlights the potential of faba beans as a sustainable and quality dietary protein source due to their high protein content, well-balanced amino acid profile, and presence of health-enhancing bioactive compounds.

title: Prediction of active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements and artificial neural network
summary: This paper uses an artificial neural network to predict the active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements, expanding the application of artificial neural network methods in medicinal botany and providing references for its application in other directions.

title: Storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture as affected by various formulations of drying medium, and its fermentation characteristics in mung bean (Vigna radiata L.) slurry
summary: This paper investigates the storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture using various formulations of drying medium, including mung bean powder with sucrose and trehalose. The study aims to evaluate the influence of these protective agents on the survival of L. plantarum S20 during freeze-drying and subsequent storage. The results show that supplementing mung bean powder with either sucrose or trehalose improves the survival of freeze-dried L. plantarum S20, but no significant difference was observed between the two disaccharides.

title: Imaging of plant current pathways for non-invasive root Phenotyping using a newly developed electrical current source density approach
summary: This paper presents a new method for non-invasive root phenotyping using an electrical current source density approach. The method, called inversion of Current Source Density (iCSD), images the positions where the current passes from the plant to the soil by measuring the distribution of the electric potential. The authors develop and test an iCSD inversion code that does not rely on prior assumptions on root architecture and function, and design and conduct rhizotron experiments to validate the approach.

title: A Surrogate Modeling Approach for the Development of Biorefineries
summary: This paper introduces a generic approach to develop surrogate models for biorefining processes by integrating first-principle knowledge. The proposed methodology is applied to a real-life lignocellulosic organosolv technology, and three case studies demonstrate its potential.

title: Strategic Priorities of the Scientific Plan of the European Research Infrastructure METROFOOD-RI for Promoting Metrology in Food and Nutrition
summary: This paper discusses the strategic priorities of the METROFOOD-RI, a pan-European research infrastructure for promoting metrology in food and nutrition. The paper outlines the key thematic areas of research in the food and nutrition domain, including sustainability, traceability, and FAIR data management practices.

title: Optimization of cardamom fruit extraction using the Box–Behnken design
summary: This paper focuses on optimizing cardamom fruit extraction using the Box-Behnken design to recover polyphenolic compounds. The study aims to identify optimal conditions for solvent ratio, ethanol concentration, and extraction time to yield total phenolic content, total flavonoids, and antioxidant activity.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods such as Folin-Ciocalteu, aluminum chloride, glacial acetic acid, proanalytical ethanol, and microplate reader are used to analyze total phenolic content, total flavonoid content, and antioxidant activity.

title: Spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs of multiple ecosystem services based on land use changes in Zengcheng, China
summary: This paper assesses the spatiotemporal effects of urbanization on multiple ecosystem services in Zengcheng, China. The study uses land use classification and raster maps to detect past changes in land use types, and evaluates the trade-offs among different ecosystem services.

title: Authentication of Peaberry and Civet Coffee Using UV-Visible Spectroscopy and PLS-DA Method
summary: This paper investigates the influence of particle size on the authentication of peaberry and civet coffee using UV-visible spectroscopy combined with partial least squares-discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) method. The study finds that particle size significantly affects the performance of PLS-DA model, but a calibration model can be developed to compensate for this influence.

title: Signaling Pathway Activities Improve Prognosis for Breast Cancer
summary: This paper demonstrates that pathway-level features, such as signaling circuit activities, outperform conventional gene-level features in breast cancer prognosis. The authors use the canonical circuit activity analysis method to recode gene expression values into measurements of signaling circuit activities, which can be used as multigenic mechanistic biomarkers for cancer prognosis.
statisticalMethods: trimmed mean of M-values normalization method (TMM)

title: The HSP40 chaperone Ydj1 drives amyloid beta 42 toxicity
summary: This paper investigates the role of the HSP40 chaperone Ydj1 in driving amyloid beta 42 toxicity. The authors use a combinatory genetic and proteomic approach in yeast models to identify Ydj1 as a crucial factor in Abeta42-mediated cell death. However, the study's findings are limited by the use of episomal plasmids, which makes it difficult to interpret the results.

title: Roles of Primary Cilia in the Developing Brain
summary: This paper reviews recent advances in understanding the interactions between primary cilia and signaling pathways essential for cellular homeostasis and brain development. Primary cilia play central roles in transducing or regulating several signaling pathways, including Sonic hedgehog (Shh) and Wnt signaling.

title: Dynamic regulation of canonical TGFβ signalling by endothelial transcription factor ERG protects from liver fibrogenesis
summary: This paper investigates the role of the endothelial transcription factor ERG in regulating canonical TGFβ signalling to protect from liver fibrogenesis. The study shows that ERG maintains homoeostatic balance by promoting SMAD1 pathway while repressing SMAD2/3 activity, and its loss leads to spontaneous EndMT and tissue fibrogenesis.

title: Genetic Determinants Highlight the Existence of Shared Etiopathogenetic Mechanisms Characterizing Age-Related Macular Degeneration and Neurodegenerative Disorders
summary: This paper explores the genetic determinants associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and their potential relationship with neurodegenerative disorders (NDDs). The study found that certain genetic variants are shared between AMD and NDDs, suggesting a common etiopathogenetic mechanism. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods were not used in this study.
statisticalMethods: Statistical analysis was performed to reveal the association between SNPs and AMD risk.

title: Fine Tuning of an Oxidative Stress Model with Sodium Iodate Revealed Protective Effect of NF-κB Inhibition and Sex-Specific Difference in Susceptibility of the Retinal Pigment Epithelium
summary: This paper investigates the effects of sodium iodate on retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells in mice, with a focus on NF-κB inhibition and sex-specific differences. The study uses a morphometric method to quantify RPE damage caused by NaIO3-induced oxidative stress.
statisticalMethods: one-way ANOVA, Student's t test, simple linear regression model

title: Microvascular dysfunction in COVID-19: the MYSTIC study
summary: This paper investigates microvascular alterations in patients with COVID-19, using a prospective, observational, cross-sectional study to quantify endothelial glycocalyx dimensions and circulating markers of endothelial dysfunction. The results show severe alterations of the microcirculation and endothelial glycocalyx in patients with COVID-19, highlighting the importance of systemic vascular involvement in the disease.
statisticalMethods: non-parametric Mann-Whitney U test and chi-square test

title: Developmental Emergence of Sparse Coding: A Dynamic Systems Approach
summary: This paper presents a dynamic systems modeling study that provides mechanistic insights into the sparsification phenomenon in developing neural networks. The authors use system dynamics methods to model the development of neural networks from before to after eye-opening, and demonstrate how specific developmental changes in neuronal and synaptic parameters drive sparsification. They reveal how these changes refine the information processing capabilities of an in vivo developing network, mainly by showing a developmental reduction in the instability of network's firing activity.

title: Protein kinase A inhibition induces EPAC-dependent acrosomal exocytosis in human sperm
summary: This paper investigates the role of cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP)-dependent processes on acrosomal exocytosis in human sperm. The authors found that inhibition of protein kinase A (PKA) at the end of capacitation induced EPAC-dependent acrosomal exocytosis, with a 50% increase in intracellular cAMP levels.
statisticalMethods: analysis of variance (ANOVA) followed by Tukey's honestly significant difference (HSD) comparison

title: Drug–target interaction prediction via multiple classification strategies
summary: This paper proposes a new drug-target interaction (DTI) prediction method, MCSDTI, which uses multiple classification strategies to predict interactions for targets with larger numbers of interactions and those with smaller numbers of interactions. The method is shown to be competitive compared to previous methods on most datasets.
statisticalMethods: AUCs are compared between the proposed method and previous methods on various datasets.

title: miRNA Targets: From Prediction Tools to Experimental Validation
summary: This review discusses the key strategies for miRNA target identification, including computational prediction and experimental validation. Machine Learning methods are used to predict potential targets of miRNAs, with a focus on thermodynamic stability and sequence conservation.

title: Transcriptional Differences for COVID-19 Disease Map Genes between Males and Females Indicate a Different Basal Immunophenotype Relevant to the Disease
summary: This paper presents DeCovid, a Shiny app for exploring basal expression level differences between two demographic risk factors, age and sex, for the COVID-19 Disease Map and COVID-19 related pathway genes expressed at several human tissues. The authors used data from the GTEx database to study basal expression differences in COVID-19 associated genes between different demographic groups, identifying a similar immunological state prevalent in young people and women, which is different than that found in men and old people.

title: Phosphatidylserine synthase 2 and phosphatidylserine decarboxylase are essential for aminophospholipid synthesis in T rypanosoma brucei
summary: This paper investigates the role of phosphatidylserine synthase 2 (TbPSS2) and phosphatidylserine decarboxylase (TbPSD) in aminophospholipid synthesis in Trypanosoma brucei. The study reveals that TbPSS2 is essential for normal growth of T. brucei, while down-regulation of TbPSD affects mitochondrial integrity and ATP production.

title: Aquaculture State, Challenges and Technologies in the Middle East
summary: This review paper discusses the current state of aquaculture in the Middle East, highlighting its challenges, technologies, and future prospects. The paper emphasizes the importance of aquaculture for food security and economic growth, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Deep longitudinal phenotyping of wearable sensor data reveals independent markers of longevity, stress, and resilience
summary: This paper presents a deep learning-based approach to predict biological age acceleration (BAA) from wearable sensor data. The GeroSense system, a deep artificial neural network, extracts health-associated features from physical activity recordings and predicts BAA with high accuracy. The model's output is a single dynamic variable closely related to BAA, which can be used as a biomarker of aging in humans.
statisticalMethods: log-linear proportional hazards models, logistic regression

title: Dysfunctional Vascular Endothelium as a Driver of Atherosclerosis: Emerging Insights Into Pathogenesis and Treatment
summary: This review paper examines the role of the vascular endothelium in atherosclerosis, highlighting its involvement in directing site-specificity of plaque formation and governing plaque progression through intracellular processes. The authors discuss emerging evidence that implicates the activated endothelium as a driver of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.

title: The Alteration of Intrinsic Excitability and Synaptic Transmission in Lumbar Spinal Motor Neurons and Interneurons of Severe Spinal Muscular Atrophy Mice
summary: This paper investigates the intrinsic excitability and synaptic transmission in lumbar spinal motor neurons and interneurons of severe spinal muscular atrophy mice. The study found increased excitability and synaptic abnormality in both types of neurons, suggesting a compensatory adjustment occurring in SMA.

title: An Integrated Transcriptomic and Proteomic Analysis Identifies Significant Novel Pathways for Henoch-Schönlein Purpura Nephritis Progression
summary: This study integrates transcriptomic and proteomic analyses to explore the underlying mechanism of Henoch-Schönlein purpura nephritis (HSPN) progression. Although machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not explicitly used, the study employs advanced statistical methods and pathway enrichment analysis to identify significant novel pathways associated with HSPN progression.

title: RPamide Neuropeptides NLP-22 and NLP-2 Act Through GnRH-like Receptors to Promote Sleep and Wakefulness in C. elegans
summary: This paper investigates the role of RPamide neuropeptides NLP-22 and NLP-2 in regulating sleep and wakefulness in C. elegans. The authors identify two opposing neuropeptide/receptor signaling pathways: NLP-22 promotes behavioral quiescence, whereas NLP-2 promotes movement during lethargus, by signaling through gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) related receptors. The study demonstrates that GNRR-6 is a receptor for NLP-22 in the regulation of body movement and that NLP-2 peptides promote wakefulness during L4 lethargus.
statisticalMethods: The authors used statistical methods to analyze the data from their in vitro and in vivo experiments. They used EC50 values to quantify the potency of various peptides in activating GnRH/AKH-like receptors, and they also performed statistical tests to compare the effects of NLP-22 and NLP-2 overexpression on locomotion quiescence.

title: Small ORFs as New Regulators of Pri-miRNAs and miRNAs Expression in Human and Drosophila
summary: This paper investigates the role of small open reading frames (smORFs) in regulating pri-miRNA and miRNA expression in human and Drosophila. The study finds that smORFs can act as cis-regulatory elements, influencing the levels and activity of mature miRNAs.

title: A 19-miRNA Support Vector Machine classifier and a 6-miRNA risk score system designed for ovarian cancer patients
summary: This paper presents a machine learning approach to predict the recurrence of ovarian cancer using a Support Vector Machine classifier and a risk score system based on 19 miRNAs. The study aims to improve prognosis and treatment outcomes for ovarian cancer patients by identifying potential biomarkers.
statisticalMethods: univariate and multivariate Cox regression analysis

title: Assessment of Mutation Susceptibility in DNA Sequences with Word Vectors
summary: This paper assesses the susceptibility of DNA sequences to mutations using word vectors. The authors apply the dna2vec method, a word embedding approach inspired by Word2Vec, to reveal semantic and syntactic relationships between k-mers in human and mouse genomes. They find a correlation between mutation counts and cosine similarity, suggesting that vector embeddings can predict mutations in genomes.

title: Immune Literacy: Reading, Writing, and Editing Adaptive Immunity
summary: This review highlights state-of-the-art methods in systems and synthetic biology for understanding adaptive immunity. It showcases novel approaches that integrate immune repertoire sequencing, immunoinformatics, and immunogenomic engineering to reprogram immune responses for translational medicine.

title: Data-driven translational prostate cancer research: from biomarker discovery to clinical decision
summary: This paper reviews the current state of data-driven translational prostate cancer research, focusing on the integration of big data and artificial intelligence to improve clinical decision-making. The authors discuss the heterogeneity and complexity of prostate cancer development and evolution, as well as the role of systems medicine in precision healthcare.

title: PD-1 Blockade Aggravates Epstein–Barr Virus+ Post-Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder in Humanized Mice Resulting in Central Nervous System Involvement and CD4+ T Cell Dysregulations
summary: This paper investigates the effects of PD-1 blockade on post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) in humanized mice. The study found that PD-1 blockade aggravated PTLD and central nervous system involvement, leading to CD4+ T cell dysregulations.

title: Efficiency of Human Resource Management in Industrial Automation Enterprises with Prospects of Innovative Susceptibility
summary: This paper examines the efficiency of human resource management in industrial automation enterprises, focusing on innovative susceptibility. It compares HRMS development levels in global companies and Ukrainian enterprises, aiming to form a strategy for HRMS development and increase innovative susceptibility.

title: Financial journalism in today’s high-frequency news and information era
summary: This study examines the role of financial journalists in today's high-frequency news and information era, assessing their watchdog function, production processes of financial news, and impact on the stock market. The research finds a discrepancy between ideal and actual roles of financial journalists, with limited influence on driving stock market prices.

title: Ethical Challenges and Countermeasures of Autonomous Vehicles
summary: This paper explores the ethical challenges and countermeasures of autonomous vehicles, discussing the conflicts in bioethical standards and ownership of accident responsibility. The authors analyze the domestic and foreign intelligent vehicle market, listing and analyzing legal and countermeasures of ethical dilemmas in various countries.

title: Wearable Technology and Health: A Bibliometric Analysis
summary: This paper performs a bibliometric analysis of the growth of wearable technology and health publications between 2000 and 2017, using Scopus data and SciMAT software. The study finds an increasing trend in publications on this topic, with a focus on monitoring systems, devices, and algorithms.

title: Attempts to Attract Eyesight in E-Commerce May Have Negative Effects
summary: This paper examines the effects of different ways of highlighting products on user attention and perception. The study found that while attempts to attract user attention may have negative effects, a low-intensity background highlight is the most effective solution.

title: Industry Cluster Innovation Upgrading and Knowledge Evolution: A Simulation Analysis Based on Small-World Networks
summary: This paper examines the innovation and knowledge evolution of industry clusters through a simulation analysis. It focuses on the effects of hub firms and network member interactions on cluster upgrading, using two patterns of knowledge learning and innovation: STI (science, technology, and innovation) and DUI (doing, using, and interacting). The study finds that hub enterprises' influence on cluster evolution is crucial, but knowledge absorption problems among members can weaken innovation performance.

title: What is Research Rigor? Lessons for a Transdiscipline
summary: This paper explores the concept of research rigor, its definition, and application across various disciplines. The authors analyze 62 articles on rigor in social science research, identifying different definitions and relationships between rigor and relevance. They conclude by proposing a framework for defining rigor that supports transdisciplinary research.

title: Performance in the Workplace: a Critical Evaluation of Cognitive Enhancement
summary: This paper critically evaluates the impact of AI technologies on work organizations, arguing that recent research focuses on developing accurate and precise performance models to predict patterns of behavior. The authors propose that cognitive load measurement will shape human performance in manufacturing systems, leading to a reorganization of work and social relations.

title: Influence of Artificial Intelligence in Civil Engineering toward Sustainable Development—A Systematic Literature Review
summary: This paper presents a systematic literature review to explore the influence of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in civil engineering toward sustainable development. The study found that AI has provided various benefits and opportunities, including data collection, sustainable assessment, and productivity. The trend of construction is diverted toward sustainability with the aid of digital technologies.

title: Gamifying the Gig: Transitioning the Dark Side to Bright Side of Online Engagement
summary: This paper investigates digital platform gig work dropouts through the moderating impact of gamified interventions on online platforms. The study applies social exchange theory and self-determination theory to understand gig workers' motivation, with a focus on how gamification can control their intentions to quit.

title: Impact of Industry 4.0 and Lean Manufacturing on the Sustainability Performance of Plastic and Petrochemical Organizations in Saudi Arabia
summary: This paper explores the impact of Industry 4.0 technologies and lean manufacturing on the sustainability performance of plastic and petrochemical organizations in Saudi Arabia. While the study finds a positive relationship between these technologies and sustainability, it does not explicitly mention the use of machine learning or AI methods.

title: Structural uncertainty and uncertainty management in four common Land Use Cover Change (LUCC) model software packages
summary: This paper compares the structural uncertainty of four common LUCC model software packages, CA_Markov, Dinamica EGO, Land Change Modeler, and Metronamica. The authors aim to fill a research gap by characterizing the overall structural uncertainty of these models, which is essential for planning agents and real-world problem-solving.
statisticalMethods: Pearson correlation coefficient, Kappa Simulation (Ksim), and spatial metrics

title: Collaboratively Optimizing Power Scheduling and Mitigating Congestion using Local Pricing in a Receding Horizon Market
summary: This paper presents a distributed, hierarchical market-based approach to solve the economic dispatch problem. The method requires minimal information sharing and uses local pricing differences to mitigate congestion. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.

title: Predicting Stock Price Trend Using MACD Optimized by Historical Volatility
summary: This paper proposes an improved stock price forecasting model using a new technical indicator called MACD-HVIX, which is optimized by historical volatility. The model outperforms traditional MACD in terms of accuracy and stability, making it useful for trading.

title: The psychosocial antecedents of the adherence to the Mediterranean diet
summary: This paper investigates the psychosocial factors influencing people's intention to adhere to the Mediterranean Diet. The study proposes and tests an integrated theoretical model, considering rational, social, emotional, motivational, and behavioral antecedents. The results confirm the plausibility of the proposed model, with perceived behavioral control being the strongest predictor of intention.

title: Longevity Foundation: Perspective on Decentralized Autonomous Organization for Special-Purpose Financing
summary: This paper presents a perspective on decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) for special-purpose financing, considering longevity as a model example. While the paper discusses modern technologies and blockchain-based smart contracts, it does not explicitly mention or utilize machine learning (ML)/artificial intelligence (AI) methods.

title: Smart Companies: Company & board members liability in the age of AI
summary: This paper examines how artificial intelligence (AI) can be used to augment the decision-making process of the board of directors in companies, and proposes a change in the corporate governance paradigm for Smart Companies. The authors argue that AI will become an integral part of the boardroom in the next years, and propose adaptations to the current accountability mechanisms when AI is used in the decision-making process.

title: Seafarers high quality training provision by means of VR technologies in the context of maritime transport sustainability
summary: This paper explores the use of virtual reality (VR) technologies to improve seafarers' environmental awareness and competence in maritime transport sustainability. The study aims to form ecological consciousness of future seafarers using educational VR technologies, highlighting the importance of human interaction with the sea and the need for proper training.

title: Exploring the Relevance of Intangible Assets and Capital Structure
summary: This paper explores the role of intangible assets in company financing, examining their impact on capital structure and potential as collateral for loans. The study finds that intangible assets have significant positive correlation with a company's capital structure, indicating they can be used as an additional financing tool.

title: Applying Research-Based Teaching Strategies in a Biomedical Engineering Programming Course
summary: This paper explores the application of research-based teaching strategies in a biomedical engineering programming course. The authors detail their four-week module, which combined traditional lectures with project-based learning (PBL) and scaffolding to promote student engagement and learning. While machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly mentioned, the focus on PBL and scaffolding suggests an emphasis on student-centered learning and instructor facilitation.

title: CEO Exposure, Media Influence, and Stock Returns
summary: This paper explores the role of CEO media behavior on the relationship between media content and stock markets. The authors use daily frequency data for a sample of Chinese stocks to show that higher CEO media exposure attenuates the media effect on stock markets, especially consumer-related stocks.

title: Semi-Static and Sparse Variance-Optimal Hedging
summary: This paper focuses on hedging of a contingent claim by a 'semi-static' strategy composed of a dynamic position in one asset and static positions in other assets. The authors develop methods for variance-optimality and provide tractable formulas using Fourier-integration in the Heston model, but do not utilize machine learning or AI techniques.

title: A Cubic Regression Model to Measure the Impact of Accidents on Traffic Incidences in Kuwait
summary: This paper aims to study the annual total number of traffic incidences in relation to the total annual number of traffic accidents in Kuwait. A cubic regression model was specified and estimation was done using the least square estimation (LS) method, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Modern Design Methodologies and the Development of Mechatronic Products
summary: This paper discusses modern design methodologies for mechatronic product development, focusing on the integration of Design Thinking, Concurrent Engineering, and Agilism. The authors explore various design processes, including the VDI 2206 standard, and propose new approaches to address challenges in mechatronics design.

title: How Small Consultancies Grow: Challenging Problem-Based Theorising
summary: This paper examines the growth of small management consultancies, challenging problem-based theorizing. It identifies five common barriers to growth and how they were overcome by founders who sold their companies. The study finds no evidence to support the 'problem-based' theory of growth for small professional service firms.

title: Effect of Granulation Methods on Drug Release Studies in Sustained Release Matrix Tablets of a Poorly Soluble Drug prepared using Synthetic Polymers
summary: This paper investigates the effect of granulation methods on drug release in sustained release matrix tablets of a poorly soluble drug. The study uses synthetic polymers and evaluates various compression techniques to optimize tablet formulation.

title: Novel 3′-Substituted-1′,2′,4′-Oxadiazole Derivatives of 18βH-Glycyrrhetinic Acid and Their O-Acylated Amidoximes
summary: This paper presents the synthesis and evaluation of novel glycyrrhetinic acid derivatives containing 3′-(alkyl/phenyl/pyridin(-2″, -3″, and -4″)-yl)-1′,2′,4′-oxadiazole moieties at the C-30 position. The compounds were synthesized using a condensation reaction between triterpenoid's carboxyl group and amidoximes, followed by cyclization. The cytotoxicity of these derivatives was evaluated in various cell lines, showing improved antiproliferative activity compared to the parent compound.

title: High-Throughput Computational Studies in Catalysis and Materials Research
summary: This paper reviews high-throughput computational studies for new materials and catalysts, highlighting the impact of automation and data science tools on rational design and discovery. The authors emphasize the efficiency of virtual high-throughput screening (HTPS) in searching for materials with tailored properties, leveraging open-source codes and large computational resources.

title: Sorbent Based on Polyvinyl Butyral and Potassium Polytitanate for Purifying Wastewater from Heavy Metal Ions
summary: This paper presents a novel composite sorbent based on polyvinyl butyral and potassium polytitanate for purifying wastewater from heavy metal ions. The study focuses on the development of a cost-effective method for wastewater treatment, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Fluorescence Lifetime Imaging Microscopy: Fundamentals and Advances
summary: This paper provides an overview of fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy (FLIM) principles, instrumentation, and analysis. FLIM is a powerful technique for distinguishing the unique molecular environment of fluorophores, but it does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Simulation of Coke Quality Indicators Using Artificial Neural Network
summary: This paper explores the application of artificial neural networks to model coke quality indicators, specifically Coke Reactivity Index (CRI) and Coke Strength after Reaction (CSR). The authors use a two-layer neural network with optimization methods to train the network and achieve accurate predictions.

title: Experimental Investigation of the Impact of CO, C2H6, and H2 on the Explosion Characteristics of CH4
summary: This paper investigates the explosion characteristics of methane in coal mines by experimentally studying the effect of multicomponent flammable gases, including CO, C2H6, and H2. The results show that the presence of these gases increases the explosion pressure and rate of pressure rise, making the explosions more dangerous and destructive.

title: Simultaneous Quantification of Five Lignans from Schisandra chinensis in Various Tissues of Rats
summary: This paper presents a rapid and sensitive high-performance liquid chromatography – electrospray ionization – tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC – ESI – MS/MS) method for the simultaneous quantification of five lignans from Schisandra chinensis in various tissues of rats. The study focuses on the tissue distribution of these lignans, which are known to have antihepatotoxic effects.

title: Next Steps for Access to Safe, Secure DNA Synthesis
summary: This paper discusses the need for continued improvement in biosecurity safety nets provided by DNA synthesis order screening. The authors propose regular red teaming as a means to assess evolving risk of vulnerabilities in screening systems, and suggest that this approach can also serve as effective regression tests during software development.

title: Self-propelling Microdroplets Generated and Sustained by Liquid-liquid Phase Separation in Confined Spaces
summary: This paper explores the phenomenon of self-propelling microdroplets generated through liquid-liquid phase separation in confined spaces. The authors reveal an effective pathway for rapid transport of microdroplets, which is driven by concentration gradients and interfacial energy.

title: Dermacozine N, a Novel Linear Pentacyclic Oxazinophenazine with Near Infrared Absorption Maxima
summary: This paper reports the isolation and structure elucidation of dermacozine N, a novel linear pentacyclic oxazinophenazine with near infrared absorption maxima. The compound was isolated from the Mariana Trench sediment strain Dermacoccus abyssi MT 1.1T and its structure was determined using a combination of NMR, MS, and UV-Vis spectroscopy.

title: Application of Raman Spectroscopic Methods in Food Safety: A Review
summary: This review paper discusses the application of Raman spectroscopic methods for food safety detection, highlighting their non-destructive, rapid, and sensitive nature. The authors summarize recent developments in Raman spectroscopy, including micro-Raman spectroscopy, Raman imaging, and surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS), and discuss their potential applications in detecting biological, chemical, and physical contaminants in foods.

title: Base‐free Oxidative Esterification of HMF over AuPd/nNiO‐TiO2
summary: This paper investigates the catalytic performance of Au, Pd and AuPd NPs on nNiO, TiO2 and mixed nNiO-TiO2 supports in the base-free oxidative esterification of HMF. The study aims to unveil the synergistic effects deriving from the Au-Pd alloy formation and from metal-support interactions.

title: Automated Optimisation of Coarse-Grained Force Fields Using Free Energy Data
summary: This paper presents an automated approach for optimising coarse-grained force fields by reproducing free energy gradients derived from atomistic simulations. The method is implemented in the ForceBalance software and applied to optimise the SIRAH CG protein force field using atomistic hydration free energy data, resulting in improved solvation free energies.

title: In situ sensors for flow reactors – a review
summary: This paper reviews the state of in situ sensors for flow reactors, highlighting their importance in optimizing controllable variables and enabling real-time measurements. While machine-learning and artificial intelligence tools are mentioned as potential future applications, they do not play a central role in the current methodology.

title: First synthetic report and antioxidant potential of natural product (±)-5,7-dihydroxy-8-methyl-3-(2',4'-dihydroxybenzyl)chroman-4-one from Chinese medicine Gan Luo Xin pill
summary: This paper presents the first synthetic route for a natural product, (±)-5,7-dihydroxy-8-methyl-3-(2',4'-dihydroxybenzyl)chroman-4-one, from Chinese medicine Gan Luo Xin pill. The synthesis involves 9 steps with readily available reagents and is significant in enhancing the availability of natural products throughout the year.

title: De novo creation of a naked eye–detectable fluorescent molecule based on quantum chemical computation and machine learning
summary: This paper presents the de novo design of a fluorescent molecule using a combination of quantum chemical computation and machine learning. The authors used a random forest regression model in scikit-learn to predict molecular properties, achieving 75% accuracy in designing fluorescent molecules.

title: Deep Batch Active Learning by Diverse, Uncertain Gradient Lower Bounds
summary: This paper presents a new algorithm for batch active learning with deep neural network models. BADGE (Batch Active Learning by Diverse Gradient Embeddings) samples groups of points that are disparate and high-magnitude when represented in a hallucinated gradient space, trading off between diversity and uncertainty without requiring any hand-tuned hyperparameters.
statisticalMethods: Proposition 1 shows that the norm of the gradient embedding is a lower bound on the norm of the loss gradient induced by the example with true label y with respect to the weights in the last layer.

title: AIM 2020 Challenge on Video Extreme Super-Resolution: Methods and Results
summary: This paper reviews the video extreme super-resolution challenge associated with the AIM 2020 workshop at ECCV 2020. The challenge focuses on upscaling videos with an extreme factor of 16, which results in more serious degradations that also affect the structural integrity of the videos. The paper discusses various methods for addressing this challenging task, including deep learning-based approaches and recurrent neural networks.

title: Non-Parametric Variational Inference with Graph Convolutional Networks for Gaussian Processes
summary: This paper proposes a novel approach to variational inference for Gaussian processes, leveraging graph convolutional networks to efficiently approximate the posterior distribution. The method significantly speeds up inference and often achieves more accurate results than previous methods.

title: The Microsoft 2017 Conversational Speech Recognition System
summary: This paper presents an updated version of the Microsoft conversational speech recognition system, which achieves a word error rate of 5.1% on the Switchboard evaluation set. The system combines recent developments in neural-network-based acoustic and language modeling to advance the state-of-the-art. Machine learning plays a central role in the methodology, with the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), bidirectional long short-term memory (BLSTM) models, and sequence training.
statisticalMethods: Maximum mutual information (MMI) as the discriminative objective function

title: Steady-State Planning in Expected Reward Multichain MDPs
summary: This paper explores the steady-state planning problem, which involves deriving decision-making policies for agents that satisfy constraints on their steady-state behavior. The authors propose a linear programming solution for multichain Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and prove that optimal solutions yield stationary policies with rigorous guarantees of behavior.

title: Recursive-NeRF: An Efficient and Dynamically Growing NeRF
summary: This paper presents Recursive-NeRF, a novel method for efficient and adaptive rendering of scenes using Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF). By recursively growing neural networks based on the complexity of the scene, Recursive-NeRF achieves significant gains in speed while providing high-quality view synthesis. The approach is complementary to existing methods such as NSVF and can be combined for further speed improvements.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods for rendering and training neural networks, including hierarchical volume sampling and importance sampling.

title: Fast IP Hopping Protocol SDI Implementation
summary: This paper proposes a new approach to protect against Distributed Denial of Service attacks and traffic eavesdropping in TCP/IP networks. The method, called IP Fast Hopping, introduces a dynamic mapping of server's address on a large set of temporary addresses, hiding the physical location of protected servers from unauthorized clients.

title: From Data Acquisition to Data Fusion: A Comprehensive Review and a Roadmap for the Identification of Activities of Daily Living Using Mobile Devices
summary: This paper presents a comprehensive review of sensor data fusion techniques for identifying activities of daily living (ADLs) using mobile devices. The authors focus on the state-of-the-art in sensor fusion, highlighting its importance in improving algorithm reliability and addressing mobile device constraints.

title: Joint Bayesian Gaussian Discriminant Analysis for Speaker Verification
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to speaker verification using Joint Bayesian (JB) Gaussian discriminant analysis. The authors apply JB, originally proposed for face verification, to the speaker verification task and make three contributions: employing exact statistics in EM iterations, simultaneous diagonalization of within-class and between-class covariance matrices, and comparing similarities and differences with various Gaussian PLDAs.

title: Learning Agent-Aware Affordances for Closed-Loop Interaction with Articulated Objects
summary: This paper proposes a novel closed-loop control pipeline that integrates manipulation priors from affordance estimation with sampling-based whole-body control. The pipeline is agent-aware, meaning it takes into account the robot's capabilities and embodiment, and outperforms state-of-the-art counterparts in tasks such as opening and closing an oven door.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods for affordance estimation and control policy optimization.

title: Explore Semantic Pixel Sets Based Local Pattern with Entropy Information for Face Recognition and Application in Back Propagation
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to face recognition using semantic pixel sets based local patterns with entropy information. The method combines the Local Binary Pattern (LBP) operator with a semantic pixel set of entropy information, which is used as input for classification using back propagation networks. The results show a high recognition rate of 98%.

title: Psychological Bidirectional Influences of Information Sampling and Concept Learning
summary: This paper investigates how humans actively sample information from sources expected to provide behaviorally relevant information, developing a computational model called Sampling Emergent Attention (SEA) that reflects this effect. The model consists of two interacting components and predicts classic behavioral effects associated with selective attention.

title: Burn image segmentation based on Mask Regions with Convolutional Neural Network deep learning framework: more accurate and more convenient
summary: This paper proposes a novel method for burn image segmentation using the Mask R-CNN deep learning framework, achieving more accurate and convenient results compared to traditional methods. The authors employed state-of-the-art techniques, including Atrous Convolution in Feature Pyramid Network (FPN), to segment burn wounds in images.

title: Phase Distribution in Probabilistic Movement Primitives
summary: This paper investigates a method to temporally align observations for learning ProMPs, maximizing spatial structure information while maintaining smooth phase velocity. The proposed system recognizes and reproduces human movements using probabilistic movement primitives.

title: Design Principles for Data Analysis
summary: This paper introduces design principles for data analysis, which are complementary to statistical thinking. The authors propose six principles: data matching, exhaustive, reproducibility, transparency, interpretability, and explainability. They argue that these principles can help induce variation in data analyses and provide a framework for teaching students how to build data analyses using formal design principles.

title: UrduFake@FIRE2020: Shared Track on Fake News Identification in Urdu
summary: This paper presents the first shared task at FIRE 2020 on fake news detection in the Urdu language. The study uses machine learning methods, including BERT-based approaches, to identify fake news and achieves an F-score value of 0.90.
statisticalMethods: F1-macro score is used as the evaluation metric to accommodate class imbalance

title: System Identification with Student’s t-Process Dynamical Model
summary: This paper proposes a Student's t-process dynamical model (TPDM) for state space modeling, which is an extension of the TPLVM. The TPDM is applied to the problem of satellite orbit estimation, where it successfully estimates the true position of the satellite from observed information.

title: A High-Quality Multilingual Dataset for Structured Documentation Translation
summary: This paper presents a high-quality multilingual dataset for structured documentation translation, which advances research on localization of structured text. The dataset is built from the online documentation of an enterprise software platform and includes XML-structured parallel text segments in 16 languages. Machine learning-based translation models are used to improve translation accuracy, and the beam search accurately generates XML structures.

title: Part Attentioned Fine-Grained Categorization Using Context Sensitive Flow
summary: This paper proposes a novel multiple scales attention fusing convolutional neural network for fine-grained image recognition. The proposed method, FFCSnet, consists of two main components: a new part feature fused attention net and a context sensitive loss. It achieves state-of-the-art performance on two challenging fine-grained image recognition datasets, CUB Birds and Stanford Cars.

title: CU-UD: text-mining drug and chemical-protein interactions with ensembles of BERT-based models
summary: This paper presents an ensemble system for text-mining drug and chemical-protein interactions using BERT-based models. The system combines the outputs of individual models using majority voting and multilayer perceptron, achieving state-of-the-art performance on the DrugProt task in BioCreative VII.

title: Fast Evaluation of Real and Complex Polynomials
summary: This paper proposes a novel algorithm for quickly evaluating polynomials, with a focus on improving the speed without compromising precision. The algorithm is designed for repeated single-point evaluations and can also be used as an embarrassingly parallel multipoint evaluator.

title: Statistically Profiling Biases in Natural Language Reasoning Datasets and Models
summary: This paper proposes a light-weight statistical profiling framework, ICQ (I-See-Cue), to identify biases in natural language reasoning datasets and models. The framework automatically identifies possible biases in multiple-choice NLU datasets without the need for additional test cases, and evaluates through blackbox testing the extent to which models may exploit these biases.
statisticalMethods: mean squared error (MSE) and Jensen-Shannon Divergence

title: Proximal Distilled Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning
summary: This paper proposes a novel algorithm called Proximal Distilled Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning (PDERL) that integrates evolution and learning to enhance each other. PDERL uses learning-based variation operators that compensate for the simplicity of genetic representation, addressing the scalability problem of Genetic Algorithms (GAs).

title: Real-Time Social Network-Based Knowledge Discovery System for Decision Making
summary: This paper presents a real-time social network-based knowledge discovery system that uses natural language processing and text mining techniques to automatically interpret user opinions about venues. The system is designed for decision-making, allowing users to quickly identify positive, negative, or neutral thoughts about foods, beverages, and venues.
statisticalMethods: Classification accuracy of 84.49% for Turkish and 95% for English

title: Automated Maxillofacial Segmentation in Panoramic Dental X-Ray Images Using an Efficient Encoder-Decoder Network
summary: This paper proposes a deep learning-based approach for automated maxillofacial segmentation in panoramic dental X-ray images. The proposed model, EED-Net, achieves better accuracy and speed trade-offs than state-of-the-art methods, making it suitable for real-time applications.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods to evaluate the performance of EED-Net on the maxillofacial dataset.

title: Farmers' willingness to pay for Sinar donkey conservation in selected districts of Metekel and Assosa zones, northwest Ethiopia: a contingent valuation study
summary: This paper conducts a contingent valuation study to assess farmers' willingness to pay for Sinar donkey conservation in selected districts of Metekel and Assosa zones, northwest Ethiopia. The study uses descriptive statistics and logistic regression to analyze the data, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Reward Value-Based Goal Selection for Agents' Cooperative Route Learning Without Communication in Reward and Goal Dynamism
summary: This paper proposes a goal selection method to enable agents to cooperate without communication by adapting to dynamic changes in reward values and goals. The proposed method uses two unified conditions to select the appropriate purposes, making all agents learn to achieve their goals in order of minimum condition value.

title: Comparison of Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and Multilayer Perceptron Methods on Classification of Bank Customer Account Closure
summary: This paper compares the performance of three machine learning methods (Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and Multilayer Perceptron) in classifying bank customer account closure. The results show that the Multilayer Perceptron method achieves the highest accuracy (85.5373%) and is therefore considered the best model for this task.

title: Bank competition in China: a blessing or a curse for financial system?
summary: This paper investigates the relationship between bank competition and systematic risk in China, using a dynamic causality model. The study finds a bidirectional causal relationship between banking competition and systematic risk, with both positive and negative effects.
statisticalMethods: Granger and sub-sample time varying rolling window

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning in a Monetary Model
summary: This paper proposes the use of deep reinforcement learning to solve dynamic stochastic general equilibrium models. The authors combine a standard DSGE modeling approach with flexible expectations formation, using modern developments in deep reinforcement learning to enable agents to learn nonlinear decision rules via deep artificial neural networks.

title: On the enrichment of time series with textual data for forecasting agricultural commodity prices
summary: This paper presents a method to enrich time-series data with textual information for forecasting agricultural commodity prices. The authors use a combination of time-series and textual features, including domain-specific terms extracted from texts, to improve the accuracy of their models.
statisticalMethods: Histogram-based Gradient Boosting Regression (HGBR), Support Vector Regression (SVR), Random Forest Regressor (RF), and Bagging Regressor (BR) are used for regression tasks

title: Differentiations in Women’s Land Tenure Experiences: Implications for Women’s Land Access and Tenure Security in Sub-Saharan Africa
summary: This paper explores the differentiated land tenure experiences of women in sub-Saharan Africa, highlighting the need for policies to address the heterogeneity of women's situations. The study uses evidence from Ghana, Nigeria, and Zimbabwe to show that women have unique problems, needs, and statuses in their quest for land access and tenure security.

title: COVID-19 acceleration in digitalisation, aggregate productivity growth and the functional income distribution
summary: This paper examines the impact of COVID-19 on digitalization, aggregate productivity growth, and the functional income distribution in the EU economy. The authors use a two-sector growth model to analyze the effects of a persistent increase in demand for digital services on productivity and inequality.

title: Feasibility of nowcasting SDG indicators: a comprehensive survey
summary: This paper explores the feasibility of nowcasting Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicators, aiming to address the issue of long publication lags. The authors conducted a comprehensive survey of 362 SDG indicators and sub-indicators, classifying them as highly likely, likely, or unlikely for nowcasting. The study highlights the potential of nowcasting in leveraging timely data from various sources, but also notes concerns over methodology robustness and data validity.

title: Tracking COVID-19 Decease Through Rolling Conditional Variance
summary: This paper proposes a tracking indicator for volatility and COVID-19 direction, including a weekly window to observe its evolution. The research aims to track the total deaths caused by COVID-19 in the most affected countries after the approval, distribution, and implementation of vaccines from 2021.

title: Based on DPSIR Model Environmental Planning and Risk Evaluation in the Early Stage of State-Level New Areas Development
summary: This paper applies the DPSIR conceptual model to summarize and extract a state-level new Area risk evaluation index system, using traditional statistical methods and high-order mathematical models as comparison. The study identifies 23 risk indicators and uses the adaptability and reliability and validity to test the reliability of the indicator system.
statisticalMethods: traditional statistical methods and high-order mathematical models

title: Inclusive finance, industrial structure upgrading and farmers’ income: Empirical analysis based on provincial panel data in China
summary: This paper empirically studies the relationship among inclusive finance, industrial structure upgrading and farmers’ income using a panel dataset of 28 provinces in China from 2006 to 2016. The research finds that inclusive finance can significantly promote the increase of farmers’ income through its intermediary mechanism, the Upgrading of Industry Structure (UIS). However, the development model of inclusive finance should be transformed to give full play to its hematopoietic function and guiding role, supporting the UIS.

title: Neural Payoff Machines: Predicting Fair and Stable Payoff Allocations Among Team Members
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to predicting fair and stable payoff allocations among team members using neural networks. The authors combine solution concepts from cooperative game theory with the predictive power of neural networks, creating models that can generalize to games far from the training distribution and predict solutions for more players than observed during training.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods to analyze the performance of the proposed models and compare them to traditional approaches.

title: Extension Agents Perception of Open Data Usage in Agricultural Communication in Abia State
summary: This paper assesses the perception of open data usage among agricultural extension agents in Abia State, Nigeria. While open data is recognized as a driver for economic growth and a means to facilitate precision agriculture, its use is hindered by challenges such as lack of funding, internet facilities, and adequate knowledge of ICT tools.

title: Cognitive Sophistication and Deliberation Times
summary: This paper explores the relationship between cognitive sophistication, deliberation times, and behavioral heterogeneity in economics. The authors propose a model that links cognitive effort to choices and deliberation times, using stylized facts from psychophysiological literature on response times. They test this model experimentally in two games commonly used to study iterative thinking.

title: Irrelevant matches in round-robin tournaments
summary: This paper investigates the existence of round-robin tournaments with no irrelevant matches. The authors formalize the notion of relevant and irrelevant matches, and study the circumstances under which relevant tournaments exist. They prove that all tournaments with a static schedule and at least five players include a match that is irrelevant for both agents, but show that dynamic schedules can be devised to avoid irrelevant matches.

title: Determinants of banks’ cost efficiency: a case study of selected commercial banks, Ethiopia
summary: This paper examines the determinants of cost efficiency in Ethiopian commercial banks using a stochastic frontier analysis. The study focuses on the role of bank-specific and macroeconomic factors in influencing cost efficiency, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Real-time Bidding for Time Constrained Impression Contracts in First and Second Price Auctions -- Theory and Algorithms
summary: This paper studies the optimal behavior of a bidder in real-time auctions with time constraints, focusing on first and second price mechanisms. The authors show that the problem can be reduced to a convex optimization problem and provide algorithms for implementing solutions. While ML/AI methods are not explicitly used, the paper's focus on dynamic bidding policies and contract management involves complex statistical estimation problems.
statisticalMethods: classical control theory methods (e.g., PID controllers), MDP formulations, reinforcement learning

title: COVID-19 and Its Impacts on Global Economic Spheres
summary: This paper analyzes the socio-economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on global economic spheres, highlighting its effects on GDP, unemployment rates, and poverty. Although the study mentions artificial intelligence, robots, and changing technologies as necessary for survival in critical times, it does not explicitly use or integrate machine learning (ML) methods into its methodology.

title: An Integrated Ecological-Social Simulation Model of Farmer Decisions and Cropping System Performance in the Rolling Pampas (Argentina)
summary: This paper presents an integrated ecological-social simulation model, AgroDEVS, which uses agent-based modeling and Cellular Automata to simulate land-use and cover change (LUCC) dynamics in the Rolling Pampas region of Argentina. The model integrates economic, environmental, and social factors to predict LUCC patterns and their associated economic and environmental changes.
statisticalMethods: Normalized RMSE, Probability of a Match, Index of Observed Fit

title: German forecasters' narratives: How informative are German business cycle forecast reports?
summary: This paper analyses the information content of German forecasters' narratives for German business cycle forecasts. The authors apply textual analysis to convert qualitative text data into quantitative sentiment indices, which are then used to test the efficiency of numerical forecasts. While the results suggest some informational content of sentiment indices for growth and inflation forecasts, the predictive power is weak.

title: Empirical study and model simulation of global stock market dynamics during COVID-19
summary: This paper empirically studies the impact of COVID-19 on global stock markets, focusing on large volatility dynamics, variation-fluctuation correlation function, and epidemic-fluctuation correlation function. The authors generalize the Heston model to simulate stock market dynamics under the influence of COVID-19.

title: Modeling Unemployment Duration, Determinants and Insurance Premium Pricing of Malaysia: Insights from an Upper Middle-Income Developing Country
summary: This paper investigates the behavior and determinants of unemployment in Malaysia, an upper middle-income country with relatively low unemployment but rising labor market mismatches. The study uses statistical modeling to estimate unemployment duration and derive a model-based insurance premium pricing schedule that broadens the country's unemployment insurance coverage.
statisticalMethods: Burr distribution, Cox proportional hazards model

title: Accumulating Risk Capital Through Investing in Cooperation
summary: This paper proposes a method for training policies that balance safety and cooperation in sequential social dilemmas, using the concept of risk capital to incentivize long-term cooperation. The proposed algorithm, ARCTIC, is shown to be effective in achieving cooperation while maintaining safety in Prisoner's Dilemma and Stag Hunt.

title: Proportional Justified Representation
summary: This paper extends the work of Aziz et al. on multi-winner elections by introducing Proportional Justified Representation (PJR), a relaxation of Extended Justified Representation (EJR) that is compatible with perfect representation and can be computed in polynomial time. The authors also show that PJR provides weaker guarantees than EJR regarding average voter satisfaction.

title: TRAINING OF FUTURE ENERGY SPECIALISTS TO SOLVE PRACTICAL PROBLEMS ON THE BASIS OF PHYSICAL PROJECTS
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of using physical projects in training future energy specialists to solve practical problems. The authors analyze research in education, the National Qualifications Framework, and standard higher education requirements to develop an effective teaching method.
statisticalMethods: quantitative and qualitative data processing, graphical presentation of results

title: Using social media advertisement data to monitor the gender gap in STEM: opportunities and challenges
summary: This paper investigates the feasibility of using Facebook and Instagram advertising audience estimates for modeling the leaky pipeline phenomenon in the USA. The authors filter the advertising audience estimates by location, age, gender, and interests related to STEM, compute the gender gap index, and compare it across age groups at the US metro level. However, they conclude that there is little evidence that this novel data source can measure the decline in interest in STEM for young women in the USA.

title: Improvement of English Teaching Model Based on Computer Network
summary: This paper explores the improvement of English teaching mode based on computer image assistance, using computer-assisted instruction to enhance students' motivation and participation in classroom activities. The study integrates machine learning concepts into traditional teaching methods, promoting a student-centered approach and utilizing modern information technology for autonomous learning.

title: Comparison of Learning Transfer Using Simulation Problem-Based Learning and Demonstration: An Application of Papanicolaou Smear Nursing Education
summary: This study compares the effects of simulation problem-based learning (S-PBL) and demonstration-based learning on nursing students' self-confidence, learner satisfaction, and critical thinking in Pap smear education. The results show that S-PBL is an effective strategy for improving learning transfer, but ML/AI methods are not used in this paper.

title: Scalable quantum computational chemistry with superconducting qubits
summary: This paper presents a scalable solution to the molecular electronic structure problem in quantum chemistry using variational quantum eigensolver (VQE) with superconducting qubits. The authors demonstrate high-accuracy results for H2, LiH, and F2 molecules by integrating error mitigation schemes and optimising the algorithm.
statisticalMethods: Classical optimisation and stochastic gradient descent

title: Assessing prior knowledge types as predictors of academic achievement in the introductory phase of biology and physics study programmes using logistic regression
summary: This paper explores the relationship between prior knowledge types and academic achievement in biology and physics introductory courses. The authors use logistic regression to evaluate the predictive power of four prior knowledge types on student achievement, finding that only certain types of prior knowledge are significant predictors for each subject.

title: Exploring Kid Space in the wild: a preliminary study of multimodal and immersive collaborative play-based learning experiences
summary: This paper presents a preliminary study on Kid Space, an immersive computing experience designed to engage children in physical movement and social collaboration during play-based learning. The technology incorporates multimodal sensing and sensemaking technologies, including face, pose, and gesture recognition, location tracking, ambient audio classification, automatic speech recognition, and natural language understanding and dialogue management.

title: Research on Integrating Ideological and Political Elements into Vocational College Public English on the Basis of Project Teaching Method
summary: This paper explores the practice and research of integrating ideological and political elements into vocational college public English teaching using project-based teaching. The study aims to provide a meaningful reference for ideological and political teaching of English courses in the future, with a focus on cultivating students' patriotism and international vision.

title: Crossword puzzle as a learning tool to enhance learning about anticoagulant therapeutics
summary: This study evaluates the effectiveness of crossword puzzles as an active learning tool in pharmacy education, specifically for teaching anticoagulant therapeutics. The research found that students generally have positive perceptions of the activity and that it can enhance information recall and retention.

title: Exploring the Impact of the Counseling Service on Student-Teachers' Academic Performance: The Case of E.P. College of Education, Bimbilla
summary: This study explores the impact of counseling services on student-teachers' academic performance in E.P. College of Education, Bimbilla. The research found that counseling service equips student-teachers with good study and time management skills to improve their academic performance.

title: Evaluation Method of Public Physical Training Quality Based on Global Topology Optimization Deep Learning Model
summary: This paper proposes a new public sports training quality evaluation method based on the global topology optimization deep learning model. The method improves the accuracy of evaluation results and has certain feasibility, making it a substantial contribution to the field of education.

title: Research on Inclusive Education for Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) Children in Southern Jiangxi
summary: This paper examines the current status and challenges of inclusive education for ASD children in Southern Jiangxi, China. It discusses the development of inclusive education in both China and foreign countries, highlighting the importance of creating opportunities for ASD children to interact with normal children and improve their social communication skills.

title: That Wasn't the Math I Wanted to do!
summary: This paper examines students' beliefs about mathematics during the transition from school to university, focusing on the role of static and dynamic beliefs in predicting success. The study uses questionnaires to assess students' beliefs at the beginning and middle of their first term at university, finding that dynamic beliefs decrease while static beliefs remain stable.

title: Secondary Education and COVID-19
summary: This paper explores the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on secondary education, discussing changes in teaching methods, including distance learning and hybrid models. The use of digital technology became a primary modality for ensuring educational continuity during school closures.

title: The proofing validation of conventional mechanical drawing job sheet
summary: This paper focuses on developing and assessing the feasibility of a Job Drawing course in Mechanical Drawing (MD) at Yogyakarta State University. The research uses the 4-D Thiagarajan model, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: A Case Study of Drama Education for Indigenous Children in The Alternative Classroom
summary: This paper investigates the use of drama education as an alternative approach to teaching indigenous children. It explores how drama can be used to improve social development and engagement in learning, particularly for children who may struggle with traditional educational methods.

title: The impact of learning strategies on the academic achievement of university students in Saudi Arabia
summary: This study investigates the learning strategies adopted by Saudi university students and their impact on academic achievement. The research found that microstrategies and study habits are the most preferred strategies, with female students using them more than male students. The study also found a significant predictor of student academic achievement.

title: Initial learning scenarios based on the computational thinking evaluation for the course Programming fundamentals at INACAP
summary: This paper presents a design and planning of initial learning scenarios for the course Programming Fundamentals, focusing on computational thinking evaluation. The research aims to favor motivation and autonomy in study through recognition of skills and instructional design. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this paper.

title: EFL Teaching in KSA
summary: This study examines the current strategies of teaching English as a foreign language in Saudi Arabian universities, highlighting the need for improved methods and increased student motivation. The research focuses on the importance of English in achieving the Kingdom's Vision 2030, which emphasizes empowering individuals through education.

title: Manifestation Of Prophetic Leadership Values In Islamic Education
summary: This paper explores the manifestation of prophetic leadership values in Islamic education, highlighting the importance of moral values and humanism in educational institutions. The study uses a library research approach with data analysis methods, content analysis, and spiral analysis to examine the concept of prophetic leadership and its application in education.

title: Design and Research of Mathematics Teaching Intelligent Classroom Based on PCA-NN Algorithm
summary: This paper proposes an optimization model of mathematics classroom design and teaching quality evaluation based on the PCA-NN algorithm. The research focuses on improving the quality of mathematics classroom teaching by effectively integrating ML/AI methods into the design and evaluation process.

title: Application of Mind Map in Teaching Geometry in Grade 4
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of using mind maps in teaching geometry to fourth-grade students. The study demonstrates that incorporating mind maps into the curriculum can improve student learning motivation and subject interests, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Students’ Acceptance of Technology-Mediated Teaching – How It Was Influenced During the COVID-19 Pandemic in 2020: A Study From Germany
