summary: This paper investigates students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching during the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors applied the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) to examine the acceptance of technology-mediated teaching by students in two disciplines: information systems and music and arts. The study found that students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching differed depending on the discipline, with students in information systems showing higher acceptance rates than those in music and arts.

title: Trends in Educational Gamification: Challenges and Learning Opportunities
summary: This special issue explores the application of gamification in education, highlighting its potential to engage learners and promote creativity. However, it also notes challenges and limitations, including a lack of understanding among teachers about how to effectively implement gamification.

title: Dropout at Danish vocational schools: does the school’s health promotion capacity play a role?
summary: This study investigates the association between VET schools' health promotion capacity and student dropout rates. The authors found no associations between health promotion capacity and dropout rates, suggesting that other factors may play a more significant role in determining student completion of education.

title: Application of Granular Biocomposites Based on Homogenised Peat for Absorption of Oil Products
summary: This paper investigates the use of granular biocomposites made from homogenized peat, devulcanised rubber, and cenospheres for oil product absorption. The study focuses on the material's properties, such as hydrophobicity, porosity, and sorption capacity, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Robust Identification of Strain Waves due to Low-Velocity Impact with Different Impactor Stiffness
summary: This paper focuses on the development of an automated impact monitoring system for aeronautical structures. The authors investigate the effects of different impactor stiffnesses on strain wave generation and velocity, aiming to reduce their influence on impact-related features. Signal processing techniques are used to extract features from dynamic strain signals acquired using sensor networks.

title: The Influence of the Chamber Configuration on the Hydrodynamic Efficiency of Oscillating Water Column Devices
summary: This paper evaluates the influence of the front wall thickness on the hydrodynamic performance of Oscillating Water Column (OWC) devices. The study uses numerical results and compares them with literature values, finding good agreement. The research focuses on the design and construction of OWCs, particularly in breakwaters, and aims to improve their efficiency.

title: An Efficient Stochastic Constrained Path Planner for Redundant Manipulators
summary: This paper proposes a novel stochastic method to efficiently plan collision-free trajectories for redundant manipulators. The approach exploits the kinematics of mechanisms with redundant actuation and maximizes manipulability while avoiding obstacles, providing smooth trajectories that can be directly commanded to the robot.

title: Overcurrent relay coordination with grid-connected and islanding capability on distribution network with distributed generation
summary: This paper proposes a method to establish overcurrent relay settings that coordinate correctly for both grid-connected and islanding conditions on distribution networks with distributed generation. The proposed method is based on the idea that a single setting can work for both conditions, and it has been successfully implemented in a case study.

title: Performance of Composite Shear Walls Subjected to In-plane Cyclic Loading-A Numerical Parametric Study
summary: This paper investigates the performance of composite shear walls under in-plane cyclic loading through a numerical parametric study. The research focuses on evaluating the behavior and comparing the performance of different types of composite shear walls, including RC shear walls, composite shear walls with single or double external steel plates, and other configurations.

title: Optimal Placement of FACTS Devices Based on Whale Optimization Algorithm for Power System Security Enhancement
summary: This paper presents a methodology to enhance the security of power systems by optimally placing FACTS devices using the Whale Optimization Algorithm. The method analyzes system security based on loading of transmission lines and variations of bus voltages, and combines security constraints with Optimal Power Flow to resolve this problem.

title: Demand Response Contextual Remuneration of Prosumers with Distributed Storage
summary: This paper proposes a methodology to optimally manage community resources, including distributed generation and energy storage systems. The authors aim to address fair and contextual remuneration of prosumers participating in demand response events, reducing uncertainty and improving self-consumption.

title: Comparative analysis and experimental results of advanced control strategies for vibration suppression in aircraft wings
summary: This paper presents a comparative analysis of two active vibration control methods, Linear Quadratic Regulator and Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller, for suppressing vibrations in aircraft wings. The study focuses on the experimental results and settling times obtained using these controllers.

title: Fault Detection Method for Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator Wind Energy Converters Using Correlation Features Among Three-phase Currents
summary: This paper presents a fault detection method for permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) wind energy converters using correlation features among three-phase currents. The proposed method uses an artificial neural network (ANN) trained by the features extracted from motor currents and the DC-link current to detect open-circuit faults (OCFs) in PMSG drives at different wind speeds.

title: A Review on Augmentation of Voltage Stability Using Optimization Technique
summary: This paper reviews the importance of voltage stability and optimal reactive power dispatch in power systems, discussing traditional and advanced optimization techniques. The authors propose a review of LP Technique and PSO algorithm for system parameters development to improve voltage stability and profile improvement.

title: Data-based PID control of flexible joint robot using adaptive safe experimentation dynamics algorithm
summary: This paper proposes a data-based PID controller for flexible joint robots using the adaptive safe experimentation dynamics (ASED) algorithm. The ASED algorithm is an enhanced version of the SED algorithm, which improves convergence accuracy by adapting to changes in the objective function.

title: Free-hand gas identification based on transfer function ratios without gas flow control
summary: This paper presents a novel gas identification protocol based on transfer function ratios (TFR) that is intrinsically independent of the gas input pattern. The protocol, combined with MEMS-based sensors, enables free-hand gas identification without gas flow control units, expanding the applicability of gas sensors to portable electronics.

title: Numerical simulation and experimental investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance
summary: This paper presents an experimental and numerical investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance. The authors focus on evaluating the efficiency of a submersible mixer using both theoretical and numerical methods, comparing their results with experimental data. Machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this research.

title: Artificial Neural Network and Response Surface Methodology Based Analysis on Solid Particle Erosion Behavior of Polymer Matrix Composites
summary: This paper investigates the erosion behavior of polymer matrix composites using a combination of response surface methodology and artificial neural networks. The study demonstrates how machine learning can be used to model complex material phenomena, with the ANN model showing good agreement with experimental results.

title: A Novel Method for Effective Cell Segmentation and Tracking in Phase Contrast Microscopic Images
summary: This paper presents a novel method for effective cell segmentation and tracking in phase contrast microscopic images. The proposed method uses the K-means clustering technique to eliminate the halo effect, which interferes with precise segmentation of cell shapes. The method is verified by comparing it with manual tracking results and state-of-the-art unsupervised methods.

title: Appliance-Level Monitoring with Micro-Moment Smart Plugs
summary: This paper proposes a micro-moment-based smart plug system for energy efficiency, which collects contextual information and enables real-time power measurements. The system is part of the broader (EM ) 3 project that uses artificial intelligence to achieve high domestic energy performance.

title: Power System Small-Signal Stability as Affected by Grid-Connected SmartPark
summary: This paper examines the impact of grid-connected smart charging stations on power system small-signal stability. The authors employ damping torque analysis to investigate the effects of smart charging station integration on transmission system dynamics, finding that optimal charging capacity is crucial for maintaining dynamic stability.

title: Forecasting Short-term load using Econometrics time series model with T-student Distribution
summary: This paper focuses on short-term load forecasting, a crucial aspect of electrical system planning and dispatching. The authors propose an Autoregressive integrated moving average (SARIMA) - generalized autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity (GARCH) model with T-student Distribution to forecast electric load for one day ahead. Although the paper uses econometrics time series models, which are not typically considered machine learning or AI methods, it does not explicitly mention any ML/AI techniques.
statisticalMethods: time series regression, Augmented Dickey-Fuller test, McLeod-Li test

title: Experimental Analysis of Modified DC-P&O Technique with Arm Controller for a Stand-Alone 40 W PV System
summary: This paper presents an experimental analysis of a modified direct-control perturbation & observation (DC-P&O) technique for a stand-alone 40 W photovoltaic system. The authors focus on improving the efficiency of solar cells by proposing a modified DC-P&O method using an efficient DC-DC boost convertor and an intelligent, efficient and low-cost 32-bit ARM Cortex microcontroller.

title: Sequential Algorithm for Combined State of Charge and State of Health Estimation of Lithium Ion Battery based on Active Current Injection
summary: This paper proposes a sequential algorithm for estimating the state of charge (SoC) and state of health (SoH) of lithium-ion batteries using active current injection. The algorithm uses frequency-scale separation to estimate parameters/states sequentially, improving estimation performance compared to concurrent algorithms.

title: High Density Resistive Array Readout System for Wearable Electronics
summary: This paper presents a wearable sensing system for high-density resistive array readout, which measures the resistance change of sensors using a custom graphical user interface. The system consists of a readout board and a battery housed in a wristband chassis.

title: Assessment of Rough Set Theory in Relation to Risks Regarding Hydraulic Engineering Investment Decisions
summary: This paper assesses the application of rough set theory in hydraulic engineering investment decisions, proposing innovations for optimizing water conservancy project investment decision-making. The study uses rough set theory to analyze imprecise and uncertain information, discovering hidden knowledge that can be used to discover potential rules.

title: Prediction and evaluation of photovoltaic-thermal energy systems production using artificial neural network and experimental dataset
summary: This paper presents a novel mathematical and ANN model for examining the performance of PV/T systems, with a focus on predicting and assessing photovoltaic-thermal energy system production using artificial neural network models based on an experimental dataset in Sohar/Oman. The proposed neural models can generate future figures for any needed period that accurately fit the actual datasets.

title: Electrical Modification and Experimental Study of Combine Harvester Reaping Unit
summary: This paper focuses on the electrical modification of a combine harvester reaping unit to improve efficiency and reduce labor requirements. The research team proposes an electric refit for the reaping unit, including the selection of motor and reducer, 3D design, and finite element analysis. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Gap Filling of Advanced Technology Microwave Sounder Data as Applied to Hurricane Warm Core Animations
summary: This paper presents a new methodology for gap-filling ATMS SDR brightness temperature data using the DCT-PLS smoothing algorithm, which is essential for monitoring hurricane warm core structures. The authors develop three regression-based retrieval algorithms to produce vertical atmospheric temperature fields under all weather conditions, and create a 3-D image animation system showing atmospheric temperature anomaly distribution of hurricane warm core structures.
statisticalMethods: Penalized Least Square Discrete Cosine Transform

title: Unprecedented differences in phytoplankton community structures in the Amundsen Sea Polynyas, West Antarctica
summary: This paper investigates the phytoplankton community structure in the Amundsen Sea Polynyas, West Antarctica, and finds unprecedented differences between adjacent polynyas. The study uses automated continuous observation instruments to measure phytoplankton species abundance, but does not employ machine learning or AI methods.

title: Energy-aware and Bandwidth Allocation for Air Pollution Monitoring System using Data Analytics
summary: This paper proposes a novel framework for air pollution monitoring using wireless sensor networks, leveraging data analytics to improve the accuracy and efficiency of pollutant detection. While machine learning is mentioned as part of the methodology, its role appears minimal in this context.

title: Forest Fires Detection using Deep Transfer Learning
summary: This paper presents a deep transfer learning approach for forest fire detection, utilizing pre-trained computer vision architectures to achieve a detection rate of over 99.9%. The methodology integrates deep learning with traditional image processing methods to identify wildfires earlier.

title: Deep Learning Based Thermal Image Processing Approach for Detection of Buried Objects and Mines
summary: This paper presents a deep learning based thermal imaging approach for the detection of buried objects and surface mines. The proposed method uses a Region Convolution Neural Network (RCNN) to identify buried objects in thermal images, achieving 90% accuracy in predicting target locations.

title: Applying Machine Learning for Firebrand Production Prediction
summary: This paper presents a machine learning-based metamodeling framework for firebrand production prediction, which can provide high accuracy fire modeling in real-time. The framework uses non-linear non-parametric ML models to predict the firebrand areal mass density and number density of landing firebrands.

title: Citrus orchards under formation evaluated by UAV-Based RGB Imagery
summary: This study evaluates the use of aerial UAV images with automated routines to estimate biometric attributes of citrus orchards under formation. The method uses RGB sensors and achieves high accuracy in estimating crown projection area and plant height, making it a substantial contribution to the field.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods used include zonal statistics, arithmetic mean, and Delaunay algorithm.

title: Understanding Adverse Biological Effect Predictions Using Knowledge Graphs
summary: This paper presents a novel approach for extrapolating adverse biological effects of chemicals using knowledge graphs and their vector embeddings. The method improves prediction performance by up to 40% in terms of R^2 coefficient of determination, providing quantitative and qualitative insights into the predictions.

title: Walking in a heterogeneous landscape: Dispersal, gene flow and conservation implications for the giant panda in the Qinling Mountains
summary: This paper investigates the genetic status of the Qinling giant panda population, examining the factors that underpin the structuring of genetic variation within populations. The study uses a landscape genetics approach to identify the role of isolation-by-barriers (IBB), isolation-by-distance (IBD) and isolation-by-resistance (IBR) in shaping the pattern of genetic variation in this giant panda population.

title: Geant4-based simulations of charge collection in CMOS Active Pixel Sensors
summary: This paper presents Geant4-based simulations of charge collection in CMOS Active Pixel Sensors, focusing on the development of a charge transport model for accurate Monte Carlo simulations. The model includes charge generation, diffusion, and sharing across adjacent pixels, as well as the full electronic chain for a CMOS APS.

title: Cloud Detection by Luminance and Inter-band Parallax Analysis for Pushbroom Satellite Imagers
summary: This paper proposes a cloud detection algorithm for Earth observation images obtained by pushbroom satellite imagers, exploiting the inter-band disparity to detect clouds. The method is shown to be effective in detecting clouds with a balanced accuracy rate close to 98%.

title: Age-Dependent Dispersal and Relatedness in Tiger Sharks (Galeocerdo cuvier)
summary: This paper investigates the dispersal patterns of tiger sharks, focusing on the relationship between physical and reproductive dispersal. The authors use genetic data to examine fine-scale structure in populations, finding evidence of male-biased dispersal and female philopatry. However, tracking studies have shown that both males and females move similar distances, exhibiting repeated site fidelity.

title: Remote Aircraft Target Recognition Method Based on Superpixel Segmentation and Image Reconstruction
summary: This paper proposes a remote aircraft target recognition method based on superpixel segmentation and image reconstruction. The method uses histograms of oriented gradients to estimate the orientation of an aircraft, followed by improved SLIC superpixel segmentation algorithm to segment the target from complex backgrounds and shadow areas. The approach is robust to noise and recognizes targets more accurately than other methods.

title: Multi$^{	ext{3}}$Net: Segmenting Flooded Buildings via Fusion of Multiresolution, Multisensor, and Multitemporal Satellite Imagery
summary: This paper proposes a novel approach for rapid segmentation of flooded buildings by fusing multiresolution, multisensor, and multitemporal satellite imagery in a convolutional neural network. The model significantly expedites the generation of satellite imagery-based flood maps, crucial for first responders and local authorities in the early stages of flood events.

title: Forecasting Hydropower Generation in Ghana Using ARIMA Models
summary: This paper uses the Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) model to forecast hydropower generation and water level of the Akosombo dam in Ghana. The study focuses on the importance of accurate forecasting for sustainable electricity supply, particularly in developing countries like Ghana.
statisticalMethods: Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) and Mean Absolute Percentage error (MAPE) were used to evaluate the forecasting accuracy of the selected model.

title: Support vector machine tropical wind speed retrieval in the presence of rain for Ku-band wind scatterometry
summary: This paper explores the application of support vector machines (SVM) to improve wind speed retrieval during rain for tropical regions. The authors apply SVM in machine learning to solve this complex problem, leveraging data-oriented regression and triple collocation to demonstrate better similarity between resolved Ku-band winds and collocated C-band winds.

title: MULTIRESOLUTION SEGMENTATION FOR EXTRACTING PLASTIC GREENHOUSES FROM DEIMOS-2 IMAGERY
summary: This paper presents a multi-resolution segmentation approach for extracting plastic greenhouses from Deimos-2 imagery. The authors use object-based image analysis (OBIA) techniques to segment the images and assess the quality of the segmentations using the AssesSeg tool.

title: Reducing pollutant emissions from vessel maneuvering in port areas
summary: This paper proposes an activity-based model to calculate ships' exhaust emissions while maneuvering in port, and evaluates the effectiveness of green port policies. The study finds that lower speeds and onshore power supply can reduce local air pollution, and assist transportation authorities to proactively respond to the International Maritime Organization's regulations for ensuring a sustainable future.

title: Palaeo-tsunami inundation distances deduced from roundness of gravel particles in tsunami deposits
summary: This paper presents a new approach to estimate tsunami inundation distance based on the mixture ratio of gravels from several sources in tsunami deposits. The method uses roundness measurements and mixture ratios to identify an abrupt change in the mixture ratio at a constant percentile, regardless of tsunami magnitude. This relationship allows for the estimation of palaeo-tsunami run-up height and/or inundation area.

title: TermPicks: A century of Greenland glacier terminus data for use in machine learning applications
summary: This paper presents a comprehensive dataset of manually digitized glacier termini for Greenland's outlet glaciers, which will be used as training data for machine learning methods. The dataset includes 39,060 individual terminus traces for 278 glaciers and has been cleaned and reformatted for use in scientific analysis.

title: Study on the Dust Content in Dead-End Drifts in the Potash Mines for Various Ventilation Modes
summary: This paper investigates dust content reduction in potash mines using various ventilation modes. The study focuses on the dynamics of a dust-air mixture and proposes a mathematical model for numerical simulation, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Focusing on Shadows for Predicting Heightmaps from Single Remotely Sensed RGB Images with Deep Learning
summary: This paper proposes a deep learning model that uses shadows in remotely sensed images to predict heightmaps. The model takes advantage of the shadow map, which is calculated efficiently using image operators, and achieves superior performance on the task.

title: Bayesian network modelling provides spatial and temporal understanding of ecosystem dynamics within shallow shelf seas
summary: This paper uses Bayesian networks to model the complex interactions between physical and biological variables in shallow shelf seas, providing a data-driven understanding of ecosystem dynamics. The study focuses on four contrasting regions in the North Sea, examining changes over 30 years and identifying key indicators of abundance or biomass change.

title: Ecosystem Respiration and Gross Primary Productivity in a Subalpine Grassland
summary: This paper investigates ecosystem respiration and gross primary productivity in a subalpine grassland, but does not utilize machine learning or AI methods. The study focuses on the effects of warming and altered water availability on plant performance and carbon budget.

title: Assessment of Habitat Change Processes within the Oti-Keran-Mandouri Network of Protected Areas in Togo (West Africa) from 1987 to 2013 Using Decision Tree Analysis
summary: This paper assesses habitat change processes within the Oti-Keran-Mandouri complex of protected areas in Togo using decision tree analysis. The study uses satellite-derived land cover maps to identify habitat change processes and their impact on biodiversity conservation.

title: Design and Analysis of Multi-Layer and Cuboid Coding Metamaterials for Radar Cross-Section Reduction
summary: This paper presents a design and analysis of multi-layer and cuboid coding metamaterials for reducing Radar Cross-Section (RCS) values in C- and Ku-band applications. The research focuses on developing coding metamaterials with unique properties, which can manipulate electromagnetic waves to achieve different functionalities.

title: Study of wear performance of deep drawing tooling
summary: This paper studies the wear behavior of high carbon high chromium steel, specifically Viking grade steel, under various processing parameters. The research aims to investigate the mechanical and tribological properties of die steel and develop a statistical model to predict wear under dry conditions.

title: Understanding and optimization of hard magnetic compounds from first principles
summary: This paper reviews recent developments in computational schemes for rare-earth magnet compounds, focusing on the use of first-principles calculations to understand and design magnetic materials. The authors discuss the limitations of current methods and propose new approaches, including data-driven methods for optimizing chemical composition.

title: Study on the linkages between microstructure and permeability of porous media using pore network and BP neural network
summary: This paper presents a framework to characterize the pore microstructure of porous media and predict permeability using a combination of pore network modeling (PNM) and back-propagation neural networks (BPNN). The PNM is used to represent the complex geometry of the pore space with morphology parameters, while the BPNN maps these parameters to permeability. The study demonstrates excellent prediction performance of the BPNN and identifies key morphology descriptors that significantly affect permeability.
statisticalMethods: Pearson correlation coefficient (PCC) is used to determine linear relationships between morphology parameters and permeability. Feature importance scores are calculated to show which morphology parameters have a significant effect on predicting permeability.

title: Application of Bayesian Family Classifiers for Cutting Tool Inserts Health Monitoring on CNC Milling
summary: This paper presents the application of supervised Machine Learning classifiers to design empirical classification models for tool condition monitoring in CNC milling. The study uses Bayesian family classifiers, including Bayes Net and Naïve Bayes, to classify tool conditions based on vibration data collected during face milling.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods, including Principle Component Analysis (PCA) and regression analysis, are used to analyze vibration data.

title: An inductively coupled plasma metal organic chemical vapor deposition based on showerhead structure for low temperature growth
summary: This paper proposes a new method for the low-temperature growth of semiconductor thin films using inductively coupled plasma metal organic chemical vapor deposition (ICP-MOCVD) with a showerhead structure. The research focuses on optimizing the showerhead structure to improve uniformity and crystalline quality, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: A New Approach for Measurement of Tensile Strength of Concrete
summary: This paper presents a new approach to measure the tensile strength of concrete using a compression-to-tension load transformer device. The method involves applying compressive loads to the top and bottom of a hole in the specimen, causing it to be subjected to uniaxial tensile stress.

title: Damage Monitoring of Single Lap Bonded Composite Using Acoustic Emission Technique
summary: This paper investigates the damage monitoring of single lap bonded composite using acoustic emission technique. The authors experimentally investigate the type of failure involved in single adhesive lap joints of composite and use an acoustic emission technique to monitor the pre and post aspects of damage growth in adhesive composite joint.

title: Hydrogen adsorption on doped MoS2 nanostructures
summary: This paper investigates the hydrogen adsorption characteristics in chemically modified MoS2 nanostructures using density functional theory calculations. A machine learning model is used to facilitate the screening of suitable structures, achieving a promising level of prediction accuracy with minimal structural input.

title: Critical increase in Na-doping facilitates acceptor band movements that yields ~180 meV shallow hole conduction in ZnO bulk crystals
summary: This paper investigates the effect of Na-doping on the electronic properties of ZnO bulk crystals. The authors report a critical increase in Na-acceptor concentration, which leads to shallow hole conduction and p-type conduction in ZnO crystals.

title: Prediction of Endpoint Sulfur Content in KR Desulfurization Based on the Hybrid Algorithm Combining Artificial Neural Network With SAPSO
summary: This paper presents a data-driven model to predict endpoint sulfur content in KR desulfurization process using a hybrid algorithm combining artificial neural network with SAPSO. The proposed model achieves higher accuracy than traditional statistical models and is used to optimize the KR desulfurization process.
statisticalMethods: Correlation Coefficient (R), Root Mean Square Error (RMSE), and Mean Absolute Relative Error (MARE)

title: Design and High-Throughput Screening of High Entropy Alloys
summary: This paper explores the design and high-throughput screening of high entropy alloys, proposing new parameters to predict phase formation. The authors introduce the mixing entropy (ΔS mix ) and Delta (δ) parameter to comprehensively reflect phase formation laws in multi-component alloys.

title: Editorial on Special Issue “Holography, 3-D Imaging and 3-D Display”
summary: This paper is an editorial that discusses the application of modern holographic techniques in various fields, including 3D inspection, 3D microscopy, metrology and profilometry, augmented reality, and industrial informatics. The paper does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Predicting Mechanical Properties from Microstructure Images in Fiber-reinforced Polymers using Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: This paper explores the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to predict mechanical properties from microstructure images in fiber-reinforced polymers. The authors modified a pre-existing CNN, StressNet, for non-linear finite element simulations and trained it on data generated from FE simulations. The resulting model can make predictions within seconds, compared to 92.5 hours for the full FE simulation.

title: Evaluation of ANN and ANFIS modeling ability in the prediction of AISI 1050 steel machining performance
summary: This paper evaluates the performance of Artificial Neural Network (ANN) and Adaptive Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) models in predicting machining responses for AISI 1050 steel turning operation. The study finds that ANN is relatively superior to ANFIS, with a maximum value of 92.1% recorded using the ANN compared to that of the ANFIS of 73%. The results demonstrate the substantial impact of ML/AI on the research, as the models are used to predict machining responses and optimize process parameters.
statisticalMethods: Coefficient of correlation (R2), root mean squared error (RMSE)

title: Frequency-dependent dielectric constant prediction of polymers using machine learning
summary: This paper develops a machine-learning-based model to predict the frequency-dependent dielectric constant of polymers, which is critical for various applications. The model uses a dataset of 1210 experimentally measured values and a hierarchical polymer fingerprinting scheme to accurately and rapidly predict ϵ of new polymer candidates across a wide range of frequencies.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods such as LASSO for dimensionality reduction and feature elimination.

title: A Study on Casting of Structural Mesh-like Metal Parts
summary: This paper presents a case study on the casting of structural mesh-like metal parts, focusing on cylindrical spacers. The research aims to improve design and manufacturing practices by parametrically defining shapes, examining alternative casting deployment, and ending with prototype manufacture. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Computational engineering of the oxygen electrode-electrolyte interface in solid oxide fuel cells
summary: This paper focuses on computational modeling of the microstructure evolution at the oxygen electrode–electrolyte interface in solid oxide fuel cells. The authors use thermodynamic, 1D kinetic, and 3D phase-field modeling to study the effects of different ceramic processing techniques for the CGO interlayer and operating parameters on the performance of SOFCs.

title: Theoretical and experimental investigations of ultrasonic vibration–assisted boring for titanium alloy
summary: This paper investigates the use of ultrasonic vibration-assisted boring (UB) to improve the quality of machined surfaces in titanium alloy. The authors analyze the kinematics characteristics of UB and compare it with conventional boring, finding that UB can reduce boring force and surface roughness effectively.

title: Preparation of a low-cost and eco-friendly superabsorbent composite based on wheat bran and laterite for potential application in Chinese herbal medicine growth
summary: This paper focuses on developing a low-cost, eco-friendly superabsorbent composite using wheat bran and laterite for potential application in Chinese herbal medicine growth. The study optimizes the conditions to prepare the WB-g-PAA/LA superabsorbent composite and investigates its properties and applications as a urea fertilizer carrier and in the growth of Chinese herbal medicine.

title: High Precision, Low Excitation Capacitance Measurement Methods from 10 mK- to Room-Temperature
summary: This paper presents a high precision capacitance measurement method that can measure capacitance from 10 mK to room temperature with excellent accuracy. The method uses a passive bridge at the sample stage and radio frequency excitation to increase the output signal, and develops a high sensitivity radio frequency lock-in technique to analyze the bridge output.

title: Automatic segmentation of ceramic materials with relaxed possibilistic c-means clustering for defect detection
summary: This paper proposes a Possibilistic C-Means pixel clustering algorithm with fuzzy stretching to enhance the contrast of ceramic material images for defect detection. The method is shown to be effective in segmenting defects from the background, outperforming standard K-means clustering.

title: Metal Nanoclusters/Polyvinyl Alcohol Composite Films as the Alternatives for Fabricating Remote-Type White Light-Emitting Diodes
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to fabricating remote-type white light-emitting diodes using metal nanoclusters/polyvinyl alcohol composite films. The research focuses on the synthesis and characterization of these composite materials, which exhibit high emissivity and stability.

title: GaN-based flip-chip LEDs with highly reflective ITO/DBR p-type and via hole-based n-type contacts for enhanced current spreading and light extraction
summary: This paper presents a novel double-layer electrode flip-chip LED (DLE-FCLED) with ITO/DBR p-type contact and via hole-based n-type contacts, which improves light extraction efficiency, current spreading, and heat dissipating. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.

title: INVESTIGATION ON CRACK ANALYSIS OF H13 FIXED DIE AND STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF MOVING DIE WITH TWO DIFFERENT MATERIALS
summary: This paper investigates the physical phenomenon of die casting for two dies (moving die and fixed die) using two different alloy materials. The numerical analysis is carried out to determine the crack formation zone by temperature distribution and structural analysis by stress-strain relationship.

title: Distributed GNE seeking under partial-decision information over networks via a doubly-augmented operator splitting approach
summary: This paper focuses on distributed computation of generalized Nash equilibrium (GNE) in games with shared coupling constraints, assuming players have only partial-decision information. The authors propose a fully distributed GNE seeking algorithm using an operator-splitting approach, which is the first such algorithm in the literature.

title: TGV-regularized inversion of the Radon transform for photoacoustic tomography
summary: This paper proposes a reconstruction method for photoacoustic tomography using total generalized variation regularization for the inversion of the Radon transform. The method is shown to be capable of artifact-free inversion and has the potential to push the limits for optical phase-contrast PAT.

title: Summation of Gaussian shifts as Jacobi's third Theta function
summary: This paper explores the connection between summation of Gaussian shifts and the solution to a Schrödinger equation, providing a concise and controllable upper bound for the saturation error in terms of the shape parameters. The results show that flatter Gaussian radial basis functions result in better approximation quality.

title: The problem of generalized D-stability in unbounded LMI regions
summary: This paper generalizes the concepts of D-stability and additive D-stability of matrices by considering a family of unbounded regions defined in terms of Linear Matrix Inequalities (LMI regions). The authors study the problem when the localization of a matrix spectrum in an unbounded LMI region is preserved under specific multiplicative and additive perturbations of the initial matrix. They provide new D-stability criteria using additive compound matrices and generalize the theory of stability with respect to LMI regions.

title: Optimal Transport, Convection, Magnetic Relaxation and Generalized Boussinesq equations
summary: This paper establishes a connection between Optimal Transport Theory and classical Convection Theory for geophysical flows, using the Angenent-Haker-Tannenbaum model to relate different variants of the Navier-Stokes-Boussinesq equations to various models involving Optimal Transport.

title: Formal Degree of Regular Supercuspidals
summary: This paper focuses on the formal degree of supercuspidal representations, a numerical invariant that generalizes the dimension of unitary supercuspidals. The authors compute the formal degrees of Yu's supercuspidal representations and verify Kaletha's regular supercuspidal L-packets satisfy the conjecture.

title: Finite-Time Stability Criteria for a Class of High-Order Fractional Cohen–Grossberg Neural Networks with Delay
summary: This paper focuses on the finite-time stability of a class of delayed fractional Cohen-Grossberg neural networks with high-order fractional derivatives. The authors develop two criteria for guaranteeing finite-time stability based on analytical techniques, which are different from earlier works.

title: Generalized Fisher-Darmois-Koopman-Pitman Theorem and Rao-Blackwell Type Estimators for Power-Law Distributions
summary: This paper generalizes the notion of sufficiency for estimation problems beyond maximum likelihood, focusing on power-law distributions and their sufficient statistics. The authors explore the relationship between sufficiency and robust inference methods, including Jones et al. likelihood function.

title: Application of the symbolic regression method for solving the inverse problem of control of the 3-RPR platform
summary: This paper focuses on finding a functional dependence between the position of a 3-RPR platform and its control. The authors use symbolic regression, specifically the network operator method, to solve the inverse problem. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.

title: Tail behavior of dependent V-statistics and its applications
summary: This paper establishes exponential inequalities and Cramer-type moderate deviation theorems for a class of V-statistics under strong mixing conditions. The theory is developed via kernel expansion based on random Fourier features, which is new and useful for handling many notorious classes of kernels.
statisticalMethods: Bernstein-type inequalities, Cramér-type moderate deviation results

title: Formation of Inter-Frame Deformation Field of Images Using Reverse Stochastic Gradient Estimation
summary: This paper investigates the effectiveness of stochastic gradient estimation for detecting motion in image sequences. It proposes two approaches to estimate inter-frame deformation fields using reverse stochastic gradient descent, and compares their efficiency with other methods.

title: PI/PID controller stabilizing sets of uncertain nonlinear systems: an efficient surrogate model-based approach
summary: This paper proposes a novel numerical strategy to efficiently compute the PID stabilizing set of uncertain nonlinear systems. The method uses an adaptive surrogate model-based approach, specifically the Monte Carlo intersite Voronoi (MiVor) scheme, which classifies the PID controller space into stable/unstable regions using the largest Lyapunov exponent (LLE). This approach is applied to the blood glucose regulation problem in type 1 diabetes patients and demonstrates robust performance.

title: Consistent Estimation of Identifiable Nonparametric Mixture Models from Grouped Observations
summary: This paper proposes an algorithm for consistently estimating identifiable nonparametric mixture models from grouped observations. The method leverages an oracle inequality for weighted kernel density estimators and provides statistical guarantees. It is shown to outperform existing methods, especially when mixture components overlap significantly.
statisticalMethods: oracle inequality for weighted kernel density estimators

title: 3D Tensor Based Nonlocal Low Rank Approximation in Dynamic PET Reconstruction
summary: This paper presents a novel tensor-based nonlocal low-rank framework for dynamic positron emission tomography (PET) reconstruction. The method efficiently combines temporal and spatial information to enhance image quality, making it a substantial contribution in the field of PET imaging.

title: On a Parabolic-Hyperbolic Filter for Multicolor Image Noise Reduction
summary: This paper proposes a novel PDE-based anisotropic filter for noise reduction in multicolor images, generalizing Nitzberg&Shiota's model. The authors derive a well-posedness theory and study the long-time behavior of their new image filter.

title: Iteratively Linearized Reweighted Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers for a Class of Nonconvex Problems
summary: This paper proposes the iteratively linearized reweighted alternating direction method of multipliers (ILR-ADMM) for solving a class of nonconvex and nonsmooth problems. The ILR-ADMM combines the iteratively reweighted strategy with the linearized ADMM, resulting in convex subproblems that can be solved efficiently. The paper provides convergence results using the Kurdyka-Lojasiewicz property and demonstrates the efficiency of the proposed algorithm through numerical examples.

title: Linear Asymptotic Convergence of Anderson Acceleration: Fixed-Point Analysis
summary: This paper studies the asymptotic convergence of Anderson acceleration (AA) for fixed-point methods, analyzing its properties and behavior. The authors investigate how AA affects the convergence speed of iterations and provide theoretical findings on its impact.

title: Existence results to a nonlinear p(k)-Laplacian difference equation
summary: This paper investigates the existence of non-trivial solutions to an anisotropic discrete nonlinear problem involving p(k)-Laplacian operator with Dirichlet boundary condition. The main technical tools applied here are the two local minimum theorems for differentiable functionals given by Bonanno.

title: Identification of Linear Systems with Multiplicative Noise from Multiple Trajectory Data
summary: This paper studies the identification of linear systems with multiplicative noise using multiple-trajectory data. The authors propose an algorithm based on the least-squares method and demonstrate its consistency under certain conditions.

title: The basins of attraction of the global minimizers of the non-convex sparse spikes estimation problem
summary: This paper studies the shape of the basin of attraction of the global minimum of a non-convex functional in the context of sparse spikes estimation. The authors provide a bound on the conditioning of the Hessian at a global minimum and an explicit shape of the basin of attraction, showing that it increases with better RIP constants.

title: SRUNet: Stacked Reversed U-shape Network for Lightweight Single Image Super-Resolution
summary: This paper proposes a stacked reversed U-shape network (SRUNet) to fully utilize multi-scale features in single image super-resolution. SRUNet consists of shallow feature extraction, stacked reversed U-shape module, multi-scale backward fusion module, and feature refinement module. The model achieves competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods and is the first attempt to employ iterative up-and-down sampling architecture in lightweight SISR models.
statisticalMethods: Extensive experimental results demonstrate the model's competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods.

title: SymPKF: a symbolic and computational toolbox for the design of parametric Kalman filter dynamics
summary: This paper introduces SymPKF, a symbolic and computational toolbox for designing parametric Kalman filter dynamics. The tool uses the Sympy library to perform symbolic computations and generate code for numerical simulations. While machine learning is not directly used in this research, it has potential applications in data assimilation and parameter estimation.

title: A linear programming-based approach to estimate discrete probability functions with given quantiles
summary: This paper presents a novel method for estimating discrete probability functions using linear programming, focusing on the maximum entropy approach with given quantiles. The proposed method is an efficient solution to the nonlinear optimization problem, outperforming generic methods in solving nonlinear programming problems.

title: A Solution Technique for L'evy Driven Long Term Average Impulse Control Problems
summary: This paper presents a step-by-step solution technique for long term average impulse control problems with L'evy processes. The authors characterize the value of the control problem as the value of a stopping problem and construct an optimal strategy from the optimizer of said stopping strategy.

title: Derivative-Free Optimization Algorithms based on Non-Commutative Maps
summary: This paper proposes a novel class of derivative-free optimization algorithms that utilize non-commutative maps to approximate the gradient of the objective function. The algorithms are inspired by continuous-time Lie bracket based methods, but with a tailored integration scheme for discrete-time optimization.

title: Use of Pupil Area and Fixation Maps to Evaluate Visual Behavior of Drivers inside Tunnels at Different Luminance Levels—A Pilot Study
summary: This study investigates the visual behavior of drivers in tunnels under different luminance levels, using pupil area and fixation maps to evaluate their gaze patterns. The research focuses on improving traffic safety in tunnels by understanding how drivers' visual features change with illumination.

title: Medications, Deep Brain Stimulation, and Other Factors Influencing Impulse Control Disorders in Parkinson's Disease
summary: This review paper examines the factors influencing impulse control disorders (ICDs) in patients with Parkinson's disease. The authors discuss various risk factors, including demographics, medical and surgical associations, premorbidities and comorbidities, family history and genetics, and personality traits. They conclude that dopamine alone cannot account for all ICDs and highlight the need for further investigation.

title: Polymer Optical Fiber Sensors in Healthcare Applications: A Comprehensive Review
summary: This paper presents a comprehensive review of polymer optical fiber sensors in healthcare applications, discussing their advantages and potential for widespread use. The authors highlight the benefits of POF sensors in various healthcare devices, including movement analysis, physiological parameters monitoring, and instrumentation of robotic devices.

title: Interpretable machine learning-derived nomogram model for early detection of diabetic retinopathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus: a widely targeted metabolomics study
summary: This paper proposes an interpretable machine learning-derived nomogram model for early detection of diabetic retinopathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus using metabolomics and clinical indicators. The model shows excellent performance in predicting DR, with AUCs of 0.99 (95% CI) in both training and testing sets.
statisticalMethods: Hosmer–Lemeshow test, receiver operating characteristic curve, decision curve analysis

title: A novel stroke risk model using machine learning techniques
summary: This paper presents a new stroke risk model developed using machine learning techniques, specifically extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost), to predict 1-year thromboembolic events in Chinese patients with atrial fibrillation. The model integrates three key variables: congestive heart failure or left ventricular dysfunction, age, and prior stroke, and outperforms the widely-used CHA2DS2-VA score in predicting low-risk patients.

title: Effectiveness and treatment moderators of internet interventions for adult problem drinking: An individual patient data meta-analysis of 19 randomised controlled trials
summary: This paper investigates the effectiveness and moderators of treatment outcomes in internet-based interventions for adult problem drinking. The study conducted a one-stage individual patient data meta-analysis (IPDMA) on 19 randomised controlled trials, including 14,198 adults at baseline. The results show that internet-based alcohol interventions are effective in reducing mean weekly alcohol consumption and achieving adherence to low-risk drinking limits, but the use of waitlist control may inflate outcomes.
statisticalMethods: linear mixed models, odds ratio (OR), number needed to treat (NNT)

title: Feasibility and acceptability of a milk and resistance exercise intervention to improve muscle function in community-dwelling older adults (MIlkMAN): Pilot study
summary: This pilot study examines the feasibility and acceptability of a milk and resistance exercise intervention to improve muscle function in community-dwelling older adults. The study found that the intervention was feasible and acceptable, but did not show significant improvements in muscle strength or function.

title: Effect of N-acetylcysteine on remission maintenance in patients with ulcerative colitis: A Randomized controlled clinical trial
summary: This study investigates the effect of N-acetylcysteine on remission maintenance in patients with ulcerative colitis. The research focuses on the antioxidant properties of NAC and its potential to prevent relapse in UC patients, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
statisticalMethods: Statistical analysis was performed using SPSS version 21, including chi-square test, independent t-test, one-way analysis of covariance (ANCOVA), Kaplan-Meier methodology, and log-rank test.

title: Deep Learning-Based Postoperative Recovery and Nursing of Total Hip Arthroplasty
summary: This paper presents a deep learning-assisted recovery and nursing system for total hip arthroplasty, utilizing Mask R-CNN to improve postoperative care. The model is trained on human hip X-ray images and can accurately identify prosthetic structures, predict complications, and assist doctors in formulating postoperative care plans.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods used: VAS index, Harris score, Barthel index

title: Exploring Sentiment and Care Management of Hospitalized Patients During the First Wave of the COVID-19 Pandemic Using Electronic Nursing Health Records: Descriptive Study
summary: This study explores the use of electronic nursing health records to analyze sentiment and care management of hospitalized patients during the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors used a descriptive study design, analyzing the textual content of electronic nursing clinical notes (ENCN) from nurses working in post-intensive care units for COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 wards. Sentiment analysis was performed using the National Research Council of Canada's Emotion Lexicon, Affin, and Bing dictionaries, revealing significant differences in sentiment between patients with COVID-19 and those without.
statisticalMethods: Statistical analysis was performed using the R package (version 3.5.1). The level of significance was established at P<.05.

title: Children’s Rare Disease Cohorts: An Integrative Research and Clinical Genomics Initiative
summary: This paper presents the Children's Rare Disease Cohorts initiative, a program at Boston Children's Hospital integrating genomic, research, and clinical data to expedite pediatric precision medicine. The authors developed a genomics learning system (GLS) for storage and use of the data, which was used to analyze clinical and research data of an additional set of 6075 exomes and 112 genomes.

title: A practical guide to preclinical systematic review and meta-analysis
summary: This paper provides a comprehensive guide to conducting preclinical systematic reviews (SRs) and meta-analyses (MAs), highlighting their importance in generating empirical evidence for robust experimental design, informing research strategy, and supporting funding applications. The authors emphasize that SRs can be conducted without machine learning expertise, using free and widely accessible software.

title: Differentiation of Cytomegalovirus and Herpes Simplex Virus Esophagitis Based on Endoscopic Findings
summary: This paper investigates the differentiation of cytomegalovirus (CMV) and herpes simplex virus (HSV) esophagitis based on endoscopic findings. The authors develop a predictive model to distinguish between the two conditions, which is challenging due to overlapping endoscopic features. The study uses logistic regression analysis and receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve analysis to evaluate the model's performance.
statisticalMethods: chi-square test, Fisher exact test, Student's t test, Mann-Whitney U test

title: Diabetic Retinopathy Detection by Image Processing Algorithms and Machine Learning Technique
summary: This paper presents a machine learning-based approach for detecting diabetic retinopathy from fundus images. The proposed system uses Support Vector Machine (SVM) classification and image processing techniques to identify microaneurysms, hemorrhages, and exudates in the retina. The method is shown to be effective in distinguishing between normal eyes, diabetic retinopathy, and Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD).

title: Toward improved endoscopic examination of urinary stones: a concordance study between endoscopic digital pictures vs microscopy
summary: This paper presents a concordance study between endoscopic and microscopic observations of urinary stones. The authors aim to improve the recognition of urinary stone morphologies using endoscopic examination, which is essential in lithiasis. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: DeepAISE -- An End-to-End Development and Deployment of a Recurrent Neural Survival Model for Early Prediction of Sepsis
summary: This paper presents DeepAISE, a recurrent neural survival model for early prediction of sepsis. The model uses clinical criteria and treatment policies to rank the relative utility of various consensus criteria through policy evaluation. The authors show that by coupling a criterion with a treatment policy, one can use the framework of Attributable Treatment Effect Estimates (ATEE) to compare the different criteria.
statisticalMethods: Survival analysis, attributable treatment effect-size estimates

title: Effects of high-intensity interval and moderate-intensity continuous aerobic exercise on diabetic obese patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease
summary: This study investigates the effects of high-intensity interval and moderate-intensity continuous aerobic exercise on diabetic obese patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. The research finds that both types of exercise reduce hepatic fat and visceral lipids, but there is no significant difference between the two groups.
statisticalMethods: Analysis of variance, paired t test

title: Long non-coding RNA profile study identifies a metabolism-related signature for colorectal cancer
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to predicting outcomes of colorectal cancer patients by identifying a metabolism-related long non-coding RNA signature. The study uses machine learning techniques to integrate clinical data and transcriptome information, resulting in a prognostic scoring system that can predict patient prognosis with high accuracy.
statisticalMethods: Pearson test, Wilcoxon test, Kruskal-Wallis test, univariate cox proportional hazards regression

title: FLAIRectomy: Resecting beyond the Contrast Margin for Glioblastoma
summary: This paper discusses the resection of peri-tumoral FLAIR signal in glioblastoma patients, which has been shown to improve survival outcomes. The authors review existing studies on the composition of peri-tumoral FLAIR and its relationship with patient survival, highlighting the importance of considering FLAIRectomy as a treatment option for GBM.

title: Identification and Analysis of Glioblastoma Biomarkers Based on Single Cell Sequencing
summary: This paper identifies biomarkers for glioblastoma tumors using single-cell RNA sequencing and computational methods. The study applies machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines, to screen core biomarkers that can distinguish between tumor cells and surrounding tissue. The results provide insights into GBM mechanisms and may be useful for diagnosis and therapy.

title: The Impact of Mind-Body Exercises on Motor Function, Depressive Symptoms, and Quality of Life in Parkinson’s Disease: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis investigates the effects of mind-body exercises (Tai Chi, Yoga, Health Qigong) on motor function, depressive symptoms, and quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease. The study finds significant improvements in motor function, depressive symptoms, and quality of life, suggesting that mind-body exercises can be an effective method for clinical exercise intervention in PD patients.
statisticalMethods: Meta-analysis using Cochrane collaboration software (Review Manager 5.3) and Stata14.0

title: Real-time Surgical Tools Recognition in Total Knee Arthroplasty Using Deep Neural Networks
summary: This paper proposes a real-time surgical tools recognition system for total knee arthroplasty using deep neural networks. The system uses a convolutional neural network (CNN) to detect surgical tools in real-time, improving the accuracy and precision of TKA procedures.

title: Advance Care Planning and Care Coordination for People With Parkinson's Disease and Their Family Caregivers—Study Protocol for a Multicentre, Randomized Controlled Trial
summary: This study evaluates the impact and feasibility of a nurse-led palliative care intervention for people with Parkinson's disease across seven European countries. The intervention focuses on Advance Care Planning (ACP) and care coordination, aiming to improve quality of life and manage end-of-life perspectives.
statisticalMethods: Mantel–Haenszel methods and multilevel logistic regression models

title: Effects of the sodium–glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor dapagliflozin in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 chronic kidney disease
summary: This paper investigates the effects of dapagliflozin, a sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor, in patients with type 2 diabetes and Stages 3b–4 chronic kidney disease. The study found that dapagliflozin did not decrease HbA1c levels but decreased UACR, BP, and body weight to a clinically meaningful extent.
statisticalMethods: Descriptive statistics were used for presenting baseline characteristics and safety data. The mean change from baseline value and 95% confidence interval (CI) were derived using a longitudinal repeated measures mixed model.

title: Evaluation of Adherence to Anti-Retroviral Treatment: Experience of SANRU, DRC
summary: This study evaluates adherence to anti-retroviral treatment (ART) in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The authors analyzed data from 2586 patients and found that 82% were adherent to ART, with a strong association between adherence and the presence of HIV care trained healthcare providers.

title: HR-Depth: High Resolution Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
summary: This paper presents HR-Depth, a self-supervised monocular depth estimation method that uses high-resolution images to improve accuracy. The authors redesign the skip connection and propose a feature fusion squeeze-and-excitation block to better fuse spatial and semantic information, achieving state-of-the-art performance with fewer parameters.
statisticalMethods: The paper uses statistical methods such as bilinear interpolation and convolutional layers.

title: Logic Writing of Chinese Declarative Sentences Relying on Marked Verb Matching Lambek Checking Algorithm
summary: This paper presents a natural language processing approach using the marked verb matching Lambek check algorithm to improve logic writing and processing of Chinese declarative sentences. The method combines word bank and statistics, enabling more accurate semantic analysis and disambiguation.

title: Measurement of Branching Fraction and Search for CP Violation in B→φφK
summary: This paper measures the branching fractions and CP-violation asymmetries in B→φφK decays using a large data sample. The results are consistent with Standard Model predictions, but an observation of large CP violation would indicate new physics beyond the Standard Model.

title: Identification and Filtering of Random Error in Fiber Optic Current Transducer
summary: This paper focuses on the random error problem of fiber-optic current transformers (FOCT) and proposes a time series modeling method to accurately detect and identify various types of random error information. The research uses Wavelet transform and Kalman filtering algorithm to suppress random errors, improving current measurement accuracy.

title: Improved Estimation of Parkinsonian Vowel Quality through Acoustic Feature Assimilation
summary: This paper investigates the use of acoustic features to predict the perceived quality of sustained vowels produced by people impaired with Parkinson's disease. The authors develop a regression model that assimilates relevant acoustic features, including recurrence period density entropy (RPDE), Gammatone frequency cepstral coefficients (GFCCs), and modulation spectrogram features, to improve estimation of PD vowel quality ratings.
statisticalMethods: Linear regression (LR) and support vector regression (SVR) models were used. Statistical methods included Pearson's correlation coefficient and Spearman's rank-order correlation.

title: Constraints on the variability of quark masses from nuclear binding
summary: This paper explores anthropic constraints on quark masses and the Higgs vacuum expectation value, using recent work on nuclear binding. The authors refine the understanding of the viable range of quark masses that follow from the existence of heavy nuclei, and discuss the implications for fundamental physics.

title: Branes, Anti-Branes and Brauer Algebras in Gauge-Gravity duality
summary: This paper proposes gauge theory operators built using a complex Matrix scalar which are dual to brane-anti-brane systems in AdS5 × S5 space-time. The authors use Brauer algebras to construct the relevant multi-trace Matrix operators and relate them to the physics of brane-anti-brane systems.

title: Speech recognition rates and acoustic analyses of English vowels produced by Korean students
summary: This paper investigates the pronunciation difficulties of English vowels in Korean students using speech recognition software. The study found that Korean students tend to experience difficulty pronouncing certain vowel pairs, and the results may provide pedagogical implications for teaching and evaluating English vowel pronunciation.
statisticalMethods: Statistical analyses were conducted on the data using R.

title: Measurement of gamma + c + X and gamma + b + X production cross sections at sqrt(s) = 1.96 TeV
summary: This paper presents the first measurements of differential gamma + c and gamma + b production cross sections at a hadron-hadron collider. The research focuses on understanding the sea quark content of the proton and gluon splitting into heavy-flavour quark pairs, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Towards the development of cascaded surface plasmon resonance POF sensors exploiting gold films and synthetic recognition elements for detection of contaminants in transformer oil
summary: This paper presents the development of a multichannel optical chemical sensor based on molecularly imprinted polymers and surface plasmon resonance in a D-shaped multimode plastic optical fiber. The sensor is designed for detection of contaminants in transformer oil, with a focus on simultaneous determination of dibenzyl disulfide (DBDS) and furfural (2-FAL). The paper explores the possibility of using gold films and synthetic recognition elements to enhance the sensitivity and selectivity of the sensor.

title: Coherent Raman Pulses with Quantum-Randomized Polarization
summary: This paper demonstrates the generation of coherent Stokes pulses with randomly-oriented linear polarizations using Raman amplification in diamond crystals. The method produces quantum-random polarization states, which are passively-generated and can be used for applications requiring high entropy rates.

title: Data-driven subspace predictive control of adaptive optics for high-contrast imaging
summary: This paper proposes a data-driven method to improve the performance of adaptive optics systems in high-contrast imaging. The proposed controller uses a closed-loop data-driven subspace identification algorithm to predict future wavefront sensor measurements, allowing for near-optimal control and a gain of several orders of magnitude in raw contrast.

title: Differential phase extraction in dual interferometers exploiting the correlation between classical and quantum sensors
summary: This paper presents an experimental demonstration of a method to extract the differential phase in dual atom interferometers, exploiting the correlation between classical and quantum sensors. The authors use a novel approach that combines the advantages of both methods, achieving optimal sensitivity in the differential phase extraction.

title: Feature enhancement for a defocusing structured-light 3-D scanning system
summary: This paper proposes a hybrid method to enhance the calibration and scanning features of a defocusing structured-light 3D scanning system. The method uses a high-order sinusoidal pattern instead of conventional sequential binary patterns, improving reprojection error.

title: Efficacy of the Radial Pair Potential Approximation for Molecular Dynamics Simulations of Dense Plasmas
summary: This paper investigates the efficacy of radial pair potential approximations in molecular dynamics simulations of dense plasmas. The authors compare three RPP models and find that force-matched RPPs are valid for simulating dense plasmas at temperatures above fractions of an eV, while the Yukawa model systematically fails at low temperatures.

title: Optical validation and characterization of Planck PSZ2 sources at the Canary Islands observatories. II. Second year of LP15 observations
summary: This paper presents the second and final year of optical follow-up observations for unidentified PSZ2 sources in the northern sky. The authors use a combination of imaging and spectroscopic data to validate cluster candidates, with a focus on improving the purity and completeness of the PSZ2 sample.

title: Optimization of Spot Efficiency of Double-Helix Point Spread Function and Its Application in Intracellular Imaging
summary: This paper proposes an iterative optimization algorithm that combines Laguerre–Gaussian modes and Zernike polynomials to optimize the double-helix point spread function, resulting in a significant improvement in imaging quality. The ML impact is substantial as it is central to the methodology.

title: The 750 GeV diphoton excess in unified $SU(2)_L\times SU(2)_R\times SU(4)$ models from noncommutative geometry
summary: This paper discusses a possible interpretation of the $750$ GeV diphoton resonance in unified $SU(2)_L\times SU(2)_R\times SU(4)$ models with gauge coupling unification, imposed by non-commutative geometry. The authors show that the observed cross sections involving the $750$ GeV diphoton resonance could be realized through a SM singlet scalar field accompanied by colored scalars in these unified models.

title: Vacuum alignment in a composite 2HDM
summary: This paper studies the vacuum structure of a composite two Higgs doublet model based on a minimal underlying theory with 3 Dirac fermions in pseudo-real representations of the condensing gauge interactions. The authors find that the most general CP-conserving vacuum is characterised by three non-vanishing angles, and discuss various mechanisms for generating the top mass.

title: Drastic suppression of superconducting $T_{c}$ by anisotropic strain near a nematic quantum critical point
summary: This paper studies the effect of anisotropic strain on superconductivity in iron-based superconductors. The authors find that anisotropic strain can suppress the superconducting critical temperature, inducing a strain-tuned superconductor to metal quantum phase transition.

title: REX: X-ray experiment on the Water Recovery Rocket
summary: This paper presents a suborbital sounding rocket mission that aimed to classify the Technology Readiness Level of onboard devices designed for space applications. The mission used X-ray telescopes and other sensors, but there is no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods being used.

title: Quantitative Matching of Forensic Evidence Fragments Utilizing 3D Microscopy Analysis of Fracture Surface Replicas
summary: This paper presents a quantitative framework for forensic comparison of fractured surfaces using 3D microscopy analysis. The authors utilize statistical decision-making tools to quantify the range of features' resolution that generic silicon-type casting materials can capture to replicate the fracture topology.

title: Impact of Warped Extra Dimensions on the Dipole Coefficients in b→sγ Transitions
summary: This paper investigates the FCNC process b → sγ in the minimal Randall-Sundrum model with a brane-localized Higgs sector. The authors derive integral expressions for the dipole coefficients using five-dimensional propagators and compare their results with those obtained in the KK-decomposed theory.

title: Deep learning‐based quantification of PET/CT prostate gland uptake: association with overall survival
summary: This paper presents a deep-learning algorithm for automated quantification of prostate cancer on PET/CT images, which shows good agreement with manual measurements and is significantly associated with overall survival. The algorithm uses a fully convolutional neural network to segment the prostate gland and estimate its volume, as well as calculate various PET-measures.
statisticalMethods: Sørensen-Dice index, univariate Cox regression model

title: Limiting Fragmentation at LHC Energies
summary: This paper investigates the validity of limiting fragmentation in relativistic heavy-ion collisions at Large Hadron Collider (LHC) energies. The authors use a phenomenological three-source relativistic diffusion model to extrapolate pseudorapidity distributions of produced charged hadrons from RHIC to LHC energies, and find that their results are compatible with the limiting-fragmentation conjecture.

title: Using In-Situ Laboratory and Synchrotron-Based X-ray Diffraction for Lithium-Ion Batteries Characterization: A Review on Recent Developments
summary: This paper reviews recent developments in using in-situ laboratory and synchrotron-based X-ray diffraction for lithium-ion battery characterization. The focus is on improving the understanding of physical and chemical changes in battery materials under working conditions, with a deep analysis of structural evolution, redox processes, and transport properties during cycling.

title: Celebrating 10th anniversary of Photoacoustics
summary: This paper celebrates the 10th anniversary of the journal Photoacoustics, highlighting its growth and impact in the field of physics. The paper discusses various research trends and emerging technologies in photoacoustics, including all-optical optoacoustic systems, laser ultrasound imaging, and advanced methods of photoacoustic microscopy.

title: The Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge (PLAsTiCC)
summary: This paper presents the PLAsTiCC challenge, an open competition to identify promising techniques for obtaining classification probabilities of transient and variable objects. The challenge aims to balance diverse science goals by engaging a broader community in probabilistic classifications, which are essential for upcoming deep photometric surveys like LSST.

title: Locating the Quad: Informality, Institutional Flexibility, and Future Alignment in the Indo-Pacific
summary: This paper examines the Quad, an informal intergovernmental organization consisting of Australia, India, Japan, and the US. The authors argue that the Quad's informality is a geopolitical necessity, allowing for coordination on security activities while maintaining equivocal positions vis-à-vis China.

title: Institutional Castling: Military Enlistment and Mass Incarceration in the United States
summary: This paper examines the historical relationship between penal confinement and military employment, highlighting how changes in social policies have affected the risk of incarceration among young black men. The authors argue that the intersection of these institutions is crucial to understanding patterns of social inequality.

title: Pile of Law: Learning Responsible Data Filtering from the Law and a 256GB Open-Source Legal Dataset
summary: This paper presents Pile of Law, a 256GB open-source legal dataset that can be used for pretraining large language models. The authors propose using legal norms to filter out private and toxic content from the dataset, providing an approach to responsible data filtering.

title: Ethical Global Citizenship Education: From Neoliberalism to a Values-Based Pedagogy
summary: This paper proposes an ethical global citizenship education framework that goes beyond neoliberal principles toward promoting social responsibility, justice, human rights, and glocal sustainability. The authors argue for a values-based pedagogy that fosters critical thinking, self-awareness, and international understanding.

title: There is No Substitute for Human Intelligence
summary: This paper explores the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and handheld devices in point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS), demonstrating its potential to improve image acquisition, diagnostic yield, and portability. The authors highlight the benefits of AI-guided software in facilitating bedside use by frontline medical personnel, particularly in settings with limited access to ultrasound expertise.

title: The Technological Construction of Sovereignty
summary: This paper explores the impact of technology on sovereignty, arguing that technological construction can redefine core aspects of state authority. The authors contend that digital technologies shape internal and external legitimacy, accountability, and transparency, and propose a dialogue between policymakers and technologists to design law and policy in alignment with sovereignty safeguards.

title: Possibilities for Modernization of Conciliation Board Procedures in the Countries of Central and Eastern Europe-Online Dispute Resolution and Electronic Communication
summary: This paper examines the role of conciliation bodies in consumer disputes, focusing on the potential for modernization through online dispute resolution and electronic communication. Although the authors mention the possibility of using artificial intelligence and other software solutions, their methodology primarily relies on traditional procedures and written communication.

title: Future of US-China Relations: Conflict, Competition or Cooperation?
summary: This paper analyzes the future nature of US-China relations using both Realism and Liberalism paradigms. The authors conclude that China's ambitions are limited, and it is unlikely to challenge US hegemony due to its relative weakness.

title: Predicting Election Outcome from Social Media Data
summary: This paper proposes a simple and straightforward technique for predicting election outcomes based on tweets counts. The authors aggregate two efficacious techniques to extract information from tweet data, counting virtual votes for each corresponding political group. The results closely match the original election findings, published by the Australian Electoral Commission.

title: Restorative Justice and its impact on Primary Schools Students of Swat, KP- Pakistan: In Psychological Perspective
summary: This paper explores the implementation of Restorative Justice in primary schools of Swat, KP-Pakistan. Despite its increasing recognition and use, there is a limited amount of research on its effect and impact. The study aims to evaluate the success of Restorative Justice in reducing misconducts among students and promoting social healing.

title: The Death of Law: Another Obituary
summary: This paper argues that the distinctive mode of judgment in modern law, known as Legal Adjudication by Judgment (LAJ), is destined for 'the dustbin of history' due to its supersession by technological management. The author contends that LAJ's emphasis on generality and abstraction is being replaced by a more nuanced approach that incorporates machine learning and artificial intelligence.
