title: The Role of Serology Testing in the Context of Immunization Policies for COVID-19 in Latin American Countries
summary: This paper reviews the role and value of serology testing in the context of COVID-19 immunization policies in Latin American countries, highlighting the barriers and challenges to its adequate use. The study finds that serology testing has not been widely adopted in the region due to various factors, including lack of infrastructure, limited resources, and conflicting guidelines.

title: Climate Change, Malthusian Catastrophe, and a Global Rule of Law
summary: This paper discusses the implications of global warming as a successor to the Malthusian Population Catastrophe, exploring the differences between two legal cultures and their applications to human life. The authors argue that the Anglophone solution is to impose a strict global Rule of Law, while the Civilian counterpart emphasizes cultivation and learning.

title: Study Protocol for “Psilocybin as a Treatment for Anorexia Nervosa: A Pilot Study”
summary: This pilot study investigates the feasibility, brain mechanisms, and preliminary outcomes of treating anorexia nervosa with psilocybin. The study aims to assess the potential efficacy of psilocybin-assisted therapy in reducing symptoms of AN, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: The effects of yoga versus stretching and resistance training exercises on psychological distress for people with mild-to-moderate Parkinson’s disease: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
summary: This paper investigates the effects of yoga on psychological wellbeing in individuals with mild-to-moderate Parkinson’s disease. The study aims to compare the outcomes of a structured mindfulness yoga program with those of stretching and resistance training exercises, focusing on psychological wellbeing, physiological wellbeing, spiritual wellbeing, and health-related quality of life.

title: Association between categorization of emotionally-charged and neutral visual scenes and parameters of event-related potentials in carriers of COMT, HTR2A, BDNF gene polymorphisms
summary: This study investigates the association between event-related potentials and categorization of visual scenes in carriers of COMT, HTR2A, BDNF gene polymorphisms. The research focuses on understanding how genetic differences affect emotional processing and neural activity.

title: Influence of Turn-Taking in Musical and Spoken Activities on Empathy and Self-Esteem of Socially Vulnerable Young Teenagers
summary: This study investigates the impact of turn-taking in musical and spoken activities on empathy and self-esteem in socially vulnerable young teenagers. The research finds that shared rhythmicity, particularly at turn transitions, is essential for successful conversation and may enhance well-being.

title: Working With the Predictable Life of Patients: The Importance of “Mentalizing Interoception” to Meaningful Change in Psychotherapy
summary: This paper explores the role of interoception and mentalizing interoception in psychotherapy, highlighting its importance for patients' emotional experience and subjective awareness. The authors argue that predictive processing can be used to understand how subjective states are inferred from sensory inputs, and how this can inform therapy.

title: Sex Classification by Resting State Brain Connectivity
summary: This paper explores the use of machine learning to classify sex based on resting state brain connectivity. The authors employ a classifier trained on one sample and tested on two independent samples, achieving high accuracy in sex classification. The study highlights the potential of multivariate analyses in identifying complex patterns of differences between sexes, moving beyond traditional group studies.

title: Multimodal Communication in Aphasia: Perception and Production of Co-speech Gestures During Face-to-Face Conversation
summary: This study investigates the role of nonverbal communication in patients with post-stroke language impairment (aphasia) and how they perceive and produce co-speech gestures during face-to-face interaction. The research found that patients with aphasia may benefit from the multimodal information provided by co-speech gestures, but there is no significant ML/AI impact on the methodology.

title: Psychosocial Wellbeing and Its' Relationship with Attachment Patterns and Academic Achievement Motivation of Foster Care Children in Save Our Soul Enfants Ethiope, Burayu Orphanage Vocational Training and Production Center
summary: This study examines the psychosocial wellbeing of foster care children in Ethiopia, focusing on its relationship with attachment patterns and academic achievement motivation. The research uses a mixed-methods approach, collecting data from 134 foster children and six foster families. The findings suggest that most children have normal symptoms of psychosocial wellbeing, but it is related to their academic achievement motivation and anxious attachment.

title: From Social Gaze to Indirect Speech Constructions: How to Induce the Impression That Your Companion Robot Is a Conscious Creature
summary: This paper explores how social gaze can be used in companion robots to create the impression of consciousness. The authors implemented different modes of social gaze behavior in a robot and evaluated its impact on human perception, finding that it can induce a feeling of eye contact and natural personal interaction.

title: Neonatal brain metabolite concentrations: Associations with age, sex, and developmental outcomes
summary: This paper examines the associations between neonatal brain metabolite concentrations and developmental outcomes in healthy newborns. The study uses multi-voxel spectroscopic imaging techniques to investigate age correlates and sex differences in metabolite concentrations across the brain. The findings indicate that postmenstrual age correlated positively with NAA concentrations, while females had higher metabolite levels than males. However, ML/AI methods are not used in this paper.

title: Evaluating Terrain Indices for Soil Moisture Mapping: A Study on DEM Resolution and User-Defined Thresholds
summary: This paper evaluates the use of terrain indices for soil moisture mapping, focusing on the impact of DEM resolution and user-defined thresholds. The authors used a combination of machine learning and traditional methods to analyze seven terrain indices at varying resolutions and thresholds, finding that Depth to Water Index (DTW) and Elevation Above Stream (EAS) performed best in their study area. However, they also highlight the challenges caused by heterogeneous soil types and the need for local knowledge when interpreting modelled results.

title: Modulation of Distinct Intrinsic Resting State Brain Networks by Acute Exercise Bouts of Differing Intensity
summary: This study investigates the effects of acute exercise bouts on resting state functional connectivity (rs-FC) in cognitive, sensorimotor, and affective networks. The authors found distinct rs-FC alterations driven by exercise intensity, with increased FC in the fronto-parietal network after low-intensity exercise and decreased FC in the sensorimotor network after high-intensity exercise.

title: Bidirectional Associations across Time between Entitativity, Positive Affect, Generosity, and Religiousness in Adolescents Training with a Religiously Affiliated Charity Marathon Team
summary: This study examines the bidirectional associations between entitativity, positive affect, generosity, and religiousness across time among adolescents and emerging adults involved in charitable marathon training. The research focuses on how charitable sporting events can promote positive psychosocial developmental outcomes, particularly in terms of generosity and religiosity.

title: The Interpeduncular-Ventral Hippocampus Pathway Mediates Active Stress Coping and Natural Reward
summary: This paper investigates the role of the interpeduncular-ventral hippocampus pathway in mediating active stress coping and natural reward. The study uses intersectional viral manipulation strategies to manipulate the function of this pathway in mice, revealing its specific involvement in mediating active coping under stress conditions and natural reward.

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Hypermobility Type: Impact of Somatosensory Orthoses on Postural Control (A Pilot Study)
summary: This study investigates the impact of somatosensory orthoses on postural control in patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Hypermobility Type. The results show that wearing somatosensory orthoses improves postural stability, especially in eyes-closed conditions.

title: Aging Agents: Cross Generational Analysis of Behavior and Need Satisfaction Among Players of Tom Clancy’s The Division 2
summary: This study examines the age and intergenerational relationships as vectors of diversity in an online multiplayer video game, Tom Clancy's The Division 2. Machine Learning algorithms were employed to analyze player behavior data, revealing significant differences in playtime, days played, and group playtime among generations.

title: Prefrontal PV interneurons facilitate attention and are linked to attentional dysfunction in a mouse model of absence epilepsy
summary: This paper investigates the role of prefrontal PV interneurons in attention and their link to attentional dysfunction in a mouse model of absence epilepsy. The study uses a combination of slice physiology, fiber photometry, electrocorticography (ECoG), optogenetics, and behavior to examine the relationship between PVIN activity and attentional performance.
statisticalMethods: The study used statistical methods such as two-way ANOVA, paired t test, and linear regression model to analyze the data.

title: Fictionalism of Anticipation
summary: This paper explores the concept of anticipation in various fields, including psychology, philosophy, and biology. The author argues that traditional frameworks of anticipation are limited and proposes a fictionalist approach to understanding anticipatory behavior. While machine learning and artificial intelligence are not explicitly used in this paper, the discussion on cognitive processes and anticipatory systems touches on related concepts.

title: Study of detecting behavioral signatures within DeepFake videos
summary: This paper investigates the possibility of detecting DeepFakes by analyzing behavioral signatures in video. The authors propose a method to distinguish between real and fake videos based on the speaker's behavior, rather than just visual appearance.

title: Verbal and Nonverbal Mismatch Negativity in Children with Typical Development: Variables Analysis
summary: This study analyzed the influence of ear, gender, and age variables on mismatch negativity (MMN) in children with typical development. The MMN was recorded using verbal and nonverbal stimuli, providing reference values for children aged 5-11 years.

title: Representational unification in cognitive science: Is embodied cognition a unifying perspective?
summary: This paper defends a novel, multidimensional account of representational unification, arguing that embodied cognition contributes to unification even if it fails to offer a grand unification of cognitive science. The authors propose an alternative framework for evaluating research programs, focusing on the importance of unification and problem-solving in scientific progress.

title: Assessing Suicide Risk and Emotional Distress in Chinese Social Media: A Text Mining and Machine Learning Study
summary: This study explores the use of computerized language analysis methods to assess suicide risk and emotional distress in Chinese social media users. The researchers used machine learning algorithms to analyze Weibo posts and identified language markers associated with suicide risk and emotional distress. While the results show promise, further optimization is needed for real-life applications.
statisticalMethods: Logistic regression and support vector machine (SVM) models were used to analyze the data

title: The Preliminary Efficacy of a Program to Facilitate Benefit Finding for People with Mental Illness: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial in Japan
summary: This paper examines the preliminary efficacy of a new intervention program to facilitate benefit finding for people with mental illness. The program combines cognitive-behavioral stress management and own experiences, including what was found or realized through their lives since the onset of mental illness. However, the study did not find significant differences over time by groups, but medium to large effects in each scale or at least one subscale were observed.

title: Money or smiles: Independent ERP effects of associated monetary reward and happy faces
summary: This paper investigates the neural correlates of processing facial expressions of emotion and neutral faces associated with motivational salience. The study uses event-related brain potentials (ERPs) to examine how happy facial expressions and monetary reward impact different stages of face processing.

title: Simple Classification of the Alzheimer’s Severity in Supporting Strengthening the Diagnosis of Patients based on ROC Diagram
summary: This paper presents a simple classification method for determining the severity of Alzheimer's disease using Receiver Operating Characteristics (ROC) curves based on Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) values. The proposed method is designed to overcome limitations in developing countries where MRI machines and high-resolution images are scarce, and neurologists are limited in number.

title: Shortening Fermentation Period and Quality Improvement of Fermented Fish, Chouguiyu, by Co-inoculation of Lactococcus lactis M10 and Weissella cibaria M3
summary: This study investigates the effect of co-inoculation of Lactococcus lactis M10 and Weissella cibaria M3 on the quality improvement and fermentation period shortening of Chouguiyu, a traditional fermented fish. The results show that co-inoculation can promote flavor formation and improve product quality, with a 29% reduction in fermentation time.

title: Changes in the Quality Attributes of Selected Long-Life Food at Four Different Temperatures over Prolonged Storage
summary: This study investigates the changes in quality attributes of long-life food stored at four different temperatures over a two-year period. The research focuses on the effects of storage temperature on the microbiological, chemical, textural, and sensory properties of canned and dehydrated foods.

title: Yield Response of Winter Squash to Irrigation Regime and Planting Density
summary: This paper investigates the yield response of winter squash to irrigation regime and planting density in western Oregon. The study found that planting density impacted fruit weight, number of fruit per hectare, and number of fruit per plant, but did not impact yield statistically. The results suggest that farmers can manipulate squash fruit size to suit market preferences by changing planting density.

title: Developing scoring functions to assess soil quality at a regional scale in rangelands of SW Spain
summary: This paper presents a methodology for assessing soil quality at a regional scale using scoring functions. The authors developed standard scoring functions (SSFs) to standardize ten indicators of soil quality, including sand, silt, clay, and others. They used multivariate techniques such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) to calculate weighting factors for each indicator. The SSFs were applied to 194 soil profiles in the Extremadura region of Spain, resulting in two regional maps of soil quality.
statisticalMethods: Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP)

title: Optimization of Pectin Enzymatic Extraction from Malus domestica ‘Fălticeni’ Apple Pomace with Celluclast 1.5L
summary: This paper optimizes pectin extraction from apple pomace using Celluclast 1.5L, a commercially available enzyme preparation. The study uses response surface methodology to investigate the effects of temperature, time, and enzyme dose on pectin yield and composition.

title: Esophageal groove dysfunction: a cause of ruminal bloat in newborn calves
summary: This paper investigates the causes of ruminal bloat in newborn calves, specifically focusing on esophageal groove dysfunction. The authors present a case study of a 10-day-old calf that developed severe abdominal distention and was treated with rumenostomy to prevent recurrence.

title: The Effect of Topical Anaesthesia on the Cortisol Responses of Calves Undergoing Dehorning
summary: This study investigates the effect of topical anaesthesia on cortisol responses in calves undergoing dehorning. The researchers found that while the topical anaesthetic reduced wound sensitivity, it had no significant impact on cortisol concentrations.

title: Comparative Antimicrobial Effectiveness of Two Medicated Soaps with Herbal Soap from Morinda morindoides (Rubiaceae) against Skin Pathogens
summary: This paper investigates the antimicrobial effectiveness of two medicated soaps and a herbal soap formulated with fat extracted from Morinda morindoides against skin pathogens. The study found that all three soaps have antimicrobial activity, but the herbal soap was more effective than the medicated soaps.

title: A seven-gene-deleted African swine fever virus is safe and effective as a live attenuated vaccine in pigs
summary: This paper presents the development of a live attenuated vaccine against African swine fever (ASF) using a seven-gene-deleted virus. The study demonstrates that the vaccine is safe and effective in pigs, providing complete protection against lethal ASFV challenge.

title: Integrating Ecosystem Services Supply, Demand and Flow in Ecological Compensation: A Case Study of Carbon Sequestration Services
summary: This paper focuses on the integration of ecosystem services supply, demand, and flow in ecological compensation. It uses a case study of carbon sequestration services in Yantai to assess the ecological benefits and measure the amount of ecological compensation. The study combines physical measurement and monetary measurement from the perspective of ecosystem services supply and demand.

title: Nutritional, Functional, and Technological Characterization of a Novel Gluten- and Lactose-Free Yogurt-Style Snack Produced With Selected Lactic Acid Bacteria and Leguminosae Flours
summary: This paper presents a novel biotechnological protocol for producing a gluten-free, lactose-free yogurt-style snack using selected lactic acid bacteria and leguminosae flours. The study focuses on the nutritional, functional, and sensory properties of the fermented snack, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: High-Altitude Genetic Selection and Genome-Wide Association Analysis of Yield-Related Traits in Elymus sibiricus L. Using SLAF Sequencing
summary: This study investigates the genetic adaptations of Elymus sibiricus L. to high-altitude environments using SLAF sequencing and genome-wide association analysis. The research identifies key genes involved in response to UV radiation, flavonoid, and anthocyanin biosynthesis, and provides insights into hub genes controlling plant height traits.

title: The Effect of K-Carrageenan Addition to the Characteristics of Jicama Starch-Based Edible Coating and Its Potential Application on The Grapevine
summary: This paper investigates the effect of k-carrageenan addition to jicama starch-based edible coating on its physical and chemical characteristics, as well as its potential application on grapevine. The study finds that k-carrageenan significantly influences the thickness, moisture content, tensile strength value, and WVTR value of the produced edible coating.

title: Assessing functional properties of rapeseed protein concentrate versus isolate for food applications
summary: This paper compares the functional properties of rapeseed protein concentrates and isolates, exploring their potential applications in food industry. The study focuses on the effects of different processing conditions on the techno-functional properties of rapeseed materials, including rheological properties, water binding capacity, and particle hydration.

title: Parasitic Contamination of Fresh Vegetables in Open Air Markets of Aksum, Ethiopia
summary: This study assesses the parasitic contamination level of fresh vegetables in open air markets of Aksum, Ethiopia. The research focuses on identifying factors associated with vegetable contamination and determining the prevalence of parasites in various vegetable samples. Machine learning or AI methods are not used in this paper.

title: Advanced Characterization of Monoﬂoral Honeys from Romania
summary: This paper focuses on the characterization of monoﬂoral honeys from Romania using various analytical methods, including pollen analysis, FT-IR spectroscopy, and rheological properties. The study aims to determine the botanical origin of seven samples of monoﬂoral honey based on their physicochemical characteristics.
statisticalMethods: ANOVA using Statgraphics Centurion XIX software

title: Overexpression of a Novel Apple NAC Transcription Factor Gene, MdNAC1, Confers the Dwarf Phenotype in Transgenic Apple (Malus domestica)
summary: This paper investigates the function of MdNAC1, a novel NAC transcription factor gene in apple, and its role in plant dwarfism. The overexpression of MdNAC1 leads to a dwarf phenotype in transgenic apple plants, with shorter stems, roots, and leaf areas. The study reveals that MdNAC1 regulates the biosynthesis of ABA and BR, providing new insights into dwarfism.

title: Wheat CBL-interacting protein kinase 25 negatively regulates salt tolerance in transgenic wheat
summary: This paper investigates the role of TaCIPK25 in regulating salt response in wheat. The study found that overexpression of TaCIPK25 resulted in hypersensitivity to Na+ and superfluous accumulation of Na+ in transgenic wheat lines, indicating a negative regulation of salt tolerance.

title: A strategy for qualitative and quantitative profiling of glycyrrhiza extract and discovery of potential markers by fingerprint-activity relationship modeling
summary: This study evaluates the quality consistency of glycyrrhiza extract and explores anti-oxidant components using chromatographic fingerprint and bioactivity evaluation. The research uses machine learning methods to analyze HPLC fingerprints, but ML is not central to the methodology.

title: Creating functional foodstuffs from high-technological larval raw materials
summary: This paper explores the development of new functional food products using apiproducts from drone larvae, which are rich in high-grade protein and biologically active substances. The research aims to address the global problem of food shortages and nutritional deficiencies by enriching food products with vital nutrients.

title: Adaption of Wheat Genotypes to Drought Stress
summary: This paper investigates the adaptability and suitability of six wheat genotypes under harsh drought conditions. The study uses phenotypic markers to screen for drought-tolerant wheat genotypes, with a focus on morphological parameters such as stem length, spike length, and awns length.

title: Analysis of Intensity, Duration, and Frequency Rain Daily of Java Island Using Mononobe Method
summary: This paper analyzes rainfall intensity in Java Island using the Mononobe method, aiming to determine short-term rain duration and frequency. The study uses annual rainfall data from 2005-2019 for six provinces in Java, calculating daily rainfall intensity and return periods. The results show that West Java Province has high rainfall compared to other provinces, while Banten Province has the lowest rainfall.

title: Asymmetric Reciprocal Crossing Behavior of an Andean Blueberry (V. meridionale) × Lingonberry (V. vitis-idaea) Hybrid
summary: This paper investigates the asymmetric reciprocal crossing behavior of a tetraploid hybrid between Andean blueberry (V. meridionale) and lingonberry (V. vitis-idaea). The study focuses on the fertility and crossing behavior of this hybrid, exploring its potential for breeding highbush blueberries.

title: Fine mapping qGL2H, a major locus controlling grain length in barley (Hordeum vulgare L.)
summary: This paper focuses on fine mapping a major grain length QTL, qGL2H, in barley. The study uses a doubled haploid population and extensive genotypic and phenotypic data to identify a 140.9 Kb region containing three genes that contribute to grain length and yield.

title: Heats of Combustion Representative of Carbohydrate Mass Contained in Fruits, Vegetables, or Cereals
summary: This paper focuses on the measurement of heat of combustion for six carbohydrates (glucose, fructose, sucrose, maltose, starch, and cellulose) to improve the estimation of metabolizable energy. The study uses a calorimetric method to measure the heat of combustion, with results showing that Atwater's value overestimates the heat of combustion in vegetable source foods.

title: Hypoxia Stress Modifies Na+/K+-ATPase, H+/K+-ATPase, Na+/NH4+-ATPase, and nkaα1 Isoform Expression in the Brain of Immune-Challenged Air-Breathing Fish
summary: This paper explores how hypoxia stress and immune challenges affect ion transporter functions in the brain of air-breathing fish, with a focus on Na+/K+-ATPase (NKA) and its isoforms. The study finds that NKA activity is modified in response to both hypoxia stress and immune challenges, indicating a role for these transporters in coordinating neuronal functions during stress.

title: 6-Thioguanine blocks SARS-CoV-2 replication by inhibition of PLpro
summary: This paper investigates the antiviral properties of 6-Thioguanine, a generic drug that inhibits SARS-CoV-2 replication by blocking the activity of PLpro. The study shows that 6-Thioguanine is effective in inhibiting viral replication and polyprotein cleavage, making it a potential therapeutic option for COVID-19.

title: MicroRNA-375 suppresses esophageal cancer cell growth and invasion by repressing metadherin expression
summary: This paper investigates the role of microRNA-375 in esophageal cancer progression. MicroRNA-375 is found to be downregulated in clinical esophageal cancer tissues and suppresses cell growth and invasion by repressing metadherin expression.
statisticalMethods: one-way analysis of variance test followed by Tukey's multiple comparison test or an independent sample t-test

title: Antimicrobial potency, prevention ability, and killing efficacy of daptomycin-loaded versus vancomycin-loaded β-tricalcium phosphate/calcium sulfate for methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus biofilms
summary: This paper investigates the antimicrobial potency and efficacy of daptomycin-loaded versus vancomycin-loaded β-tricalcium phosphate/calcium sulfate against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) biofilms. The study compares the elution kinetics, prevention assays, and killing effects of daptomycin and vancomycin in combination with gentamicin, loaded with either β-tricalcium phosphate/calcium sulfate or calcium sulfate.

title: Chassis engineering of Escherichia coli for trans‐4‐hydroxy‐l‐proline production
summary: This paper presents a chassis engineering strategy to optimize the catalytic performance of E. coli for trans-4-hydroxy-l-proline (Hyp) production. The authors use metabolic engineering to combine central carbon metabolism with enzymatic transformation, establishing an interconnection between a-ketoglutarate and Hyp synthesis. They demonstrate that this approach enables efficient production of Hyp, with the engineered strain producing up to 49.8 g/l in a 5-l fermenter.

title: An Exon-Specific Small Nuclear U1 RNA (ExSpeU1) Improves Hepatic OTC Expression in a Splicing-Defective spf/ash Mouse Model of Ornithine Transcarbamylase Deficiency
summary: This paper explores the use of ExSpeU1, an exon-specific small nuclear U1 RNA, to improve hepatic OTC expression in a splicing-defective spf/ash mouse model of ornithine transcarbamylase deficiency. The study demonstrates that ExSpeU1 can partially rescue OTC expression by interacting with the spliceosome and rescuing proper exon definition.
statisticalMethods: The study used RT-PCR and sequencing to evaluate the splicing patterns of mouse OTC alternative transcripts.

title: A case-control study of rheumatoid arthritis identifies an associated single nucleotide polymorphism in the NCF4 gene
summary: This paper investigates the genetic association between rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and the NADPH-oxidase complex, identifying a single nucleotide polymorphism in the NCF4 gene associated with RA. The study uses a candidate gene approach to examine the role of ROS production in the development of RA.
statisticalMethods: Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium analysis and single marker analysis

title: Longitudinal imaging of individual olfactory sensory neurons in situ
summary: This paper presents a novel experimental preparation for longitudinal imaging of individual olfactory sensory neurons in living animals. The approach combines a thinned-skull technique with chronic coverslip implantation, allowing for repeated in vivo measurements of sensory neuron activity over weeks to months. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Parasitism of Adult Pentatomidae by Tachinidae in Soybean in the North Central Region of the United States
summary: This study examines the parasitism of stink bugs by tachinids in soybean fields across nine states in the North Central Region. The research focuses on characterizing the level of parasitism and its impact on stink bug populations, with implications for biological control.
statisticalMethods: binomial response using bias-reduced generalized linear models (BRGLM)

title: Microtubule-associated IQD9 guides cellulose synthase velocity to shape seed mucilage
summary: This paper investigates the role of microtubule-associated proteins in shaping seed mucilage. The authors identify IQD9 and KLCR1 as essential for maintaining cellulose synthase velocity, but do not employ machine learning or AI methods.

title: Endoplasmic reticulum stress contributed to inflammatory bowel disease by activating p38 MAPK pathway
summary: This paper investigates the role of endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), focusing on its impact on chemokine expression. The study finds that ER stress promotes inflammatory response in IBD, and this effect may be mediated by the activation of p38 MAPK signaling pathway.
statisticalMethods: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis

title: A Biosensor Platform for Metal Detection Based on Enhanced Green Fluorescent Protein
summary: This paper presents a novel biosensor platform for metal detection based on enhanced green fluorescent protein (eGFP). The authors engineered eGFP by inserting metal-binding loops (MBLs) between the N-terminal and C-terminal regions, enabling it to detect cadmium ions. The study demonstrates the potential of this approach for developing new biosensors to target various environmental pollutants.

title: Methanolic Extract of Plumbago Zeylanica - A Remarkable Antibacterial Agent Against Many Human and Agricultural Pathogens
summary: This paper investigates the antimicrobial and cytotoxic activities of Plumbago zeylanica. The methanolic extracts of the plant show remarkable antibacterial activity against various human and agricultural pathogens, but no significant cytotoxicity is observed in cancer cell lines.

title: Vitamin D receptor (VDR) gene FokI, BsmI, ApaI, and TaqI polymorphisms and osteoporosis risk: a meta-analysis
summary: This paper performs a meta-analysis to investigate the association between VDR gene polymorphisms and osteoporosis risk. The study finds no significant association in most genetic models, but identifies a significant association between the recessive model of TaqI polymorphism in the Caucasian population and osteoporosis risk.
statisticalMethods: Odds ratio (OR) with corresponding 95% confidence intervals (CI)

title: Long noncoding RNA GK-IT1 promotes esophageal squamous cell carcinoma by regulating MAPK1 phosphorylation
summary: This study investigates the role of long noncoding RNA GK-IT1 in promoting esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) progression. The research reveals that GK-IT1 competitively binds to MAPK1, preventing its interaction with DUSP6 and leading to activation of the ERK/MAPK pathway, thereby promoting ESCC progression.
statisticalMethods: Kaplan-Meier survival analysis, univariate Cox analysis

title: Caesalpinia sappan L. Wood is a Potential Source of Natural Phosphodiesterase-1 Inhibitors
summary: This study evaluates the inhibitory activity of Caesalpinia sappan L. wood extract and its fractions against phosphodiesterase-1 (PDE1) in vitro, with a focus on developing natural PDE1 inhibitors for cognitive enhancement.
statisticalMethods: one-way ANOVA and post hoc analysis with Bonferroni tests

title: Innovation in biosafety oversight: The Harvard Catalyst Common Reciprocal IBC Reliance Authorization Agreement
summary: This paper presents a collaborative model for Institutional Biosafety Committee (IBC) review, allowing one or more institutions to cede IBC review to a reviewing IBC. The model aims to reduce administrative burden and increase efficiency in multi-institutional research involving recombinant or synthetic nucleic acids.

title: Obstacles and Recommendations for Clinical Translation of Nanoparticle System-Based Targeted Alpha-Particle Therapy
summary: This paper discusses the challenges and limitations of translating nanoparticle-based targeted alpha-particle therapy (TAT) into clinical practice. The authors highlight the need for improved understanding of α-particle emitters, their production methods, and their incorporation into nanoparticles.

title: The complex relationship between Immunosenescence and Inflammaging: Special issue on the New Biomedical Perspectives
summary: This paper explores the complex relationship between immunosenescence and inflammaging, two processes that contribute to aging-related diseases. The authors discuss how these processes are interconnected and how they impact human health, but do not employ machine learning or AI methods in their research.

title: The TLR7 ligand R848 prevents mouse graft-versus-host disease and cooperates with anti-interleukin-27 antibody for maximal protection and regulatory T-cell upregulation
summary: This paper investigates the use of R848, a pharmacological Toll-like receptor 7 (TLR7) ligand, to prevent graft-versus-host disease in mice. The study finds that R848 treatment significantly improves survival rates and reduces morbidity in non-conditioned graft-versus-host disease models. However, no machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are used in this research.

title: Innovative Approach to Fast Electron Microscopy Using the Example of a Culture of Virus-Infected Cells: An Application to SARS-CoV-2
summary: This paper presents an innovative approach to fast electron microscopy using a culture of virus-infected cells, specifically SARS-CoV-2. The methodology involves in-well flat embedding and plane sectioning of virus-infected cells, allowing for the study of ultrastructural findings such as cell-cell interactions and baso-apical cellular organization related to the virus infectious cycle.

title: Phenotypic and Functional Consequences of PLT Binding to Monocytes and Its Association with Clinical Features in SLE
summary: This paper investigates the phenotypic and functional consequences of platelet (PLT) binding to monocytes in healthy donors (HD) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) patients. The study found that PLTs can modulate the immune system through interaction with immune cells, and this effect may be highlighted by an increased binding of PLTs to monocytes in autoimmune conditions.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods were used, including unpaired t-test, Mann-Whitney test, Spearman's correlation, and Pearson's correlation.

title: A Master Equation Approach to Actin Polymerization Applied to Endocytosis in Yeast
summary: This paper presents a Master Equation approach to calculating polymerization dynamics and force generation by branched actin networks at membranes. The method is applied to endocytosis in yeast, where it is used to treat the dynamics of actin polymerization and force generation during invagination.

title: Antibody-Drug Conjugate Payloads; Study of Auristatin Derivatives
summary: This paper investigates the structure-activity relationships (SAR) of novel auristatins with the goal of applying these to next generation antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The authors synthesize and test several P5 amine-containing auristatins based on the auristatin PYE scaffold, demonstrating potent activity against cancer cell lines. The study highlights the importance of hydrophilicity in reducing protein aggregation and clearance rates of ADCs.

title: Exploring the Human Microbiome: The Potential Future Role of Next-Generation Sequencing in Disease Diagnosis and Treatment
summary: This paper reviews the role of the microbiome as a therapeutic agent and its significance in human health and disease, discussing advances in high-throughput sequencing technologies for surveying host-microbe interactions. The authors highlight the importance of understanding host-microbe interactions to determine diagnosis and treatment of diseases.

title: APPlIed Government S’ StrAteGIeS for brAin drAIn PreventIon
summary: This paper proposes a regulatory framework for brain drain prevention, focusing on government policies and strategies to encourage the return of highly skilled workers. The research explores various approaches used by different countries, including financial incentives, technology parks, innovation hubs, and talent markets.

title: Owner’s Risk Management System
summary: This paper focuses on the development of an effective owner's risk management system, which is essential for business owners to identify and mitigate potential risks. The study emphasizes the importance of a well-defined business model and value chain in minimizing ownership risks.

title: Implementing the Safety Culture Improves the Autonomous Ships Prosperity
summary: This paper explores the importance of implementing a safety culture in the maritime industry to reduce accidents and improve prosperity. The authors discuss the concept of safety culture, its components, and how it can be measured. They also examine the role of human factors in maritime accidents and propose strategies for improving safety management systems.

title: The Mediating Role of Job Involvement between Job Satisfaction and Organizational Commitment in a Small and Medium Sized Business Enterprise
summary: This paper examines the relationship among job satisfaction, job involvement, and organizational commitment in a small and medium-sized business enterprise. The study investigates whether job involvement can mediate the impact of job satisfaction on employee organizational commitment. Results indicate that job satisfaction is a good predictor of organizational commitment and job involvement, and that job involvement significantly mediates the impact of job satisfaction on employee organizational commitment.

title: Human Resource Development of Vietnam Manufacturing Industry. Support from Japanese Organizations and Firms
summary: This paper examines the human resource development in Vietnam's manufacturing industry, focusing on the relationship between skills obtained in the workplace and those through higher education. The research highlights the shortage of technical skills among Vietnamese labor, with around 80% lacking any technical training. The study aims to illustrate the situation of skilled workers in Vietnam's manufacturing industry and discusses how cooperation with foreign organizations and firms can boost the workforce's skills.

title: The Effect of Boredom Proneness on Smartphone Addiction and Impulse Purchasing: A Field Study with Young Consumers in Turkey
summary: This paper investigates the relationship between boredom proneness, impulse purchasing, and smartphone addiction among young consumers. The study uses a survey of 313 students to examine how boredom affects consumer behavior, finding that boredom is associated with increased impulse purchasing and smartphone addiction.
statisticalMethods: exploratory factor analysis, coefficient alphas, regression analysis

title: Mechanism for collective property sharing in mixed marriage
summary: This paper discusses the mechanism of sharing joint assets for mixed marriage partners, focusing on Indonesian husbands or wives in mixed marriages. The research uses a normative approach and statutory method to analyze the applicable provisions regarding land ownership. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Human–Automation Interaction in Self-Organizing Sociotechnical Systems
summary: This paper discusses the importance of self-organization in sociotechnical systems, where human and automation interaction is crucial for dealing with complexity. The authors argue that traditional models of human-automation interaction are insufficient and propose a new approach based on the concept of self-organization.

title: Management of innovation processes at the enterprises of the construction materials industry
summary: This paper focuses on developing a methodical approach to managing the life cycle of innovations in industrial enterprises. The research aims to improve the efficiency of economic activity by intensifying innovation development processes. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Innovative Providing in Enterprise Modernization Processes
summary: This paper discusses the challenges of modernizing enterprises in Ukraine, highlighting the need for a comprehensive approach to upgrading equipment and management processes. The authors emphasize the importance of scientific and technological progress in enterprise development, with a focus on energy efficiency and environmental sustainability.

title: CROSS-CULTURAL COMMUNICATION COMPETENCY AMONG MANAGERS: A STUDY ON ORGANIZATIONS IN MALAYSIA
summary: This paper investigates the cross-cultural communication competency among managers in organizations in Malaysia. The study uses a qualitative approach, conducting focus groups with senior management levels to analyze the competencies needed for effective cross-cultural communication. The research highlights the importance of recognizing and managing cultural diversity in the workplace, as it can have both positive and negative impacts on organizational performance.

title: Optimum Design of a Composite Optical Receiver by Taguchi and Fuzzy Logic Methods
summary: This paper investigates the design of a composite optical receiver for indoor visible light communication (VLC) systems, optimizing multiple performance characteristics using the Taguchi and fuzzy logic combination method. The proposed receiver has improved characteristics compared to traditional designs.

title: Simulation and identification of foodborne outbreaks in a large supermarket consumer purchase dataset
summary: This paper presents a method for simulating and identifying foodborne outbreaks using Consumer Purchase Data (CPD) from supermarket chains. The authors developed an automated logistic regression procedure to identify outbreak vehicles with high accuracy, outperforming traditional questionnaire-based methods.

title: The Investigation of the Relationship Between Sustainable Supply Chain Management and Sustainable Competitive Advantage According to the Mediating Role of Innovation and Sustainable Process Management
summary: This paper examines the mediating role of innovation and sustainable process management on the relationship between sustainable supply chain management and sustainable competitive advantage. The study uses structural equations model and partial least squares approach to analyze data from 20 companies involved in banking equipment production, finding a positive and significant relationship between sustainable supply chain management and sustainable competitive advantage.
statisticalMethods: structural equations model and partial least squares

title: Prevention Village Fund Fraud in Indonesia: Moral Sensitivity as a Moderating Variable
summary: This study examines the effectiveness of internal control systems, appropriate compensation, and village apparatus competency in preventing village fund fraud. Moral sensitivity is introduced as a moderating variable to strengthen the relationship between these factors.

title: Lean Manufacturing Tools Applied to Material Flow and Their Impact on Economic Sustainability
summary: This paper investigates the relationship between lean manufacturing (LM) tools and economic sustainability in the maquiladora industry. It analyzes three LM tools: 5S, SMED, and continuous flow, and their impact on material flow throughout production systems.

title: An innovation intermediary for Nairobi, Kenya: Designing student-centric services for university-industry collaboration
summary: This paper examines the case of creating a student-centric innovation intermediary in Nairobi, Kenya. The research focuses on designing services for university-industry collaboration and aims to contribute to transferring best practices from industrialized countries to emerging economies.

title: Determinants of Sukuk Issuers’ Financial Stability: Evidence from Malaysia
summary: This paper explores the relationship between Sukuk issuers' financial stability and their characteristics in Malaysia. The study uses a dataset of 61 listed companies that have issued Sukuk from 1997 to 2017, and finds that Sukuk can promote firms' financial stability. However, the role of machine learning or AI methods is not mentioned in the paper.

title: Partnership between Irkutsk National Research Technical University and Scientific production corporation "Irkut" for high-tech aircraft production
summary: This paper describes the partnership between Irkutsk National Research Technical University and Scientific production corporation "Irkut" for creating high-tech aircraft production technologies. The research focuses on optimizing manufacturing processes, improving productivity, and reducing costs through the development of new technologies and equipment.

title: Risk, uncertainty and ambiguity amid Covid-19: A multi-national analysis of international travel intentions
summary: This paper analyzes how Covid-19 affects individuals' international tourism intentions, focusing on risk tolerance and competence to manage risks. It provides a novel analysis of risk, disaggregating it into general, domain-specific (tourism), and situational (Covid-19) aspects. The study uses a large sample from top five tourism source markets and examines the influence of socio-demographic and socio-economic characteristics.

title: The Effect of Liquidity, Solvency and Activities on Profitability in Saving and Loan Cooperatives (SLC) in Klungkung Regency, Bali, Indonesia
summary: This paper examines the effect of liquidity, solvency, and activities on profitability in Saving and Loan Cooperatives (SLC) in Klungkung Regency, Bali, Indonesia. The study uses secondary data with multiple linear regression analysis to determine the relationship between these factors and profitability. The results show that liquidity has no significant effect on profitability, while solvency has a significant negative effect.

title: Putting critical realism to use in ICT4D research: Reflections on practice
summary: This paper presents the author's reflections on adopting critical realist assumptions in information and communication technologies for development (ICT4D) research. The author explores the concept of generative mechanisms, which are central to critical realism, and discusses their application in ICT4D research.

title: The Effect of Corporate Social Responsibility and Firm Size Disclosure on Asymmetry Information in Companies Listed on Indonesia Stock Exchange
summary: This paper examines the effect of corporate social responsibility (CSR) and firm size disclosure on information asymmetry in companies listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. The study uses a simple regression analysis to test the hypothesis that CSR disclosure has a negative influence on information asymmetry, while firm size has a positive influence. The results show that CSR disclosure has a significant negative effect on information asymmetry, but firm size does not have a significant effect.

title: Behavioral Bias in Individual Investment Decisions: Is It a Common Phenomenon in Stock Markets?
summary: This paper investigates the impact of behavioral biases on individual investment decision making in an African developing country, Sudan. The study employs a cross-sectional survey design and analytical methods to collect data from 203 individual investors, providing evidence that behavioral biases play a noticeable role in individual investment decision making process.

title: Institutions or Contingencies? A Cross-Country Analysis of Management Tool Use by Public Sector Executives
summary: This paper investigates the determinants of management tool use in public organizations, drawing on normative isomorphism and contingency theory. The study uses a large-N survey of 4,533 central government executives from 18 European countries to examine the role of organizational context and executive characteristics in management tool adoption.

title: Trace-level detection of sulfonamide antibiotics using quaternary ammonium polymeric ionic liquid-based effervescence-enhanced dispersive solid-phase extraction followed by LC-DAD analysis in environmental waters
summary: This paper presents a novel method for trace-level detection of sulfonamide antibiotics in environmental waters using quaternary ammonium polymeric ionic liquid-based effervescence-enhanced dispersive solid-phase extraction followed by LC-DAD analysis. The method integrates concentration, extraction, and quick dispersion into one synchronous step, providing satisfactory analytical indicators for trace-level SAs detection.

title: Complexes with Atomic Gold Ions: Efficient Bis-Ligand Formation
summary: This paper investigates the formation of complexes between atomic gold ions and various ligands, including rare gases and molecules. The research focuses on understanding the chemical reactivity of gold atoms or cations and their interactions with different ligands.

title: Chromium-catalyzed cyclopropanation of alkenes with bromoform
summary: This paper presents a chromium-catalyzed cyclopropanation reaction of alkenes with bromoform, achieving high yields and selectivity. The reaction mechanism is investigated, and the role of the organosilicon reductant in generating a catalytically active species is discussed.

title: Chemical Composition and Biological Activities of Endophytic Fungus Talaromyces Wortmannii LGT-4, Cultured in CYM Medium
summary: This paper investigates the chemical composition and biological activities of endophytic fungus Talaromyces wortmannii LGT-4, cultured in CYM medium. The study isolates nine compounds with unique structures and evaluates their monoamine oxidase and phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3Kα) inhibitory activities.

title: Electrochemical Synthesis and Electro-Optical Properties of Dibenzothiophene/Thiophene Conjugated Polymers With Stepwise Enhanced Conjugation Lengths
summary: This paper explores the electrochemical synthesis and electro-optical properties of conjugated polymers with stepwise enhanced conjugation lengths. The study focuses on the relationship between main chain conjugation length and electrochromic properties, as well as the electrochemical redox activity and stability of the conjugated polymer.

title: Nanoparticle Conjugates of Selenium Compounds: Preparation, Characterisation and Electron Transfer
summary: This paper explores the conjugation of selenium compounds with gold nanoparticles (GNPs) and magnetic nanoparticles (MNPs), demonstrating enhanced electron transfer ability and antioxidant properties. The research focuses on modulating the redox state of organoselenium compounds by conjugating them to inorganic nanoparticles, providing new avenues for delivering these compounds.

title: The Synthesis of a Novel Azo Dyes and Study of Photocatalytic Degradation
summary: This paper focuses on the synthesis of novel azo dyes and their photocatalytic degradation using titanium dioxide (TiO2) and zinc oxide (ZnO). The study finds that TiO2 exhibits higher photocatalytic activity compared to ZnO, with a degradation efficiency of 87.12%.

title: Direct assay of monosodium glutamate in multi-sourced bouillon cubes by first derivative potentiometric titration
summary: This paper presents a simple, cheap, and accurate analytical method for the direct assay of monosodium glutamate (MSG) in bouillon cubes. The method uses first derivative potentiometric titration and is suitable for regulatory agencies such as NAFDAC and ISO.

title: Selectivity control in thiol–yne click reactions via visible light induced associative electron upconversion
summary: This paper presents a metal-free approach to access different thiol-yne products with high selectivity, using visible light induced associative electron upconversion. The reaction mechanism is supported by experiments and DFT calculations.

title: Cospatial σ-Hole and Lone Pair Interactions of Square-Pyramidal Pentavalent Halogen Compounds with π-Systems: A Quantum Mechanical Study
summary: This paper investigates the cospatial σ-hole and lone pair interactions of square-pyramidal pentavalent halogen compounds with π-systems using quantum mechanical methods. The study focuses on understanding the nature and attitude of noncovalent interactions, particularly in aromatic π-system-based interactions.

title: H2S/Thiols, NO•, and NO–/HNO: Interactions with Iron Porphyrins
summary: This paper explores the interactions between H2S, thiols, NO•, and NO–/HNO with iron porphyrins. The study focuses on the reactivity of inorganic sulfide species towards iron heme platforms, providing insights into the coordination chemistry of H2S and its conjugated base to heme proteins.

title: Preparation of Nano-Copper Sulfide and Its Adsorption Properties for 17α-Ethynyl Estradiol
summary: This paper focuses on the synthesis of nano-copper sulfide and its application as an adsorbent for removing 17α-ethynyl estradiol (EE2) from water. The study demonstrates that copper sulfide exhibits excellent adsorption properties, with a maximum adsorption capacity of 147.06 mg/g.

title: Computational Studies on Drug Likeness and Pharmacokinetic Profile of Selected Phytoconstituents from Liquorice
summary: This paper investigates the drug likeness properties and pharmacokinetic profile of selected phytoconstituents from liquorice using computational methods. The study uses servers such as PubChem, Molsoft, and admetSAR to predict molecular properties and pharmacokinetic aspects, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence.

title: Recent Advance in Co3O4 and Co3O4-Containing Electrode Materials for High-Performance Supercapacitors
summary: This paper reviews the recent advances in Co3O4 and Co3O4-containing electrode materials for high-performance supercapacitors, focusing on their synthesis methods, properties, and applications. The authors discuss various techniques used to synthesize these materials, including hydrothermal and solvothermal methods, and highlight their potential for energy storage.

title: Conversion of waste polypropylene disposable cups into liquid fuels by thermal and catalytic pyrolysis using activated carbon
summary: This paper focuses on converting waste polypropylene disposable cups into liquid fuels through thermal and catalytic pyrolysis processes. The study explores the effect of temperature, feed to catalyst ratio, and reaction times on yield of liquid fuel fraction in both thermal and catalytic processes.

title: Spectral characteristics and DFT Study of vanadyl octaethylporphyrin complex
summary: This paper explores the chemistry of vanadyl porphyrins using vanadyl octaethylporphyrin as a substance in petroleum porphyrins, crude oils and bitumen. The study uses Density Functional Theory (DFT) to determine the geometric and electronic structure of the complex, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Validation and Application of a Derivatization-Free RP-HPLC-DAD Method for the Determination of Low Molecular Weight Salivary Metabolites
summary: This paper presents a novel, derivatization-free RP-HPLC-DAD method for the simultaneous determination of low molecular weight metabolites in saliva. The method is validated and applied to investigate the dynamics of salivary metabolites as potential biomarkers for non-invasive 'personal monitoring' during drug treatments, work out, or life habits over time.

title: Adsorption of Light Gases in Covalent Organic Frameworks: Comparison of Classical Density Functional Theory and Grand Canonical Monte Carlo Simulations
summary: This paper compares the performance of classical density functional theory (cDFT) and grand canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) simulations in predicting adsorption isotherms of light gases in covalent organic frameworks (COFs). The study uses a PC-SAFT equation of state to describe fluid-fluid interactions, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Microstructure Optimization of Mos2/Sepiolite Nanocomposites via a Surfactant-Assisted Hydrothermal Strategy for High Efficiency Photocatalysis
summary: This paper focuses on optimizing the microstructure of MoS2/sepiolite nanocomposites using a surfactant-assisted hydrothermal method. The study investigates the effects of different surfactants and concentrations on the photocatalytic activity of the nanocomposite, with SDBS found to be the optimal surfactant at 1 mol/L concentration.

title: Characterization of Nanosilica and Comparing Its Effect on Crude Oils and Diesel Fuel
summary: This paper investigates the viscosity reduction of heavy oil resulting from the presence of silica nanoparticles by asphaltene adsorption process. The study uses chemical and physical methods to produce silica nanoparticles, which are then added to crude oils and diesel fuel to measure their effect on viscosity.

title: QSAR-based rational discovery of novel substituted-4′-iminospiro[indoline-3,3′-[1,2,5]thiadiazolidinyl]-2-one 1′,1′-dioxide with potent in vitro anticancer activity
summary: This paper presents a QSAR-based approach to design novel AR inhibitors with potential anticancer activities. The study uses a quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) model to predict the biological activity of newly designed compounds, and identifies molecular descriptors that contribute to the AR inhibition.
statisticalMethods: Regression analysis was used to evaluate each set of molecular descriptors, with an ideal set generating a model with least root mean square error (RMSE) and a r2 coefficient value close to 1.00.

title: Fabrication of Magnetic Catalyst Fe3O4-SiO2-V3 and Its Application on Lignin Extraction from Corncob in Deep Eutectic Solvent
summary: This paper focuses on the development of a magnetic catalyst, Fe3O4-SiO2-V3, for lignin extraction from corncob in deep eutectic solvent. The study explores the application of polyoxometalates as catalysts to optimize delignification processes.

title: Conformational sampling and kinetics changes across a non-Arrhenius break point in the enzyme thermolysin
summary: This paper investigates conformational sampling and kinetics changes across a non-Arrhenius break point in the enzyme thermolysin. The study uses room temperature crystallography to reveal motions crucial for catalysis, ligand binding, and alternate conformations of protein side chains. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.

title: Cytotoxic and antileishmanial triterpenes of Tabebuia aurea (Silva Manso) leaves
summary: This paper investigates the cytotoxic and antileishmanial activities of triterpenes isolated from Tabebuia aurea leaves. The study found that certain compounds exhibited significant cytotoxic activity against cancer cell lines and antileishmanial activity, but machine learning or artificial intelligence methods were not used in this research.
statisticalMethods: IC50 values for cytotoxicity and antileishmanial activity were measured

title: Destruction of Chitosan and Its Complexes with Cobalt(II) and Copper(II) Tetrasulphophthalocyanines
summary: This paper investigates the thermal oxidative destruction of chitosan in the presence of metallophthalocyanine complexes. The study aims to understand how these complexes affect the degradation process and potentially lead to new polymer compositions with improved oxidation resistance.

title: Minimizing Weighted Sum Download Time for One-to-Many File Transfer in Peer-to-Peer Networks
summary: This paper focuses on minimizing the weighted sum download time (WSDT) for one-to-many file transfer in peer-to-peer networks. It considers heterogeneous peers with both uplink and downlink bandwidth constraints, and proposes several schemes to optimize WSDT, including a static routing-based scheme and a dynamic rateless-coding-based scheme.

title: Implementation of use case point as software effort estimation in Scrum Framework
summary: This paper explores the implementation of Use Case Point (UCP) as a method for software effort estimation within the Scrum framework. The authors investigate how UCP can be integrated with Scrum to improve estimation accuracy and efficiency.

title: Online monitoring of water pollution level based on dissolved oxygen (DO) and biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) using wireless sensor system
summary: This paper proposes an online monitoring system for water pollution levels based on dissolved oxygen (DO) and biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) using a wireless sensor system. The system uses database replication to ensure consistency and prevent redundant data, providing reliable information on the web.

title: Analysis of Drivers’ Eye Movements on Roundabouts:A Driving Simulator Study
summary: This study investigates drivers' eye movements under distracted and non-distracted conditions on roundabouts using a driving simulator. The research focuses on the visual characteristics relevant to distracted driving, but does not involve any machine learning or AI methods.

title: A Whole-Body Software Abstraction layer for Control Design of free-floating Mechanical Systems
summary: This paper proposes a software abstraction layer to simplify the design and synthesis of whole-body controllers without making any preliminary assumptions on the control law. The library decouples the control software from implementation details, providing a clean and concise code that focuses only on the implementation of the control law.

title: qprof: a gprof-inspired quantum profiler
summary: This paper introduces qprof, a new and extensible quantum program profiler that generates profiling reports of various quantum circuits. The tool is designed to be modular and extensible, allowing it to support multiple quantum computing frameworks. qprof aims to replace the manual process of finding hotspots in quantum implementations by automatically generating a report with useful information.

title: BitSurfing: Wireless Communications with Outsourced Symbol Generation
summary: This paper proposes a new network adapter architecture, BitSurfing, which overcomes implementation challenges in nano-IoT by outsourcing symbol generation to an external source. The BitSurfing adapter reads incoming symbols and waits for intended messages to appear in the stream, emitting short pulses to notify neighboring nodes.

title: Beyond connectedness: why pairwise metrics cannot capture community stability
summary: This paper examines the limitations of pairwise metrics in capturing community stability, proposing an alternative metric based on feedback loops. The authors argue that pairwise interactions are insufficient to understand system stability and introduce a new approach using three-link feedback loops.

title: Estimation of Exciton Diffusion Lengths of Organic Semiconductors in Random Domains
summary: This paper focuses on estimating exciton diffusion lengths in organic semiconductors with random domains. The authors employ a diffusion-type equation as the forward model and propose an asymptotic-based method to solve it, demonstrating its efficiency compared to stochastic collocation methods.

title: Construction of 5G all-wireless network and information system for cabin hospitals
summary: This paper presents a 5G all-wireless solution to divide the overall network system of cabin hospitals into multiple network units by function. The solution uses virtual private networks (VPNs) built on the 5G wireless network to connect each network unit to the host hospital's data center, ensuring secure and encrypted data transmission.

title: Universal consistency and rates of convergence of multiclass prototype algorithms in metric spaces
summary: This paper studies the universal consistency and convergence rates of simple nearest-neighbor prototype rules for multiclass classification in metric spaces. The authors introduce a novel data-dependent partitioning rule, Proto-NN, which is universally consistent in any metric space that admits a universally consistent rule. They also derive rates for the k-NN rule under a generalized Lipschitz condition and margin condition.

title: WiNV: A Framework for Web-based Interactive Scalable Network Visualization
summary: This paper presents a new state-of-the-art network visualization framework, WiNV, which enables interactive and scalable visualization of large-scale networks in a web browser without the need for plugins or special-purpose runtime systems. The framework uses AJAX-based DWR technology to generate network elements on-the-fly, allowing for smooth interaction and editing capabilities.

title: Achieving Fair Random Access Performance in Massive MIMO Crowded Machine-Type Networks
summary: This paper proposes a novel random access protocol, ACBPC, that improves fairness and performance in crowded machine-type networks. Unlike previous protocols like SUCRe, which favors UEs closer to the base station, ACBPC enables UEs to estimate the number of contenders for a pilot without additional overhead, leading to improved spectral efficiency and energy efficiency.

title: Network De-materialization in Open Flow Network
summary: This review paper presents the study of DeMaterialization of Network known as Network Virtualization in SDN. It interprets different paths to network virtualization and defines contrasting mechanisms for resource allocation.

title: Numerical integration in arbitrary-precision ball arithmetic
summary: This paper presents an implementation of rigorous numerical integration with error bounds in the Arb library, using a combination of adaptive bisection and Gaussian quadrature. The code is general, easy to use, and efficient, often outperforming existing non-rigorous software.

title: Assessment of transferable forcefields for protein simulations
summary: This paper assesses the performance of four mainstream, transferable, nonpolarizable forcefields in simulating protein solutions and disordered states. The authors tested these forcefields for their ability to accurately describe disorder with secondary structure propensity and keep proteins soluble or insoluble as required. The study focuses on improving the simulation of disordered peptides and proteins, a problem that has been understudied despite its importance.

title: Patch Quality and Diversity of Invariant-Guided Search-Based Program Repair
summary: This paper evaluates the correctness and diversity of patches generated by GenProg and an invariant-based diversity-enhancing extension. The authors find no evidence that promoting diversity changes the correctness of patches, but do observe semantic differences between patches for most bugs.

title: Challenges in migrating legacy software systems to the cloud: An empirical study
summary: This paper investigates the challenges of migrating legacy software systems to the cloud, highlighting the need for a holistic understanding of the migration process and addressing key internal operational difficulties. The study emphasizes the importance of considering socio-technical aspects and reengineering processes to enable interaction with and utilization of cloud services.

title: Hybrid PSOGSA Technique for Solving Dynamic Economic Emission Dispatch Problem
summary: This paper proposes a hybrid population-based algorithm combining particle swarm optimization (PSO) and gravitational search algorithm (GSA) techniques to solve the dynamic economic emission dispatch problem. The proposed method integrates exploration abilities of PSO with GSA's strength, demonstrating efficiency and superiority over other optimization algorithms.

title: Territories of data: ontological divergences in the growth of data infrastructure
summary: This paper explores the intersection of data infrastructure and territorial conflicts in Chile, arguing that the expansion of data infrastructure can impinge upon the cultivation of worlds based on human and other-than-human interdependence. The authors adopt a political ontology lens to examine divergent ontologies of territory emerging in relation to astronomy data infrastructure.

title: Impact of Mobile Phone Usage on Some Health Aspects of Children and Adolescents: Evidence Based Review Article
summary: This paper reviews the impact of mobile phone usage on various health aspects of children and adolescents, including eye health, ear problems, neurological effects, psychiatric effects, and brain tumors. The study finds that prolonged use of mobile phones can cause visual disturbances, auditory problems, headaches, and increased risk of depression and anxiety in young users.

title: The Software System Implementation of Speech Command Recognizer Under Intensive Background Noise
summary: This paper presents a speech command recognition system that uses adaptive filtering noise cancellation and HMM-based connected-word speech recognition algorithm to improve robustness in strong noise environments. The ML impact is substantial as the system relies heavily on machine learning techniques for speech enhancement and recognition.

title: Design and Implementation of ATM Security System using IOT
summary: This paper proposes a low-cost and efficient security system for ATMs using IoT technology. The system uses various sensors, including RFID readers, smoke sensors, metal detectors, and force sensors to detect potential threats and alert authorities.

title: An Optimal Mass Transport Method for Random Genetic Drift
summary: This paper proposes an optimal mass transport method for random genetic drift, focusing on the Moran process and its large population limits. The method is designed to capture Dirac-delta singularities and preserve biologically relevant properties of the random genetic drift.

title: Secure Sensor Design Against Undetected Infiltration: Minimum Impact-Minimum Damage
summary: This paper proposes a new defense mechanism against undetected infiltration into controllers in cyber-physical systems, focusing on minimizing damage before detection. The approach involves cautious design of sensor outputs to improve security further when combined with other defense mechanisms.

title: The current use and potential of cost benefit analysis in water sector projects
summary: This paper reviews the current state of Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA) in the water sector, highlighting gaps in regional and global guidelines that underpin investment justifications. The authors identify a need for broader and more accessible recommendations for water sector specific valuation methods.

title: Effects of Moonlighting on Job Satisfaction in Public Institutions in Southwest Nigeria (A Comparative Analysis)
summary: This study investigates the effects of moonlighting on job satisfaction between academic staff and medical doctors in Southwest Nigeria. The research employs descriptive research design and multi-stage sampling technique to select respondents, using questionnaires administered to 393 academic staff and 348 medical doctors. The study reveals that moonlighting has a positive effect on job satisfaction, with academic staff moonlighting more often than medical doctors.
statisticalMethods: ANOVA test was used to estimate the comparative effects of moonlighting on job satisfaction between academic staff and medical doctors.

title: Investing in the health of girls and women: a best buy for sustainable development
summary: This paper argues that investing in women's health is crucial for economic development, as healthier women tend to be more productive and have higher returns on educational investments. The authors provide evidence from various studies showing the positive impact of women's health on labor force participation, education, and intergenerational spillover effects.

title: The Empirical Study of House-price Fluctuations on the Impact of Total Factor Productivity of Manufacturing in China—Based on the Perspective of Misallocation of Resources
summary: This paper examines the impact of total factor productivity (TFP) on misallocation of resources in China's manufacturing sector. The authors use a theoretical and empirical model to analyze the effects of distortions in factor prices caused by irrational prosperity of China's real estate market on TFP. They find significant and varying degrees of distortion in capital, labor, and overall TFP across different regions and ownership systems.

title: Macroeconomic policy and profit rate of a company: A dynamic panel estimation and comparative analysis from Indonesia
summary: This paper examines the effect of macroeconomic policy on a company's profit rate in Indonesia. It uses dynamic panel estimation and comparative analysis to determine the impact of various macroeconomic variables, including tax revenue, investment growth, and infrastructure fund allocation, on company profitability.

title: Dynamic Model for Determining Disaster Evacuation Locations with Game Theory
summary: This paper presents a dynamic model using game theory to determine optimal evacuation locations in disaster management. The model integrates geographical information systems and simple additive weighting methods to identify the best evacuation location, minimizing losses from disasters.

title: A spatial model for assessment of urban vulnerability in the light of the UN New Urban Agenda guidelines: case study of Assiut City, Egypt
summary: This paper presents a spatial model for assessing urban vulnerability in Assiut City, Egypt, using UN-based urban indicators within a GIS framework. The study aims to identify areas under risk and prioritize them for sustainable development policies. Although the paper uses geographic information systems (GIS) and multicriteria evaluation models, it does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Impact of Tax Audit on Tax Compliance with Reference to Category “A” Taxpayers: A Case Study in Hawassa City Administration, South Nations, Nationalities and Peoples’ Regional State of Ethiopia
summary: This paper examines the impact of tax audit on tax compliance in Ethiopia with reference to Hawassa City administration. The study uses a case study approach and finds that tax audits play an important role in increasing voluntary compliance, but notes that previous studies have evidenced mixed results.
statisticalMethods: Descriptive statistical tools and correlation and multiple regressions analysis

title: The Role of Islamic Microfinance Institution in Empowering Indonesian Fishing Communities
summary: This study examines the role of Islamic Microfinance Institutions (IMFI) in empowering fishing communities in Indonesia. The research focuses on the products and services provided by IMFI to improve the economic welfare of fishermen, who often live in poverty due to high-interest rates from conventional lenders.

title: Do renewable energy sources improve clean environmental-economic growth?
summary: This paper investigates the causal relationship between renewable energy sources and clean environmental economic growth among South Asian economies. The study uses panel data from eight countries and finds that renewable energy has a positive impact on economic growth, but does not explicitly use machine learning or AI methods.
statisticalMethods: panel data, PVECM test, dynamic OLS regression

title: Determinants of Banks Profitability in a Developing Economy: Empirical Evidence from Palestine
summary: This paper analyzes the determinants of bank profitability in Palestine, using dynamic panel analysis on a sample of 14 banks between 2008 and 2018. The study identifies key factors affecting bank profitability, including operating expense management, asset size, asset structure, asset quality, capital adequacy, liquidity, and activity mix.

title: Trends in the legal labour reform policy in the Kyrgyz Republic
summary: This paper analyzes the transformations in the labor market of the Kyrgyz Republic, focusing on the legal labour reform policy. The study examines the main periods of implementation of reforms and assesses the means of implementing reforms in terms of their compliance with national and international labor standards. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this paper.

title: The job of public transport, ride-hailing and delivery drivers: Conditions during the COVID-19 pandemic and implications for a post-pandemic future
summary: This paper examines the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the working conditions, job satisfaction, and subjective well-being of public transport, ride-hailing, and delivery drivers in Santiago, Chile. The study finds that app-based jobs faced specific consequences during the pandemic, with a significant decrease in people's mobility and a boost in the need to move goods.

title: FORMATION THE SYSTEM FOR ASSESSING THE ECONOMIC SECURITY OF ENTERPRISE IN THE AGRICULTURAL SECTOR
summary: This paper focuses on forming a model for assessing the economic security of agroindustrial enterprises. The authors use traditional research methods, including induction and deduction, comparison and systematization, synthesis and analysis, morphological analysis, SAW methodology, and expert evaluation to develop an integrated indicator for assessing economic security. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence techniques are not employed in this study.

title: Reducing the quality risk of elderly care services in government procurement from market-oriented private providers through ex ante policy design: lessons from the principal-agent theory analysis
