summary: This paper analyzes how to reduce the quality risk of elderly care services supplied by market-oriented private providers in government procurement through ex ante policy design. The study uses the principal-agent theory and finds that asymmetric information and goal divergence increase the quality risk, highlighting the importance of comprehensive, proactive, and pragmatic ex ante policy design.

title: Interrelation and Spillover Effects Between Stocks and Bonds: Cross-Market and Cross-Asset Evidence
summary: This paper examines the interrelation between stock and bond markets across four major countries, focusing on the time-varying nature of correlations and spillovers. The authors use a vector autoregression (VAR) model to analyze the interactions between stocks and bonds, including Granger causality tests and the spillover index methodology.
statisticalMethods: VAR framework, Granger causality tests, spillover index methodology

title: Evaluation of the Parking System Efficiency Based on the Jadwizyn Settlement in Pila in the Light of Sustainable Development
summary: This paper evaluates the efficiency of the parking system in the Jadwizyn settlement in Pila, Poland, from a sustainable development perspective. The study finds that the current parking system is not effective for the community and does not meet sustainable development guidelines.

title: Legal Principles of Environmental Accounting as Means of Identifying Sustainable Development Indicators in Ukraine
summary: This paper explores the legal principles of environmental accounting to identify sustainable development indicators in Ukraine. The authors analyze existing approaches and propose a new system for environmental accounting, which is essential for implementing sustainable development goals.

title: Assessing Factors Influencing Investors’ Preference Towards Municipal Bond in Bangladesh
summary: This paper investigates the factors influencing investors' preference towards municipal bonds in Bangladesh. It aims to identify whether fundamental features of bonds can affect investment decisions and examines the external environment's influence on bond investments. The study uses a survey of 270 share market investors and applies non-probability sampling with cross-matching to ensure proper representation.

title: The determinants of sovereign risk premiums in the UK and the European government bond market: the impact of Brexit
summary: This paper analyzes the effects of the Brexit referendum on sovereign risk premiums in the UK and European government bond markets. The study finds that the announcement of the Brexit referendum result led to an immediate increase of the risk premium, with credit default risk and risk aversion playing a more important role in the post-referendum period.

title: CORI Handheld Robotics for Total and Partial Knee Arthroplasties
summary: This paper discusses the CORI system, a handheld robotics technology used in total and partial knee arthroplasties. The system allows for personalized surgery tailored to each patient's anatomy, resulting in improved patient outcomes such as less pain, fewer revisions, and greater satisfaction post-surgery.

title: Transition to third birth among immigrant mothers in Sweden: Does having two daughters accelerate the process?
summary: This paper investigates whether immigrant parents hold sex preferences for children in Sweden, a country that promotes gender equality. The authors examine the transition to third birth by applying event-history models to Swedish register data and find that women from countries with strong son-preference cultures are more likely to have a third child if they have two girls than if they have two boys or a boy and a girl.

title: Gender Analysis of Time Use Patterns in Households in Ondo State, Nigeria
summary: This paper conducts a gender analysis of time use patterns in households in Ondo State, Nigeria. The study explores the roles men and women play in household development, examining how they allocate their time to various activities. The research aims to enhance understanding of the household economy, which is largely invisible and uncounted in economic data.
statisticalMethods: frequencies, percentages, bar charts, pie charts

title: An Efficiency Assessment of Selected German Airports Using the DEA Model
summary: This paper assesses the efficiency of 27 selected airports in Germany using Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA). The study focuses on evaluating airport performance and identifying efficient airports. Although the DEA method is used, it does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence techniques.

title: From Social Protection to Personal Protection: Implications for an Integrated Framework of Retirement Planning for Informal Workers in Ghana
summary: This paper explores retirement planning among informal workers in Ghana, focusing on the need for social protection measures to ensure their well-being. The study uses an exploratory design and applies the continuity theory to understand the retirement plans of informal workers.

title: A Scientific Novel Way of Article and Thesis Writing: Findings from a Survey on Keyword, Sequence, and Importance (KSI) Technique
summary: This paper presents the KSI model as an effective writing technique for graduate students. The model helps in selecting thesis keywords, arranging them in chronological order of significance, and keeping the volume of each keyword according to its importance on the chosen topic. Although machine learning or AI methods are not used in this research, the KSI model has several advantages, including fast problem formulation, comprehensive literature review, rapid publication, good quality thesis, mental stress elimination, and graduation on time.

title: UNNES MOOCs: What strengths does the University have and the society needs?
summary: This paper focuses on designing Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) for Universitas Negeri Semarang (UNNES), incorporating the university's strengths and societal needs. The study uses an explorative design research approach, involving lecturers, students, and policymakers to develop MOOCs as a strategic step in Education 4.0.

title: Using the jigsaw technique to teach patient safety
summary: This paper evaluates the effectiveness of the jigsaw method in teaching principles of diagnostic reasoning to resident trainees. The study compares the jigsaw method to traditional small group learning and finds that the jigsaw method is more effective in promoting collaborative learning and engagement.

title: The Rhetorical Education of Isocrates and the Exemplary in Teaching: Overcoming the “Learnification of Education”
summary: This paper argues that the rhetorical education of Isocrates can serve as an alternative to today's outcome-based education, or 'the learnification of education.' The author analyzes this phenomenon primarily as a crisis of authority, connecting Biesta's critique with Arendt's concept of authority. The paper suggests that educational theory needs to rediscover the roots of the didactical tradition in rhetorics.

title: Error Analysis of Learning Chinese Detachable Words for Mongolian Students
summary: This paper analyzes the errors made by Mongolian students in using detachable words in Chinese. The study aims to help these students correctly use detachable words and improve their language learning outcomes. Although machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly used in this research, it contributes to the understanding of second-language acquisition and interlanguage theory.

title: Leadership Competence of Supreme Student Government Officials
summary: This study assesses the leadership competence of University of Bohol Supreme Student Government officials, using a standardized descriptive questionnaire. The research focuses on identifying key leadership competencies and their impact on student government performance.

title: Learning Strategies in Elementary Schools During COVID-19 Pandemic in North Sulawesi
summary: This paper explores the experiences of elementary school teachers in implementing learning strategies during the COVID-19 pandemic in North Sulawesi. The study focuses on the psychological impact of physical distancing on teacher-student relations and the adaptation of learning strategies to suit rural and urban conditions.

title: Methods of improving the system of motivation of the university teaching staff
summary: This paper examines methods for motivating university teaching staff, focusing on economic and social factors. It proposes a method for calculating incentive payments and discusses the importance of motivation in higher education.

title: Smart Wearables for Tennis Game Performance Analysis
summary: This paper presents a miniature wearable device for tracking tennis swings and strokes, which uses machine learning to detect individual hand gestures and monitor biometric data such as skin temperature and pulse rate. The system is designed to support athlete's arm movement tracking and can work in continuous sampling or gesture recognition mode.

title: Effects of Plyometric, Strength and Change of Direction Training on High-School Basketball Player’s Physical Fitness
summary: This study investigates the effects of plyometric, strength, and change of direction training on high-school basketball players' physical fitness. The research focuses on improving performance measures such as vertical jump, sprinting, and flexibility, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Impacts of gravitational-wave standard siren observations from Einstein Telescope and Cosmic Explorer on weighing neutrinos in interacting dark energy models
summary: This paper investigates the impact of gravitational-wave standard siren observations from Einstein Telescope and Cosmic Explorer on weighing neutrinos in interacting dark energy models. The authors find that these observations can only slightly improve the constraint on the neutrino mass in the IDE models, compared to the current limit.

title: Physical Education of Students in the Format of Distance Education
summary: This paper explores the impact of physical education on students during distance learning, particularly in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors suggest that regular physical activity can help maintain and strengthen the health of the younger generation, but do not explicitly mention any machine learning or AI methods used in their research.
statisticalMethods: quantitative and qualitative analysis of research results

title: The Effect of Dynamic Geometry Software Geometer's Sketchpad on Students’ Achievement in Topic Circle among Form Two Students
summary: This study investigates the effectiveness of using Geometer's Sketchpad (GSP) in teaching and learning circle properties among Form Two students. The research found that students who used GSP performed better than those who learned traditionally, with significant improvements in understanding and visualizing geometric concepts.
statisticalMethods: Multiple-choice questions covering topics and structure form two circles by topics taught according to the appropriate level with students (easy, medium and hard)

title: Application of computer technology in Aerobics Teaching and training
summary: This paper discusses the application of computer technology in aerobics teaching, highlighting its potential to improve learning outcomes and student engagement. However, the role of ML/AI is minimal as it is not explicitly mentioned or used in the methodology.

title: Twenty Years’ Development of Teacher Identity Research: A Bibliometric Analysis
summary: This study provides a bibliometric analysis of teacher identity research over the past 20 years, using data from the Web of Science database. The analysis aims to identify the current state and impact of teacher identity research, including research topics, publication patterns, authors, and institutions contributing to this field.

title: Production-Oriented Approach on ESL Listening and Speaking Teaching in College
summary: This paper explores the production-oriented approach (POA) to teaching English listening and speaking skills in college. The authors investigate whether POA can improve students' achievements in listening and speaking, compared to a traditional re-listening and imitating method. The study finds that POA is effective in improving students' listening and speaking abilities.

title: Challenges of Nursing Students in Relation to Academic Performance at the Faculty of Technical Medical Sciences
summary: This paper explores the challenges faced by nursing students at the Faculty of Technical Medical Sciences in Tirana, Albania. The study uses a qualitative research approach to identify difficulties encountered by students in relation to their academic performance. The findings highlight issues such as low level of student engagement in clinical practice, curriculum structure, educational workload, and organizing the exam season and scheduling.

title: SELF-EFFICACY OF JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN ONLINE LEARNING
summary: This study examines the self-efficacy of junior high school students in online learning during the COVID-19 pandemic. The research focuses on the dimensions of level, strength, and generality of self-efficacy, using a questionnaire to measure student confidence in completing math tasks. The results show that Indonesian SMP/MTs students have medium levels of self-efficacy in all three dimensions.

title: The Trend of Library Development in Indonesia and the Effects on Literacy Skills in Schools
summary: This study examines the trend of library development in Indonesia from 2017-2021, its significance, and effects on literacy skills. Although machine learning/AI methods are not explicitly used, the study relies on statistical analysis to understand the relationship between libraries and literacy skills.

title: Educational or Scientific Career?
summary: This paper explores the dilemma between pedagogical development and research component of teaching in higher educational institutions. The authors conducted interviews with 25 teachers from Chuvash State University to analyze their perception of pedagogical competencies and evaluation of professional development programs.

title: Covid-19 Pandemic: Difficulties Faced By Special Education Teachers During Emergency Remote Teaching Through Online Learning And Their Opinions
summary: This paper explores the difficulties faced by special education teachers during emergency remote teaching through online learning to special needs students and their opinions during Covid-19 pandemic. The study found that teachers play a vital role in making the online educational system successful, but they face several challenges, including lack of communication due to limitations of video calling, electricity issues, and parents' unresponsiveness.

title: The Use of Asynchronous Google Classroom with Video Teaching Tutorial on Improving Student Writing Achievement for Recount Text at Public Senior High School Kendari
summary: This study investigates the effectiveness of asynchronous Google Classroom with video teaching tutorial on improving students' writing achievement for recount text at SMAN 6 Kendari. The research uses a pre-experimental one-group pre-test and post-test design, collecting data through written tests analyzed using paired sample t-tests. The results show a significant difference in gain scores between pre- and post-tests, indicating a positive effect of asynchronous Google Classroom with video teaching tutorial on student writing achievement.

title: Consequences of Patellar Tendinopathy on Isokinetic Knee Strength and Jumps in Professional Volleyball Players
summary: This study evaluates the impact of patellar tendinopathy (PT) on isokinetic knee strength and jump performances in professional volleyball players. The results show that PT has a significant effect on knee extensor strength, with both symptomatic and asymptomatic legs showing decreased values compared to healthy legs.

title: E-learning: An effective mode of teaching English as a Second Language
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of e-learning in teaching English as a second language, highlighting its benefits and tools. Although ML/AI methods are not explicitly used, the study focuses on computer-based technologies and online learning platforms to enhance language skills.

title: A Systematic Review: The Effect of Culturally Responsive Pedagogy on Student Learning and Achievement
summary: This systematic review examines the effect of Culturally Responsive Pedagogy on student learning and academic achievement. The study finds that this pedagogy has a positive impact on students' involvement in learning and academic achievement, but notes that research on its effectiveness is still limited.

title: Nitsche's Finite Element Method for Model Coupling in Elasticity
summary: This paper presents a Nitsche finite element method for coupling elastic models, focusing on the hybridized approach of Burman et al. The method is used to model interfaces with bending and membrane stiffness, as well as strong and cohesive coupling between the beam-truss interface and the membrane.

title: Performance Analysis of Flat Plate and Evacuated Tube Collectors
summary: This paper conducts a thermal analysis on the performance of solar water heating systems with flat plate and heat pipe evacuated tube collectors, comparing their efficiency and solar fraction under various operating conditions. The study finds that evacuated tube collectors are more efficient than flat plate collectors.

title: Degradation of Diclofenac Sodium in Microbial Fuel Cells
summary: This paper investigates the degradation of diclofenac sodium using microbial fuel cells. Although machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly mentioned, the study uses statistical methods to analyze data and draw conclusions about the effects of pH and temperature on diclofenac sodium degradation.
statisticalMethods: HPLC was used to determine the concentration of diclofenac sodium, and a standard curve was drawn to relate peak area to concentration.

title: Analytical and Numerical Investigation on Depth and Pipe Configuration for Coaxial Borehole Heat Exchanger, A Preliminary Study
summary: This paper presents a preliminary study on the optimization of coaxial borehole heat exchangers (CBHEs) for geothermal energy harvesting. The authors develop a numerical solver to investigate the flow regime within CBHEs, accounting for both convective and conductive heat transfer. The study focuses on determining the most optimized design for CBHEs, providing maximized thermal output by exploiting the geothermal gradient.

title: Dynamic and Friction Parameters of an Industrial Robot: Identification, Comparison and Repetitiveness Analysis
summary: This paper focuses on the identification and comparison of dynamic parameters in industrial robots. The authors use a dynamics model to study the robustness of an industrial manipulator, identifying joint friction changes during robot operation. They propose a method for estimating temperature and related friction variation using experimental data from two robots.

title: Performance Evaluation of Single and Multi-Objective Calibration in Rainfall-Runoff Modelling
summary: This paper evaluates the performance of single and multi-objective calibration methods for rainfall-runoff modelling using the MIKE 11 NAM model. The study focuses on the Gin catchment in Sri Lanka, where accurate rainfall-runoff simulations are crucial to minimize flood hazards and manage water resources efficiently. Although machine learning is not explicitly used in this paper, it highlights the importance of proper model calibration and the use of multiple evaluation criteria for hydrological modelling.
statisticalMethods: Nash-Sutcliffe coefficient (NSE), percent bias (PBIAS), and coefficient of determination (R^2)

title: Zero-crossing Point Prediction Technology of CFI Based on A New Adaptive LS Algorithm
summary: This paper proposes a new adaptive least square algorithm for predicting zero-crossing points in controlled fault interruption (CFI) technology. The algorithm improves upon the traditional LS method by reducing truncation errors caused by approximating the attenuated DC decaying component, and achieves high accuracy even with noisy data.

title: Research on the Method of Improving the Flow Field Quality in the Elbow of the Water Flow Standard Device Based on the CFD Numerical Calculation Method
summary: This paper presents a computational fluid dynamics (CFD) numerical calculation method to study the flow characteristics of fluid passing through elbows in water flow standard devices. The research focuses on improving the flow field quality by changing the turning angle and installing deflectors, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Efficiency enhancement of solar cell collector using Fe3O4 / water nanofluid
summary: This paper investigates the performance of a photovoltaic thermal (PVT) collector using Fe3O4/water nanofluid as a coolant. The study aims to enhance the efficiency of PVT collectors, which are solar devices that produce both electricity and heat energy. The authors employed numerical simulations using ANSYS Fluent to investigate the effect of nanofluids on the performance of PVT collectors.

title: Photocatalytic Decolorization and Biocidal Applications of Nonmetal Doped TiO2: Isotherm, Kinetic Modeling and In Silico Molecular Docking Studies
summary: This paper investigates the photocatalytic performance and biocidal potential of nitrogen-doped TiO2 against textile dyes and microbial contamination. The study uses molecular docking to predict the biocidal mechanism, but does not involve machine learning or AI methods.

title: Condition Assessment of Tower and Mast Structures Using the Combination of PCA with Cross-Validation
summary: This paper proposes a condition assessment approach combining principal component analysis (PCA) with cross-validation to evaluate the structural condition of tower and mast structures monitored within one cluster under changing environments. The method is effective in reducing the adverse effects of environmental temperature and speed load on the horizontal displacement monitoring data of tower and mast structures, but does not utilize machine learning or AI methods.

title: Evaluation of Diethyl Ether as a Renewable Transport Fuel in Sudan
summary: This paper evaluates the potential of diethyl ether as a renewable transport fuel in Sudan. The study investigates physicochemical properties, copper corrosion test, and diesel engine performance of diethyl ether diesel blend fuels. The results show that addition of diethyl ether up to 20% improves the physicochemical properties of diesel, but there is no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods used.

title: Model based simulation of a CVT variator to analyse the slip characteristics of the CVT belt
summary: This paper presents a mathematical model using SIMULINK to analyze the slip characteristics of a Continuously Variable Transmission (CVT) variator. The study focuses on controlling clamping forces and improving transmission efficiency, with no mention of machine learning or AI methods.

title: Integrated Disturbance Observer Attitude Controller for a Satellite with Rotating Solar Array
summary: This paper presents a robust attitude control method based on disturbance observer for a satellite with rotating solar array. The proposed controller effectively estimates and compensates the external disturbance torque, improving the attitude control accuracy and stability.

title: Assessing Performance of Multipurpose Reservoir System Using Two-Point Linear Hedging Rule
summary: This paper assesses the performance of a multipurpose reservoir system using a two-point linear hedging rule. The study focuses on optimizing water release for various purposes, including municipal and irrigation supply, while minimizing environmental impact. Although machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly used in this research, it explores innovative techniques in water resource management.

title: Safety of Nanoclay/Spring Water Hydrogels: Assessment and Mobility of Hazardous Elements
summary: This paper assesses the safety attributes of nanoclay/spring water hydrogels by evaluating their elemental composition and mobility. The study finds that while some hazardous elements are present in the hydrogels, they are not bioavailable at normal doses, making them safe for topical application.

title: A Multi-Electrode Pixel Structure for Quick-Response Electrowetting Displays
summary: This paper proposes a new multi-electrode pixel structure to improve the response speed of electrowetting displays. The proposed structure was simulated using COMSOL Multiphysics software, and the results showed that it can effectively improve the response time compared to traditional single-electrode structures.

title: Total Repair Cost Simulation Considering Multiple Probabilistic Measures and Service Life
summary: This paper analyzes the total maintenance cost for public houses in South Korea using probabilistic and deterministic methods. The study evaluates the effect of each repair process on the total maintenance cost, considering the coefficient of variation (COV) of extended service life.

title: Electric Vehicles: Problems or Solutions
summary: This paper discusses the current directions of vehicle developments, barriers and opportunities for using electric vehicles instead of conventional vehicles. The authors investigate the future market prospects of various types of EVs, with a focus on economics and environmental impact.

title: A Modeling of Lead-Acid Battery for Electric Vehicles and Simulation Utilizing C MEX S-Function in Matlab/Simulink
summary: This paper models a lead-acid battery for electric vehicles and simulates its behavior using C MEX S-Function in Matlab/Simulink. The study focuses on analyzing the battery's performance and determining the optimal arrangement of batteries to satisfy the voltage and capacity requirements of an electric vehicle.

title: Gyro-Sensor-Based Vibration Control for Dynamic Humanoid-Robot Walking on Inclined Surfaces
summary: This paper investigates the angular-pitch velocity of a humanoid robot walking on an inclined surface, using a gyro sensor to control the ankle and hip motors. The study focuses on balancing the robot's gait pattern and reducing vibrations.

title: An Automated Retrofittable Street Light Solar Panel Cleaner
summary: This paper presents a solution for cleaning solar panels on streetlights, focusing on designing and developing an automated retrofittable system that requires minimal human interference. The proposed system uses a sensor-based mechanism to clean the panels based on information collected from sensors, including timers, voltage sensors, current sensors, and humidity sensors.

title: A NUMERICAL ANALYSIS OF DIFFERENT METHODS FOR STRENGTHENING BEAMS MADE OF GLULAM WITH CFRP FIBER COMPOSITES
summary: This paper presents a numerical analysis of different methods for strengthening beams made of glulam with CFRP fiber composites. The study focuses on the mechanical properties and behavior of composite materials in construction, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence techniques.

title: Silicon nanowires decorated with platinum nanoparticles were applied for photothermal-enhanced sonodynamic therapy
summary: This paper presents a novel approach to cancer treatment using silicon nanowires decorated with platinum nanoparticles for photothermal-enhanced sonodynamic therapy. The Si-Pt nanocomposites exhibit strong chemodynamic therapy and sonodynamic therapy effects, making them suitable for combined cancer therapy.

title: Environmental Inefficiencies of Short Sea Shipping Vessels by Optimization Processes Based on Resistance Prediction Methods
summary: This paper analyzes the environmental performance of Short Sea Shipping vessels and quantifies the consequences of inaccurate resistance prediction methods. The authors compare three estimation methods, including a simplified early decision-making tool (J. Mau method) and Computational Fluid Dynamics simulations, to evaluate their accuracy in estimating calm water resistance.

title: Genetic evidence for a western Chinese origin of broomcorn millet (Panicum miliaceum)
summary: This paper presents genetic evidence supporting a western Chinese origin for the domestication of broomcorn millet. The study uses microsatellite and granule-bound starch synthase I (GBSSI) genotype data from 341 landrace samples across Eurasia to address questions about the crop's origins and expansion.

title: Unraveling pathways of elevated ozone induced by the 2020 lockdown in Europe
summary: This paper investigates how emissions changed during the COVID-19 lockdown periods using a regional model and satellite data. The study focuses on ozone formation in Europe, particularly in urban areas, and finds that changes in anthropogenic emissions contribute to ozone enhancements.

title: Activity Concentration of Natural Radionuclides in Sediment of Tigris River in the City of Mosul, Iraq
summary: This paper investigates the activity concentration of natural radionuclides in sediment samples from the Tigris River in Mosul, Iraq. The study uses gamma-ray spectroscopy to detect and calculate the content of natural radionuclides, with a focus on Radium-226, Thorium-232, and Potassium-40. The results show that the activity concentrations are within the recommended global limits, indicating that the study area is safe for residents.
statisticalMethods: Statistical methods such as skewness and kurtosis were calculated, and box plots were applied to assess the distribution of radiological parameters.

title: Associations Between Chronic Exposure to Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons and Health Indices in Gulf of Mexico Tilefish (Lopholatilus chamaeleonticeps) Post Deepwater Horizon
summary: This paper investigates the effects of chronic exposure to polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) on health indices in Gulf of Mexico tilefish post-Deepwater Horizon. The study found a significant increase in PAH exposure and metabolism, potentially leading to negative impacts on fitness.

title: Uncertainty of Drone-Derived DEMs and Significance of Detected Morphodynamics in Artificially Scraped Dunes
summary: This paper investigates the uncertainty of drone-derived digital elevation models (DEMs) and its impact on morphodynamic assessments. The authors analyze the morphological changes in a scraped artificial dune using UAV surveys and evaluate the significance of detected morphodynamics under non-extreme conditions.

title: Summary of Discussions From the 2019 OECD Conference on RNAi Based Pesticides
summary: This paper summarizes input from presenters and participants during discussions at the 2019 OECD Conference on RNAi Based Pesticides, focusing on environmental fate of dsRNA, non-target organism (NTO) risk assessment, and human health risk assessment. The conference aimed to establish evidence-based international standards for regulating dsRNA-based pesticides.

title: The Impact of Climate Change on Neglected Tropical Diseases: A Systematic Review
summary: This systematic review examines the impact of climate change on neglected tropical diseases (NTDs), identifying correlations with climatic factors that influence trends in disease transmission and distribution. The study finds that climate change is affecting NTDs, particularly those involving vectors or intermediate hosts, and highlights the need for improved surveillance and monitoring to identify areas at risk.

title: Mediterranean land use systems from prehistory to antiquity: a case study from Peloponnese (Greece)
summary: This paper presents a standardized review of land use systems in the Peloponnese, Greece, from the Neolithic to the Roman period. The study focuses on characterizing and quantifying the spatial requirements of land use, contextualizing results within temporal trends and probable drivers of change.

title: In-situ observational network for extreme weather events in India
summary: This paper discusses the role of in-situ observational networks in predicting extreme weather events in India. The authors highlight the importance of accurate and timely monitoring and forecasting, particularly for heavy rains, tropical cyclones, thunderstorms, hailstorms, cloudbursts, droughts, heat and cold waves, etc. They describe the current observational network, including Doppler Weather Radars (DWRs), Automatic Weather Stations (AWSs), Agro AWSs, Automatic Rain Gauges (ARGs), GPS upper air systems, and satellite data. The authors emphasize the need for further augmentation of the network to enhance capabilities for high-impact weather events.

title: Daphnia’s Adaptive Molecular Responses to the Cyanobacterial Neurotoxin Anatoxin-α Are Maternally Transferred
summary: This paper investigates the effects of anatoxin-α on Daphnia magna and its capability to respond and adapt to this toxin type by increasing NAR gene expression. The study found that exposure to anatoxin-α-producing cyanobacteria reduced juvenile somatic growth rates and caused up-regulation of NAR gene expression, which can be maternally transferred.

title: Reproductive characteristics of Siahmahi, Capoeta damascina in Beheshtabad River, Tigris basin
summary: This paper investigates the reproductive characteristics of Mesopotamian barb (Siahmahi) in Beheshtabad River, Tigris basin. The study focuses on determining sex ratio, length and age at first maturity, Gonadosomatic and Hepatosomatic Indices, ovum diameter, absolute fecundity and relative fecundity. Machine learning or AI methods are not used in this research.

title: The architecture of assisted colonisation in sea turtles: building new populations in a biodiversity crisis
summary: This paper examines the process and consequences of assisted colonisation in sea turtles, using a multidisciplinary approach to study the impact of reintroduction programs on wild populations. The authors investigate the genetic relationship between captive-bred green turtles and their wild counterparts, finding that progeny from 43% of clutches was related to the turtles in the CTF, with an overall total of 282 different clutches related to the CTF.

title: Conventional oil and natural gas infrastructure increases brown-headed cowbird relative abundance and parasitism in mixed-grass prairie
summary: This paper investigates the impact of conventional oil and natural gas infrastructure on brown-headed cowbird relative abundance and parasitism in mixed-grass prairie. The study finds that the presence of infrastructure increases cowbird relative abundance by four times, resulting in four times greater brood parasitism rates at infrastructure sites.

title: Vegetation Structure and Floristic Features of Al Rayn Region, Saudi Arabia
summary: This paper investigates the vegetation structure and floristic features of Al Rayn region in Saudi Arabia. The study focuses on monitoring plant species composition, vegetation cover, and environmental conditions affecting their distribution. No machine learning or AI methods are used in this research.
statisticalMethods: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) was applied using COSTAT software for Windows version (4.6)

title: Effect of environmental factors on blood counts of Gambusia affinis caught at Brantas River watershed, Indonesia
summary: This study examines the ecosystem health of the Brantas River based on its environmental condition and the hematology profile of Gambusia affinis fish present in the river. The research focuses on assessing the impact of physico-chemical water parameters on the blood counts of mosquito fish, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Validating predictability of a sea level rise at a tide gauge station
summary: This paper proposes a three-tier statistical validation approach for kinematic models that use tide gauge measurements in sea level predictions. The study aims to establish consistent statistical outcomes to ensure the reliability of kinematic models in conducting sea level predictions using pertinent records.

title: Diversity of mangrove root-dwelling sponges in a tropical coastal ecosystem in the southern Gulf of Mexico region
summary: This study contributes to filling the knowledge gap on mangrove-associated sponge communities, particularly in the Southern Gulf of Mexico. The research focuses on the diversity and spatial distribution of mangrove root-dwelling sponges, with a total of 30 species recorded from nine sites. The study area's sponge assemblage is more similar to those documented in Caribbean locations than in the Northeast of the Gulf of Mexico.

title: A New Conulariid (Cnidaria, Scyphozoa) From the Terminal Ediacaran of Brazil
summary: This paper describes a new conulariid fossil found in the terminal Ediacaran Tamengo Formation in Brazil, providing evidence for the origin of cnidarians during Neoproterozoic times. The study does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Attractiveness of Species of Vitex to Pollinators
summary: This study evaluates the attractiveness of Vitex plants to pollinators, including honeybees and bumblebees. The research focuses on the impact of habitat loss and urbanization on bee populations and explores the potential of incorporating plants that support pollinators in urban landscapes.

title: Prediction of Spatiotemporal Invasive Risk of the Red Import Fire Ant, Solenopsis invicta (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), in China
summary: This paper uses the MaxEnt model to predict the suitable areas of S. invicta growth in China under current and future climatic conditions, with a focus on understanding the impact of climate change on its distribution. The study finds that the total suitable area will spread to higher latitudes in future climate scenarios.

title: Global ex situ Conservation of Palms: Living Treasures for Research and Education
summary: This paper highlights successful ex situ conservation programs for palms, reviewing how collections genetics can guide ex situ conservation. It conducts a family-wide gap analysis and provides an in-depth case study of ex situ conservation of the genus Sabal.

title: Status and needs for ice tank testing in a changing climate
summary: This paper discusses the influence of economic and environmental development in arctic regions on ice model basin design, equipment, and testing methods. The authors present examples from The Hamburg Ship Model Basin (HSVA) and provide an outlook to future trends.

title: Modelled mid-trophic pelagic prey fields improve understanding of marine predator foraging behaviour
summary: This paper explores the utility of a mechanistically-derived micronekton field to understand the movements of southern elephant seals. The authors use the Spatial Ecosystem And Population Dynamics Model (SEAPODYM) to simulate mid-trophic prey distribution and behavior, but machine learning or AI methods are not employed in this study.

title: On the Redox-Activity and Health-Effects of Atmospheric Primary and Secondary Aerosol: Phenomenology
summary: This paper presents the overall methodology of the RHAPS project, which aims to identify specific properties of PM1 from combustion sources responsible for toxicological effects. The study focuses on the relationship between oxidative potential (OP) carried by secondary organic aerosols (SOA) and PM1 toxicity, with field campaigns and laboratory experiments conducted in the Po Valley, Italy.

title: Current Pulse Based Ion-Selective Electrodes for Chronopotentiometric Determination of Calcium in Seawater
summary: This paper proposes a current pulse based ion-selective electrode with enhanced sensitivity for chronopotentiometric determination of calcium in seawater. The super-Nernstian responses of the electrode can be modulated by current pulse, and it is successfully used for seawater analysis.

title: Lattice strain and texture development in coarse-grained uranium – a neutron diffraction study
summary: This paper presents the results of a neutron diffraction experiment on coarse-grained cast uranium under tension and compression. The study focuses on lattice strain accumulation and texture changes due to deformation, providing insights into the material's behavior.

title: Synthesis and investigation of a self-assembled hydrogel based on hydroxyethyl cellulose and its in vitro ibuprofen drug release characteristics
summary: This paper investigates the synthesis of a self-assembled hydrogel based on hydroxyethyl cellulose (HEC) and its in vitro ibuprofen drug release characteristics. The study focuses on the formation of inclusion complexes between HEC and b-cyclodextrin (b-CDP), which enhances the solubility of ibuprofen. The authors prepare a self-assembled hydrogel, gel-(b)CDP-HEC/IBU, with sustained release characteristics over 1440 min.

title: The effect of doping graphene oxide on the structure and property of polyimide-based graphite fibre
summary: This paper investigates the effect of doping graphene oxide (GO) on the structure and properties of polyimide-based graphite fibres. The authors prepared GO/PI composite fibres with different GO contents and found that the incorporation of GO improved the thermal stability, reduced exothermic intensity during carbonization, and increased the degree of graphitization.

title: Limit State of a Rectangular Reinforced Section Using Elastoplastic Material Strain Diagrams
summary: This paper presents a methodology for constructing the strength domain of a reinforced rectangular section made of elastoplastic materials. The research focuses on developing a simpler technique for constructing the strength area without solving optimization problems, using linear and quadratic functions to describe the boundary of the strength region.

title: Ab-initio study of mechanical and electronic properties of MoAlB
summary: This paper investigates the structural, elastic, and electronic properties of MoAlB using first-principles calculations. The study finds that MoAlB is mechanically stable and exhibits a high Debye temperature, making it a good thermal conductor. However, the material's brittleness suggests that it may not be suitable for certain applications.

title: NO2 Sensing Properties of Cr2WO6 Gas Sensor in Air and N2 Atmospheres
summary: This paper investigates the sensing properties of Cr2WO6 gas sensors for NO2 detection in air and N2 atmospheres. The study finds that the sensor responses are highly temperature-dependent and increase with reduction in temperatures, but no machine learning or AI methods are used.

title: Efficient Conversion of Nitrogen to Nitrogen-Vacancy Centers in Diamond Particles with High-Temperature Electron Irradiation
summary: This paper investigates the efficient conversion of nitrogen to nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond particles using high-temperature electron irradiation. The authors demonstrate a significant increase in NV concentration with up to 25% conversion yield, outperforming conventional room temperature irradiation methods.

title: Effect of Bleaching Agents on Mineral Trioxide Aggregate
summary: This study investigates the effect of bleaching agents with neutral pH on the surface of mineral trioxide aggregate (MTA) using electron microscopy and energy dispersive X-ray microanalysis. The results show no relevant changes in color or statistically significant surface structure changes of MTA after exposure to Opalescence Boost 40% HP and Opalescence 10% carbamide peroxide bleaching agents.

title: Effect of Hybrid Carbon Fillers on the Electrical and Morphological Properties of Polystyrene Nanocomposites in Microinjection Molding
summary: This paper investigates the effect of hybrid carbon fillers on the electrical and morphological properties of polystyrene nanocomposites in microinjection molding. The study finds that high structure CB is more effective than CNT in enhancing electrical conductivity, but does not involve any machine learning or AI methods.

title: Fe3O4 Nanoparticles for Complex Targeted Delivery and Boron Neutron Capture Therapy
summary: This paper presents the modification of Fe3O4 nanoparticles with (3-aminopropyl)-trimethoxysilane and subsequent attachment with carborane borate for potential use in boron neutron capture therapy. The study focuses on the stability, biocompatibility, and toxicity of the modified nanoparticles.

title: Preparation and molten salt corrosion behaviors of TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coatings on the surface of Q235 alloy at 900 °C
summary: This paper investigates the preparation and molten salt corrosion behaviors of TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coatings on the surface of Q235 alloy at 900 °C. The study uses a combination of sol-gel method and plasma surfacing technology to prepare the composite coating, which is then tested for its corrosion resistance in a molten salt environment.

title: Main 3D Manufacturing Techniques for Customized Bone Substitutes. A Systematic Review
summary: This systematic review aims to identify the main methods and materials used in manufacturing customized bone scaffolds through 3D technology. The study focuses on techniques such as SLA, Robocasting, and FDM, which are promising options for customized bone regeneration.

title: Production of nanopowders of bismuth oxide doped with silver by pulsed electron beam evaporation in vacuum
summary: This paper presents an environmentally friendly method for producing Ag-doped Bi2O3 nanoparticles using pulsed electron beam evaporation in vacuum. The study focuses on the synthesis and characterization of these nanoparticles, exploring their textural, thermal, and magnetic properties.

title: Emergence of strong room-temperature ferroelectricity and multiferroicity in 2D-Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ free-standing MXene film
summary: This paper reports the emergence of strong room-temperature ferroelectricity and multiferroicity in 2D-Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ free-standing MXene film. The authors employed a simple synthesis approach to develop ferroelectric and multiferroic 2D materials, specifically in the new class of materials called MXenes.

title: Complexity of Secure Sets
summary: This paper investigates the complexity of secure sets in graphs, a concept that generalizes defensive alliances. The authors provide a precise complexity-theoretic classification of the problem and show that it is P2-complete. They also analyze the parameterized complexity of the problem with treewidth as the parameter and show that it is hard for the class W[1].

title: A LiAlO2/nitrogen-doped hollow carbon spheres (NdHCSs) modified separator for advanced lithium–sulfur batteries
summary: This paper presents a novel double-layer lithium aluminate/nitrogen-doped hollow carbon sphere (LiAlO2/NdHCSs)-modified separator for advanced lithium-sulfur batteries. The LiAlO2/NdHCSs-modified separator shows improved electrochemical performance, with an initial discharge capacity of 1500 mA h g−1 at 0.2C and a discharge capacity of 543.3 mA h g−1 after 500 cycles at 2C.

title: Design of Asymmetric Nanofibers-Membranes Based on Polyvinyl Alcohol and Wool-Keratin for Wound Healing Applications
summary: This paper presents the design of asymmetric nanofibers-membranes based on polyvinyl alcohol and wool-keratin for wound healing applications. The research focuses on developing biomaterials with tunable properties to support all phases of the wound healing process, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: Simulation of Physical and Mechanical Properties to Increase the Strength of the Cutting Ceramics
summary: This paper focuses on simulating physical and mechanical properties to increase the strength of cutting ceramics. The research explores the effects of high-temperature plastic deformation, diffusion, and interatomic bond strength on the material's behavior. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.

title: Understanding Material Removal Mechanism and Effects of Machining Parameters during EDM of Zirconia-Toughened Alumina Ceramic
summary: This paper investigates the material removal mechanism and effects of machining parameters on machining speed and dimensional and profile accuracies of features machined on zirconia toughened alumina (ZTA) ceramics using assistive electrode EDM. The study focuses on the EDM machining of ZTA ceramics, which has potential applications in orthopedic prostheses, cutting tools, and wear-resistant parts.

title: Computer-assisted design/computer-assisted manufacturing systems: A revolution in restorative dentistry
summary: This paper discusses the application of computer-assisted design and manufacturing (CAD/CAM) systems in restorative dentistry, highlighting their ability to produce precise and aesthetically pleasing restorations. The use of CAD/CAM technology is shown to overcome errors associated with traditional ceramo-metal technology.

title: The effect of shale mineral powder on the strength of asphalt concrete
summary: This paper investigates the impact of shale mineral powder on the physical and mechanical properties of asphalt concrete. The authors develop a new technology to obtain shale mineral powder from local raw materials, which improves the strength and durability of asphalt concrete.

title: Simultaneous Enhancement of Mechanical and Magnetic Properties in Extremely-Fine Nanograined Ni-P Alloys
summary: This paper explores the structural effects on both mechanical strength and magnetization of extremely-fine nanograined metals, specifically Ni-P alloys. The authors investigate how annealing affects the properties of these materials, finding that it leads to a significant enhancement of both hardness and magnetization.

title: Sorption of organic compounds by aged polystyrene microplastic particles
summary: This paper presents experimental sorption isotherms of 21 probe sorbates by aged polystyrene microplastics, with data modelled using linear free-energy relationships. The study focuses on the interaction between UV-aged polystyrene microplastics and organic compounds, providing valuable information for predicting sorption.

title: Piezoelectric Properties of PVDF-Zn2GeO4 Fine Fiber Mats
summary: This paper presents the development and characterization of polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF)-Zn2GeO4 fine fiber mats, which show promising piezoelectric properties. The study focuses on synthesizing Zn2GeO4 nanorods and incorporating them into a PVDF matrix using the Forcespinning method.

title: Properties of Poly(3-hydroxybutyrate-co-3-hydroxyvalerate)/Polycaprolactone Polymer Mixtures Reinforced by Cellulose Nanocrystals: Experimental and Simulation Studies
summary: This paper investigates the properties of poly(3-hydroxybutyrate-co-3-hydroxyvalerate)/polycaprolactone (PHBV/PCL) polymer mixtures reinforced by cellulose nanocrystals (CNCs). The study focuses on the morphological, sorption, thermal, and mechanical properties of the obtained composites. No machine learning or AI methods are used in this research.

title: Pearson Equations for Discrete Orthogonal Polynomials: II. Generalized Charlier, Meixner and Hahn of type I cases
summary: This paper focuses on the Cholesky factorization of moment matrices for generalized Charlier, Meixner, and Hahn discrete orthogonal polynomials. The authors derive alternative derivations of Laguerre-Freud relations and find third-order and second-order nonlinear ordinary differential equations for recursion coefficients.

title: The Role of Spin(9) in Octonionic Geometry
summary: This paper reviews the role of Spin(9) in octonionic geometry, discussing its interactions with geometries related to octonions and its applications in various areas. The authors provide a survey of their recent work on Spin(9) and octonionic geometry, including the construction of the canonical 8-form Φ Spin(9) and its analogies with quaternionic geometry.

title: Generalizing Cographs to 2-Cographs
summary: This paper generalizes the concept of cographs to 2-cographs, which are graphs where every connected induced subgraph has a disconnected complement. The authors show that 2-cographs can be recursively defined and are closed under induced minors.

title: Joint impacts of media, vaccination and treatment on an epidemic Filippov model with application to COVID-19
summary: This paper proposes a non-smooth SIR Filippov system to investigate the impacts of media coverage, vaccination, and treatment on the spread of an infectious disease. The model incorporates both the number of infected population and its changing rate as the switching condition for implementing control measures.

title: Factors of Alternating Convolution of the Gessel Numbers
summary: This paper explores the relationship between Gessel numbers and super Catalan numbers, providing a close connection through alternating convolution. The authors use new sums to prove divisibility by  rac{1}{2}S(n,r) for all non-negative integers n and positive integers r.

title: Sequential Bayesian Analysis of Multivariate Count Data
summary: This paper develops a new class of dynamic multivariate Poisson count models, referred to as multivariate Poisson-scaled beta (MPSB) models. The MPSB model allows for serial dependence in the counts as well as dependence across multiple series with a random common environment. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this paper.

title: An all speed second order IMEX relaxation scheme for the Euler equations
summary: This paper presents an implicit-explicit finite volume scheme for the Euler equations, focusing on a Suliciu type relaxation model to simplify the non-linear structure of the equations. The proposed scheme is positivity preserving and asymptotic preserving towards the incompressible Euler equations.

title: Uniqueness in a Navier-Stokes-nonlinear-Schr"odinger model of superfluidity
summary: This paper deals with the problem of uniqueness of local-in-time weak solutions to a model of superfluidity governed by the nonlinear Schrödinger equation (NLS) coupled with the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations (NSE). The authors prove a weak-strong type uniqueness theorem for these weak solutions, showing that a strong solution is unique in the class of weak solutions. This result has implications for the study of superfluidity and the behavior of normal Helium liquid.

title: Efficient methods for the estimation of the multinomial parameter for the two-trait group testing model
summary: This paper presents efficient methods for estimating the multinomial parameter in a two-trait group testing model. The authors show that finding the maximum likelihood estimator (MLE) is equivalent to maximizing a multinomial likelihood with a restricted parameter space, and develop an EM algorithm-based approach to solve this problem. They also present two additional closed-form estimators, one based on the method of moments and another as a shrinkage estimator.

title: OSCILLATIONS AND ASYMPTOTIC CONVERGENCE FOR A DELAY DIFFERENTIAL EQUATION MODELING PLATELET PRODUCTION
summary: This paper analyzes the existence of oscillating solutions and asymptotic convergence for a nonlinear delay differential equation modeling platelet production. The authors propose a new age-structured model of megakaryopoiesis, focusing on the differentiation pathway from hematopoietic stem cells to progenitors to megakaryocytes, including the role of thrombopoietin (TPO). They reduce the model to a scalar nonlinear delay differential equation on the platelet count and prove its unique steady state is locally asymptotically stable. The authors also determine a sufficient and necessary condition for the existence of oscillating solutions.

title: Conformal metrics on $\ßr^{2m}$ with constant Q-curvature
summary: This paper studies conformal metrics on R^{2m} with constant Q-curvature, particularly in the case of negative or zero curvature. The authors provide existence results and asymptotic behavior at infinity for solutions to the equation.

title: Convex and Non-convex Regularization Methods for Spatial Point Processes Intensity Estimation
summary: This paper deals with feature selection procedures for spatial point processes intensity estimation. It proposes regularized versions of estimating equations based on Campbell theorem derived from two classical functions: Poisson likelihood and logistic regression likelihood. The methods are designed to ensure consistency, sparsity, and asymptotic normality.

title: Hybrid Confidence Intervals for Informative Uniform Asymptotic Inference After Model Selection
summary: This paper proposes a new type of confidence interval, called hybrid selective inference (HySI), for correct asymptotic inference after model selection. The HySI approach combines techniques from selective and post-selection inference literatures to yield a short confidence interval across a wide range of data realizations.
statisticalMethods: standard uniform laws of large numbers and central limit theorems (CLTs)

title: An alternative approach on the singular metric on a vector bundle
summary: This paper provides an alternative definition for the singular Hermitian metric on a vector bundle, discussing its applications and properties. The research focuses on complex geometry, specifically the Griffiths and Nakano positivity of the singular metric.

title: Characterization of γ-factors: the Asai case
summary: This paper characterizes Asai γ-factors for smooth irreducible representations of GL_n(E) and establishes their stability property under twists by highly ramified characters. The characterization is achieved through a local-to-global argument, using the Grundwald-Wang theorem and the global Langlands correspondence.

title: Generators and presentations for direct and wreath products of monoid acts
summary: This paper investigates the preservation of properties under direct and wreath products of monoid acts, specifically focusing on finite generation and presentability. The authors provide characterizations for when these properties are preserved in both constructions, with a focus on diagonal acts.

title: Characterizations of Adjoint Sobolev Embedding Operators for Inverse Problems
summary: This paper collects and generalizes various characterizations of the adjoint Sobolev embedding operator E * s, which plays a crucial role in inverse problems. The authors aim to establish a common reference point for researchers and students by providing rigorous mathematical proofs and discussing different approaches to dealing with E * s.

title: Singular spherical maximal operators on a class of degenerate two-step nilpotent Lie groups
summary: This paper proves the boundedness of the singular spherical maximal operator on a class of degenerate two-step nilpotent Lie groups, specifically for d ≥ 4 and p > (d-1)/(d-2). The result is obtained by reducing the estimates to oscillatory integral operators.

title: Liouville theorems to system of elliptic differential inequalities on the Heisenberg group
summary: This paper establishes Liouville theorems for a system of elliptic differential inequalities on the Heisenberg group, with no mention or use of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.

title: A Characterization of One-component Inner Functions
summary: This paper presents a characterization of one-component inner functions in terms of the location of their zeros and associated singular measures. The authors provide descriptions and examples of one-component inner functions, answering several questions posed by J. Cima and R. Mortini.

title: Rough Basin Boundaries in High Dimension: Can We Classify Them Experimentally?
summary: This paper investigates the properties of rough basin boundaries in high-dimensional systems, specifically focusing on their classification and fractal dimension. The authors argue that a known condition for roughness holds for high-dimensional bistable systems with a unique non-attracting chaotic set embedded in their basin boundaries. They provide a formula for the co-dimension of the rough basin boundary and discuss its implications for predictability and global instability.

title: k-Spectra of c-Balanced Words
summary: This paper investigates the properties and cardinalities of k-spectra in binary words, particularly for strictly balanced and c-balanced words. The authors explore various questions related to recognition and reconstruction of scattered factors and k-spectra, providing new results and insights into their structure.

title: Sampling bipartite graphs with given vertex degrees and fixed edges and non-edges
summary: This paper focuses on the problem of sampling a bipartite graph with given vertex degrees, where a set of edges and non-edges is fixed. The authors propose an extension to the Curveball algorithm, which generates approximate samples at random. They show that repeated k-swaps of lengths 4 ≤ k ≤ 2 − 2 are sufficient for ergodic sampling chains.

title: New exact wave solutions to the space-time fractional-coupled Burgers equations and the space-time fractional foam drainage equation
summary: This paper presents new exact wave solutions to the space-time fractional-coupled Burgers equations and the space-time fractional foam drainage equation using the generalized (G′/G)-expansion method. The method is effective in obtaining closed-form solutions for non-linear fractional differential equations, but it does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence techniques.

title: On the computation of torus link homology
summary: This paper introduces a new method for computing triply graded link homology, particularly well-adapted to torus links. The authors provide an exact answer for all n and verify conjectures of Gorsky et al relating homology of torus links with Hilbert schemes.

title: Usefulness of interferon-γ release assay for the diagnosis of sputum smear-negative pulmonary and extra-pulmonary TB in Zhejiang Province, China
summary: This paper investigates the usefulness of interferon-γ release assay (IGRA) for diagnosing smear-negative pulmonary and extra-pulmonary tuberculosis. The study compares the diagnostic performance of IGRA with TB antibody tests in various patient groups, finding that IGRA has a higher sensitivity than TB antibody tests but similar specificity.
statisticalMethods: Student's t-tests, Pearson chi-square and Fisher exact tests were used for statistical analysis

title: Ectopic Relapse of Anti-neutrophil Cytoplasmic Antibody-associated Pituitary Vasculitis with No Elevation of Anti-neutrophil Cytoplasmic Antibodies after Renal Remission
summary: This paper reports a case of vasculitis relapse in the pituitary gland with no ANCA elevation after renal remission. The authors describe the clinical presentation, diagnosis, and treatment of this rare condition, highlighting the importance of considering alternative diagnoses and treatments for patients with GPA-related pituitary involvement.

title: Barriers and Facilitators of Screening for Sexually Transmitted Infections in Adolescent Girls and Young Women in Mombasa, Kenya: A Qualitative Study
summary: This qualitative study explores the barriers and facilitators of screening for sexually transmitted infections (STIs) among adolescent girls and young women in Mombasa, Kenya. The research found that participants were willing to participate in STI screening but faced several barriers, including lack of symptoms, fear of positive test results, parental notification, stigmatization from parents, family members, and the community. The study suggests that addressing these barriers is crucial for improving adolescent girls' participation in research and developing interventions targeted at this population.

title: The Evolving Concept of Cluster Headache: A Historical Perspective
summary: This paper provides a historical perspective on the understanding and treatment of cluster headache, tracing its evolution from ancient times to modern-day approaches. Despite significant advances in medical knowledge, the exact cause of cluster headache remains unknown, with various theories proposed over the centuries, including neuralgia and peripheral nerve involvement.

title: Social Representations of Malaria in a Southern Malian Community: An Ethnographic Qualitative Study
summary: This ethnographic qualitative study examines the social representations of malaria in a southern Malian community. The research focuses on how local people's perceptions, knowledge, and practices regarding malaria affect therapeutic routes. Although machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study, it contributes to understanding the complex dynamics of social representations and their impact on healthcare choices.

title: Multidrug Resistant and Extensively Drug Resistant Bacteria: A Study
summary: This study investigates the incidence of multidrug-resistant (MDR) and extensively drug-resistant (XDR) bacterial isolates in a tertiary care hospital. The research focuses on detecting MDR, XDR, and pandrug-resistant (PDR) bacteria, which poses a major threat to patient treatment due to increased morbidity and mortality, prolonged hospital stay, and economic loss.

title: DUOX2 Variants are a Frequent Cause of Congenital Primary Hypothyroidism in Thai Patients
summary: This study investigates the genetic causes of congenital primary hypothyroidism (CH) in Thai patients. The researchers found that DUOX2 variants are a frequent cause of CH, with 25 out of 118 patients carrying either compound heterozygous or homozygous variants. The most common pathogenic DUOX2 variant was c.1588A>T, which is relatively common in the Thai population.
statisticalMethods: Mann-Whitney U test was used for comparison between two groups of non-normally distributed data.

title: The association of blood urea nitrogen levels upon emergency admission with mortality in acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
summary: This study investigates the relationship between blood urea nitrogen (BUN) levels and mortality in patients with acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (AECOPD). The results show that increased BUN levels are associated with hospital mortality, suggesting that BUN can be used as a prognostic indicator for AECOPD.
statisticalMethods: Receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve analysis, logistic regression models, propensity score matching

title: The role of epithelial-mesenchymal transition in the post-lung transplantation bronchiolitis obliterans
summary: This paper investigates the role of epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in post-lung transplantation bronchiolitis obliterans. The study found that EMT is involved in the process of airway remodeling in BO, providing a potential target for future treatment.
statisticalMethods: Fisher’s Exact test, Spearman’s rank correlation

title: Providing quality end-of-life care to older people in the era of COVID-19: perspectives from five countries
summary: This paper explores the challenges of providing quality end-of-life care to older people during the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors discuss the importance of palliative and hospice care philosophy in alleviating distressing pain and other burdensome symptoms, and ensuring high-quality medico-ethical decision-making based on wishes and preferences.

title: Outbreak of Vancomycin Resistant Enterococcus faecium (VREfm) in a Hematology Unit Identified Through Whole Genome Sequencing
summary: This paper describes an outbreak of Vancomycin Resistant Enterococcus faecium (VREfm) in a hematology unit using Whole Genome Sequencing. The study identifies a cluster of infections with high genetic similarity, suggesting an environmental niche in the hospital unit.

title: Survey of Chiropractic Clinicians on Self-Reported Knowledge and Recognition of Concussion Injuries
summary: This paper surveys chiropractic clinicians' self-reported knowledge and recognition of concussion injuries, finding an overconfidence in MTBI diagnosis despite low knowledge scores. The study highlights the need for further education on MTBI recognition among chiropractors.

title: Transient binocular blindness: A rare presentation of aortic dissection
summary: This paper presents a case study of a patient with aortic dissection who experienced transient binocular blindness. The authors highlight the importance of prompt detection and diagnosis of this life-threatening condition, which can present atypically. Despite its rarity, bedside carotid ultrasonography proved to be a helpful tool in assisting the diagnosis.

title: Cardio-pathogenic variants in unexplained intrauterine fetal death: a retrospective pilot study
summary: This paper investigates the prevalence and spectrum of cardio-pathogenic variants in fetuses with unexplained intrauterine fetal death. The study found that 87.5% of fetuses carried 33 variants in 22 different cardio-specific genes, but no significant clinical differences were evident between fetuses with and without these variants.

title: Prevalence of Intestinal Parasite Infections and Their Associated Factors among Food Handlers Working in Selected Catering Establishments from Bule Hora, Ethiopia
summary: This study investigates the prevalence of intestinal parasitic infections among food handlers in selected catering establishments in Bule Hora Town, Ethiopia. The research found a high prevalence rate of 46.3% and identified factors such as poor personal hygiene, inadequate sanitary facilities, and improper handling and storage of food and utensils as contributing to the spread of disease.

title: Impairment of insulin-stimulated Akt/GLUT4 signaling is associated with cardiac contractile dysfunction and aggravates I/R injury in STZ-diabetic Rats
summary: This study investigates the mechanisms of diabetes that cause cardiac dysfunctions in STZ-diabetic rats with and without myocardial I/R injuries. The research focuses on the role of insulin signaling, specifically Akt/GLUT4 signaling molecules, in cardiac contractile dysfunction and its aggravation of I/R injury.

title: T-Cell Lymphoblastic Lymphoma Arising in the Setting of Myeloid/Lymphoid Neoplasms with Eosinophilia
summary: This paper investigates T-lymphoblastic lymphoma (T-LBL) occurring in the setting of myeloid/lymphoid neoplasms with eosinophilia. The study evaluates the clinical, morphological, immunohistochemical and molecular features of 11 cases and suggests that LMO2 immunostaining may be a useful marker to identify T-LBL developing in this context.

title: Awareness of Therapeutic Benefits of Green Tea among Dental Fraternity
summary: This paper explores the awareness and knowledge of green tea's therapeutic benefits among dental students. The study uses a questionnaire-based survey to assess participants' understanding of green tea's effects on oral health, including its anti-inflammatory properties, ability to reduce bad breath, and potential to cure dental caries, gingivitis, periodontitis, and oral malignancy.

title: HIV Infection: Time from Diagnosis to Initiation of Antiretroviral Therapy in Portugal, a Multicentric Study
summary: This study evaluates the time from HIV diagnosis to antiretroviral therapy (ART) initiation in Portugal, aiming to understand the factors influencing this process. The research focuses on the healthcare system's efficiency and patient associations' support in navigating PLWH through referral and linkage to care.

title: A Scenario-Based Survey of Expert Echocardiography Recommendations for Patients With Staphylococcus aureus Bacteremia at Varying Risk for Endocarditis
summary: This paper presents a scenario-based survey of expert echocardiography recommendations for patients with Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia at varying risk for endocarditis. The study found that experts demonstrate active and precise risk stratification when recommending echocardiography strategies, but disagreement exists as to the appropriate investigation of lower-risk cases.

title: Free-living gait characteristics in ageing and Parkinson’s disease: impact of environment and ambulatory bout length
summary: This study investigates the impact of environment and ambulatory bout length on gait characteristics in people with Parkinson’s disease (PD) and age-matched controls. The researchers used accelerometer-based body worn monitors to collect data in both laboratory and free-living environments, exploring differences between groups and the influence of bout length on gait characteristics.

title: Coronavirus Pandemic Roles and challenges of coordinated public health laboratory response against COVID-19 pandemic in Africa
summary: This paper discusses the roles and challenges of coordinated public health laboratory responses to the COVID-19 pandemic in Africa. It highlights the need for concerted efforts from multiple sectors targeting humans, animals, and the environment, and proposes the adoption of the 'One Health' strategy as an ideal public health intervention.

title: Association of Low Levels of Vitamin D with Chronic Stable Angina: A Prospective Case-Control Study
summary: This study investigates the association between low levels of vitamin D and chronic stable angina in a prospective case-control study. The results show a correlation between vitamin D deficiency and chronic stable angina, suggesting that low levels of vitamin D may be an independent, potentially modifiable cardiovascular risk factor.
statisticalMethods: chi-square test, Student's t-test, likelihood ratio, Levene's test for equality, analysis of variance (ANOVA), Mann-Whitney U test, and Fisher's exact test

title: Treating breast cancer metastasis with cabazitaxel-loaded polymeric micelles
summary: This paper explores the use of cabazitaxel-loaded polymeric micelles (PCMs) to treat breast cancer metastasis. The PCMs are shown to effectively inhibit tumor growth and lung metastases, with a 71.6% inhibition of tumor growth and a 93.5% reduction of lung metastases.

title: Efficacy of a Secondary Trifocal Sulcus IOL in Providing Near and Intermediate Vision in Patients with Prior Myopic Laser Vision Correction and Cataract Surgery
summary: This study evaluates the efficacy of a secondary trifocal sulcus intraocular lens (IOL) in providing near and intermediate vision to patients with prior myopic laser vision correction and cataract surgery. The IOL is designed to address the challenges presented by eyes with previous refractive surgery, offering improved visual outcomes compared to primary monofocal IOLs.

title: Malabsorption and motor dysfunction in patients with small bowel amyloidosis
summary: This paper discusses the relationship between malabsorption, motor dysfunction, and amyloidosis in patients with small bowel involvement. The authors investigate the pathological findings and clinical signs of two cases of nonfamilial amyloidosis, confirming previous findings that amyloidosis can cause intestinal motor dysfunction.

title: An Analysis of Lexical Stress in English Pronunciation of Indo-European Words Loaned to Turkish by Turkish Speakers of English
summary: This study investigates lexical stress placement in English pronunciation of Indo-European words loaned to Turkish by Turkish speakers of English. The research aims to increase awareness of prosodic features and improve learners' communicative competence, particularly in the area of suprasegmental features such as stress patterns.

title: 11th LANE Conference: Photonic Technologies
summary: This paper presents the proceedings of the 11th LANE conference, focusing on photonic technologies. The conference features keynote speakers, plenary discussions, and presentations on laser material processing, E-Mobility, Additive Manufacturing, and social aspects. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not mentioned or used in this paper.

title: SPORT STUDENT TEACHERS’ DISCOURSES ABOUT FEMALE ATHLETES IN MIXED MARTIAL ARTS
summary: This qualitative study examines the discourses of sport student teachers about female athletes in Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). The research aims to understand the constitutive process of MMA and its space in the sports context, as well as the gender relations at stake. The study uses focus groups with undergraduate students in Sport and Physical Education, analyzing their speeches and identifying themes related to MMA, women's participation, and health impact.

title: Finite element simulation of vertical temperature gradients in a standard W40×235 steel beam
summary: This paper presents a finite element analysis to study the vertical temperature gradient in a standard W40×235 steel beam under environmental thermal loads. The research focuses on understanding the distribution of temperatures along with the depth of the beam, and how it affects the structural performance of the bridge.

title: Pixton as a digital teaching tool to encourage the writing skill
summary: This paper explores the use of Pixton, a digital storytelling tool, to enhance students' writing skills in English as a Foreign Language (EFL). The authors argue that traditional teaching methods can be ineffective for EFL learners, and that technology can provide a more engaging and interactive way to learn. Pixton is presented as a valuable resource for teachers to encourage student creativity and motivation.

title: Dark Freeze-out Cogenesis
summary: This paper proposes a new mechanism for generating the observed dark matter abundance and baryon asymmetry, addressing the coincidence between the two. The thermal freeze-out of dark matter annihilating into meta-stable dark partners sets the dark matter relic abundance while providing the out-of-equilibrium condition for baryogenesis.

title: Phase-space wavepacket dynamics of internal conversion via conical intersection: Multi-state quantum Fokker-Planck equation approach
summary: This paper investigates the role of conical intersections in internal conversion processes of photoexcited molecules. The authors employ a multi-state quantum Fokker-Planck equation approach to study wavepacket dynamics on potential energy surfaces, providing a quantitative analysis of the interplay between thermal relaxation and de-excitation dynamics.

title: WIMP search from XMASS-I fiducial volume data with background prediction
summary: This paper presents a WIMP search using the XMASS-I detector, focusing on direct detection of dark matter particles. The research uses background prediction and Monte Carlo simulations to evaluate the presence of Weakly Interacting Massive Particles (WIMPs). However, machine learning or AI methods are not employed in this study.

title: Introduction to Semi-Classical Analysis for Digital Errors of Qubit in Quantum Processor
summary: This paper surveys the progress of modeling quantum noise effects that information theorists may face in the future, focusing on nontrivial errors. It explains a channel error model to represent strange properties of error probability due to new quantum noise and provides specific examples.
